loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 47 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ceferina de 46 años, quien lo apoya en la chacra y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Pedro, es la siembra de papa, choclo, zanahoria, maíz y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, y para ello necesitará comprarse un auto para que pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono e insumos para cuidar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Pedro, 47, is a cheerful, hard working father. He lives in his own house with his wife, Ceferina, 46, who helps him in the fields. What he most wants is to improve his quality of life. Pedro farms potatoes, corn, carrots and peas which he sells in Tarma’s wholesale market when he harvests them. He has regular customers who knowing the quality of his products don’t hesitate to wait for him to buy everything at wholesale. What he likes best about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile and productive. He has been farming for 31 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be safeguarding the fields from insect infestations. In the future he’d like to continue selling his products but needs to buy a car to transport his crops. This is his 9th loan with MFP. He knows that he has to repay on time if he wants to have access to future loans. He is a responsible member of his communal bank who is concerned for his group’s wellbeing. He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy manure and supplies to care for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and supplies to protect his crops from insect infestations.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es:
Idalia García y Eduardo Tapias, su esposo (que aparece en la fotografia y trabaja como empleado en una empresa de Barranquilla) es una pareja que vino con sus 4 hijos desde San Juan Nepomuceno, cuando se radicaron  muy cerca de Barranquilla. En su pueblo natal Idalia  tenia un negocio de vender prendas de oro, y al partir de allí, porque se volvió   difícil la convivencia pacífica, abandonó su negocio y trajo solo $100.000 COP, pero como ya tenía  la experiencia de negocios, no abandonó la convicción de iniciarlo en la nueva población; así fue que invirtió en mercancía y repartió entre varios clientes que le recomendaron  a los que semanalmente visitaba para recoger el dinero producto de sus ventas, que volvía a invertir  y con este trabajo lograba generar  utilidades para ayudar a sostener su hogar. 

Como esto no le alcanzaba para responder a su clientela, se empleó de doméstica es una casa por días   y fue así como reunió dinero para comprar constantemente; cuando obtuvo su capital , aún quedaba mal en responder a los pedidos,  por eso una amiga le recomendó buscar un crédito con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ella accedió,  hizo algunos cursos administrativos, pero a pesar de que le aprobaron su crédito, su esposo como no tenía experiencia en este tipo de financiamiento, le recomendó no retirar el dinero de su cuenta y devolverlo, ella así lo hizo mientras continuaba trabajando con mucha dificultad lo que la obligó a regresar a esta organización,  sin decirle a su cónyuge  y ahora se siente muy contenta porque su negocio ha logrado crecer; antes tenía su mercancía metida en un tanque,  hoy tiene cuatro vitrinas muy bien surtidas en un sector comercial y donde todo el que pasa le compra porque es muy concurrido. Ahora su esposo quien aparece con ella en la fotografía se siente orgulloso de ella y la acompaña en todas las decisiones emprendedoras de Idalia, pues ha logrado demostrar su potencial de crecimiento y gran capacidad de multiplicar su dinero. 

En la actualidad solicita su credikiva para ponerle cielo raso a su negocio que con el apoyo de la fundación,  logró adecuar un local y separar la zona familiar de la productiva y ahora necesita enchaparla para que se vea más vistoso y todos sus clientes no quieran Salir de él de lo cómodo que se encuentran. Idalia dice que nada hubiera sido posible sin la ayuda de Dios, y que a él le pide cumplir su sueño de tener un almacén. Su más grande desafío fue cuando su hija sufrió un accidente y ella la ayudó a salir adelante descapitalizándose un poco, aquí recuerda como la Fundación siempre en estos casos le ha tendido la mano, por eso no se cambia a ninguna institución.
texts.en:
Idalia G. and Eduardo Tapias, her husband (who appears in the photo and works in another business in Barranquilla) are a couple who, between the ages of 24 and 34 years old, came with their four children from San Juan Nepomuceno to a place very near Barranquilla. In their hometown of Idalia, they were selling items made of gold; because it became difficult to live together peacefully, they abandoned their business and brought only $100,000 COP, but since they already had business experience, they did not abandon the will to begin it again in a new place; therefore, they invested in merchandise and distributed it among various customers who recommended them, and they visited them weekly to collect the money from sales, which they again invested, and in this way generated profits to help them afford their home. 

As this was not enough for serving their customers, they began working out of their home by day, and this was how they earned money for constant purchases, when they had the capital, although it was still not enough to fill all the orders. Because of this a friend recommended they seek a loan with Kiva partner Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and Idalia agreed. She took some management classes, but when the Fundacion approved her loan, her husband, who did not have experience with this kind of financing, suggested that she not take the money out of her account and that she return it. Idalia did so, while continuing to work with great difficulty, which drove her to return to this organization without telling her husband, and now she is very pleased because her business has grown. Before, she had her merchandise displayed in a tank; now she has four well stocked display cases in a commercial area where everyone who passes buys because its very popular. Now, her husband, who is in the picture with her, is proud of her and assists her in all the business decisions. She has demonstrated her ability to grow and multiply her money. 

Now she is requesting her loan to put in a ceiling, and, with the help of the Fundacion, adapt the place to separate the family area from the business area. She needs to cover it so it will look nice and so her customers will never want to leave the comfort they find themselves in.  Idalia says that none of this would have been possible without God's help, and she asks Him to help her realize her dream and have a warehouse.  Her biggest challenge was when her daughter had an accident, and she helped her be more successful by selling off a bit, and she remembers how in these sorts of cases the Fundacion always lent her a hand, and because of this she will never go to any other organization.

loans.use: Remodel store

loans.name: Familia Cristiana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Familia Cristiana está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Eremita de Jesús Aragón quien hace mas de 30 años se dedica al comercio de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, joyas etc. 
Ella inicio vendiendo ropa usada con sus ganancias y los préstamos invirtió en otros productos y empezó a desarrollar su negocio. Aragón con el préstamo invertirá en mercadería en ropa y perfumes y con las ganancias espera mejorar su casa.

Los otros integrantes son Rufino Nery Córdoba Navarro hace 10 años inicio con la venta de ropa usada en el mercado oriental en la actualidad gracias a su trabajo arduo y los préstamos él comercializa perfumes y ropa; y Fatima A. de 31 años inicio como sus compañeros con el comercio de ropa usada y una pequeña venta de chiverías en su casa, hoy en día comercializa ropa, zapatos y comida.
texts.en:
The Familia Cristiana (Christian Family) Group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people. One of them is Eremita de Jesús Aragón, who has worked selling clothing, shoes, perfume, and jewelry for more than 30 years.

She began selling used clothing with her earnings and used the loans to buy other products and thus began to grow her business. She will use the loan to buy merchandise like clothing and perfume and with her earnings hopes to improve her home.

Another member is Rufino Nery Córdoba Navarro, who began selling used clothing 10 years ago in the Oriental Market. Thanks to his hard work and the loans he currently sells perfume and clothing. The other group member is 31-year old Fatima A.. She began like her colleagues selling used clothing and food and now sells clothing, shoes, and food.

loans.use: Clothing and perfume

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen Sánchez L. y su esposo tienen un local donde se hace reparación de llantas desde hace 3 años al que desean darle una buena inversión para así generar más ingresos a su familia. El negocio ofrece el servicio de colocación de llantas, aire, parchar etc. La señora es madre de 3 pequeños a quienes quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un buen patrimonio.
texts.en: María Del Carmen Sánchez L. and her husband have had a tire repair shop for three years and would like to make a good investment in it so as to generate more income for their family. The business offers services including tire mounting, air, patches, etc. She is mother to three young children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life and a good inheritance.

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nilda; tiene 35 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio atender un kiosco escolar y también tiene un cafetín en el mercado de Ollantaytambo, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, ella quiere ampliar su negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para el cafetín como carne, gaseosas, pollo y verduras.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO.” The bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Nilda, and she is 35 years old. She has a live-in partner and 4 children. She altenates her daily activities with her business: she works in a school snack kiosk and also has a small café at the Ollantaytambo market. She works from 7:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m., and she would like to expand her business. She is requesting the loan to buy products to prepare for the café, such as meat, chicken, vegetables and soft drinks. 

The borrower appreciates the loan she is requesting, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Buying products to prepare for her café, such as meat, chicken, vegetables and soft drinks

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 47 años, está casada con Luis, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas, pero solo vive con uno de ellas: Jhellica, de 15 años. A la educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace algún tiempo, que Olinda dio un gran paso en la agricultura. En tan solo 2 años se convirtió en una comerciante mayorista, exitosa. No solo de frutas. Las que por cierto, vende muy bien y con buenas ganancias. Si no también en la compra de carne de pescado y de pollo, los cuales vende los días jueves y viernes al por mayor, en las diferentes ciudades del país. Donde el pescado de río, “de la selva peruana”, son muy cotizados. Por todos los logros obtenidos hasta el momento, Olinda está planeando, abrir una tienda de mercadería “grande y muy abastecida”, con la que pueda abastecer la demanda de capital y de las principales ciudades del país. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y, como integrante antigua de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida con el apoyo recibido durante estos años. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar más cantidad de mercadería, que consta de carne de pescado y pollo.
texts.en:
47-year old Olinda is married to Luis who is 46 years old. They have two daughters, but only 15-year old Jhellica lives with them. They are raising her in their own home located in Puente Paucartambo in the central region of the Peruvian rainforest. 

Some time ago Olinda took up farming. In two short years she became a successful wholesale merchant, not only selling fruit (which sells very well and generates good profits), but also fish and chicken. The latter she sells on Thursdays and Fridays in different towns where fish from the rivers of the rainforest are much sought after. 

Because of all her successes to date, Olinda is now planning to open a large, well-stocked store from which to fill orders from the capital and the other main cities. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and as a long-established member of her community bank, she feels grateful for the support received over the years. Once she has received the loan she is seeking, she is thinking of buying more merchandise, specifically fish and chicken.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He is the only provider for his family.

In 2007, Baker opened his own barber shop after having a long experience working in this field. He is becoming well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to advertise and renovate his shop and to buy an air conditioner. He is aiming to grow bigger to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: Advertise and renovate his shop

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.en:
Rosendo A. is from the village of San Andres. He is 45 years old. Rosendo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosendo plants and harvests rice for sale. Rosendo has been engaged in his business for more than 22 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosendo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Rosendo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rosendo is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken by Rosendo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Rosario; ella tiene 28 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche o solo quinua y por las noches vende lonche como cafe, mates entre otros la socia trabaja de forma independiente y ambulatoria, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario is a member of the ”MAMA SIMONA” which is located in Poroy district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria Rosario is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling breakfasts such as quinoa with milk or just quinoa.  In the evenings she also sells drinks such as coffee, matés (infusions) etc.  She works independently as an itinerant street vendor.  Maria Rosario is a very enterprising person who has a great desire to get ahead for her children's sake.

Maria Rosario is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Ma. Salvacion

texts.en:
Ma. Salvacion A. has been an active member of ASHI- ASE since 2006. Ma. Salvacion is 33 years old and comes from District 3, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo A. Jr., an electrician, and she has been a good mother for her three children.

They earn a living through appliance repair, so this is also her project. Her loan from ASHI serves as their business capital. Her loans really help them to continue the project and to provide good and fast service to their clients because they have their own rolling capital entrusted to them by the institution.

Throughout almost 4 years of membership in ASHI, Ma. Salvacion has maintained her good performance as a member and also a leader in their center. She has been chosen as a nominee for outstanding member of the branch and she is one of the members who access bigger loans through ASHI.

As of now, she has successfully paid off her loans through ASHI and she is proposing PHP 25,000 for her next loan. The family dreams of improving their business, so that they will have a bigger income to address the increasing needs of the family and for preparation for the future of their children.

loans.use: Electronic Repair

loans.name: Rumpene

texts.en:
Rumpene O. N. is 28 years old, married and the father of two children. He has been farming for the last six years and earns a good profit. His farm is in a productive area with good climatic conditions, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Rumpene learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to prepare his land for wheat farming. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. Rumpene is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for planting wheat

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng P. lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province.  She is a married woman who was born in 1966. She  is a noodle seller in her local village, where she earns some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Noeun Chea, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support the family. This couple supports three children, who are all clothes sellers, earning small incomes.  

Mrs. Heng P. has a problem because her children’ work place is far away from her home.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Heng P. is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation. Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
La señora Katy es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se desempeña como armador de bote. 
Lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco, tiene un puesto que tiene en el mercado de Yarinacocha.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 tinas de pescado fresco y un motor pequeño,  para utilizarlo para la pesca, de esa manera el pescado pueda llegar directamente, sin los intermediarios.
La señora Katy se dedica a la venta de pescado por las tardes, el resto de tiempo se dedica a la atención de  su hogar y a sus hijos que todavía son pequeños.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha tenido un capital para iniciar su propio negocio y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Katy, 31, is a member of the “Nuevo Edén” (New Eden) communal bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She’s married and has three children; her husband is a boat builder.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She sells fresh fish.  She has a stand in Yarinacocha’s market. She will use her new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy two vats of fresh fish and a small motor to use for fishing so that she can get fish directly and not have to go through middlemen.  Katy sells fish in the afternoon.  The rest of the time she dedicates to her home and to her children who are still small.  

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she’s had capital to start her own business and improve her economy.

loans.use: to buy two vats of fresh fish and a small motor.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badenya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, sous préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de bois de chauffe, de condiments, de parures et de parfums.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
CHITAN D. compte acheter du bois de chauffe avec les charretiers de la ville presque quotidiennement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya solidarity group are all married women. They average 33 years of age and two children each, and they all live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana, sub-prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell firewood, condiments, ornaments and perfumes. They are on their second group loan. 

Chitan D. plans to buy firewood from local carters almost every day. She conducts her sales daily from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to make loan repayments, pay contributions to social ceremonies, and reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Ana Ersidia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 35 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado, además es secretaria vive con su esposo que es ganadero, juntos administran el negocio, pero ella es empleada como secretaria, tienen cinco años D. comercializar ganado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar reces, su objetivo con la compra en aumentar sus reces ir creciendo en el negocio, para luego comercializarlas.
Su objetivo es aumentar cada día más su potencial ganadero, ayudara a su familia y juntos avanzar a una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years of age and resides in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután. She works raising cattle for sale and is also a secretary. She lives with her husband who is a cattle farmer with whom she jointly runs the business although she is employed as a secretary. They have been in the cattle business for five years.

She is seeking a loan to buy cows. Her objective is to increase their number of cattle, thus growing the business, and later sell them. Her goal is to continually increase her capacity as a cattle farmer, help her family, and together rise to better economic circumstances.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 26-year-old woman and lives in the Congo Town area, she's single and has a five year old daughter who is presently in school.

Theresa has been running a beauty parlor for nine years, and she hope to make it well known in the entire country. Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more hair, cosmetics and dryers for her business.

She hopes her living conditions will improve in the near future.

loans.use: purchase more hair, cosmetics, and hair dryers

loans.name: Penina Odera

texts.en:
Peninah Odera is 48 years old and married to George Otieno.  She has two children and has been running her outside catering business for a period of about 10 years with an income of approximately 4,000 Kenya shillings a month.

She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one.  She wants to use the loan to install water pipes in her business premise. 

She hopes to establish a hotel and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To install water pipes at her business premise.

loans.name: La Estancia (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por 10 mujeres y 2 hombres, quienes trabajan a diario en diferentes actividades para mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas muy responsables y amables. Viven por la comunidad de la Estancia que pertenece al Cantón Paute,  este cantón es de  clima templado propicio para la floricultura y producción de frutas como las manzanas y peras. Cuenta con varios lugares turísticos para visitar y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señorita. Jenny vive por el sector de la Estancia, tiene 18 años y es madre de una niña de 10 meses de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres pero de manera independiente.
 
Nuestra socia hace 2 años labora en una plantación de flores de domingo a domingo desde las  7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia. 

Los dos niños de la fotografía son hijos de dos socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Estancia" is made up of 10 women and 2 men. They work every day on different businesses to improve the finances of their homes. They are very responsible and friendly individuals. They live in the community of La Estancia, belonging to the community of Paute. This community is of a temperate climate conducive of flower harvests and the production of fruits, such as apples and pears. There are various tourist locations to visit and the population maintains their culture and traditions.

Jenny lives in the sector of La Estancia. She is 18 years old and she is the mother of a 10-month old baby girl. She lives at home with her parents, although she is independent.

She has been working at a flower plantation for the past 2 years, from Sunday to Sunday, from 7 in the morning until 8 at night. 

This is the first loan she accesses through her communal bank. She was invited to join by her mother. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry to start this new business. 

The children in the photograph are the children of two other members.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jekadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKADI 1 sont toutes mariées et vivent à Kapala, dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, au moins 5 enfants. Le village est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 17 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du pois sucré, (tels avec KIA) ce produit est très  prisé actuellement par des industriels de la région qui  font sa transformation en jus. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leur activité agricole, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Elles sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence de pois, des intrants et des équipements appropriés pour sa production et sa récolte. Ces équipements et intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail et en gros , à divers client.
 KIA compte utiliser personnellement  son prêt  de la façon suivante achat, d’un sac d’urée, de  2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jekadi group are all married and live in Kapala in large traditional families with their children, husbands, parents- and sisters-in-law etc. They are all around 31 years old with an average of 5 children each. The village is the capital of the municipality and is around 17km away from Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali. The members, such as Kia, cultivate sweet-peas; these are highly sought-after by producers in the region who press them for juice. 
In order to generate greater profits from their agricultural activities, the group members have decided to seek assistance from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme this year. They are on their first loan cycle, which will be used to purchase a sufficient quantity of pea seeds, agricultural products and tools required for the pea production and harvesting process. These materials will be purchased from the large market at Sikasso. After harvesting the crops at the end of the season, the products are stocked for a certain amount of time so that they may accrue in value before being sold at the large market of Sikasso for cash and credit sales to a varied customer base. 
Kia aims to use her loan in order to purchase a bag of nitrogen powder, two bags of complex cereals and the rest will be used to pay labour and hoeing costs. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to meet her family's everyday requirements.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and to pay for labour

loans.name: Tariro Group

texts.en:
Tendai (in the middle) is 44 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is divorced with five children ages 12, 15, 18, 21 and 23.  Three of them are currently attending school.

Tendai runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge faced is a lack of working capital. Tendai has requested a loan of $150 to boost her business stock by buying more t-shirts, blouses and warm-type clothing for winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family’s quality of life.

In the future, Tendai plans to have an improved and better functioning business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Насрулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 25 лет. Холост. Имеет среднее образование. Он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр, где он пополняет балансы и продает панели телефонов. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения панели телефонов и сим-карты.
texts.en: Nasrullo lives in Hamadoni. He is 25 years old and single. He has a secondary education. He provides a service. He has a mobile phone shop where he adds minutes to phones and sells cell phone covers.  He has been doing this work for two years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cell phone covers and SIM cards.

loans.use: to buy cell phone covers and SIM cards.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa cooks etew (banku), as it is popularly called by people in the Central Region of Ghana. Her business is situated in the community of Elmina and is five years old. She is married and has 10 children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa takes care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy maize to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, es madre de dos niños de 12 y 07 años con quienes vive junto a su esposo en casa de su hermana. Delia tiene como trabajo la confección de sus propios diseños de ropa en lycra (ropas interiores, pantalones, blusas) de esa manera formó su pequeño pero muy productivo taller en casa de su hermana. Cuenta que hace tiempo ella era trabajadora de una señor que distribuía en un centro comercial llamado “El Huequito de la Ciudad”, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que ella también podría realizar sus propios diseños ya que es muy buena en lo que hace, eso se refleja cuando vende todos los días. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que su dinero esta en movimiento y eso genera ingresos diarios. Además de disponer de su tiempo, esta muy contenta con los créditos obtenidos en MFP por que dice que son muy bajos en cuanto al interés. Le gustaría mas adelante poder tener un taller mas amplio y poder contratar a alguna persona que le pueda ayudar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos para implementar su taller con maquinas como remalladoras y de coser. En esta oportunidad ella quisiera comprar una maquina y materiales para seguir con la  confección de prendas intimas.
texts.en: Delia is 28 years old.  She is a hard working and very responsible woman who is the mother of two children, ages 12 and 7 years old.  They live together with her husband in her sister's house.  Delia's work is designing and making her own clothing out of Lycra (undergarments, pants, blouses).  She has started a small but very productive workshop in her sister's house.  She tell us that some time ago she worked for a man who was a distributor in a commercial center called “El Huequito de la Ciudad” (The Little Hollow in the City).  However, over time she realized that she could make her own designs, as she is very good at what she does.  This is reflected in her daily sales.  What she likes most about her work is the money flow, which generates income every day.  In addition, she has time at her disposal.  Delia is very happy with the loans she has gotten from MFP because she says that they have a very low interest rate. Delia would like, in the future, to have a bigger workshop and to contract another worker.  This is Delia's second loan with MFP.  She is awaiting more support to be able to set up her workshop with sewing machines and sergers.  With this loan, Delia would like to purchase a sewing machine and materials so she can continue making undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and Lycra.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is single with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (an orphan). Hadjah sells cassava chips, chapatti, samosas and pancakes .She has been in business for the last six years. Hadjah sells her products to the market. She works seven days a week. Hadjah has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil for frying cassava chips, baking flour for chapatti and cowpeas. The main business challenge is the change in seasonality and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children and to set up a retail shop. Hadjah lives in a rented house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, baking flour and cowpeas

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou, 31 years old, lives in Prey Chor District in Kompong Charm province in Cambodia. She is married and has three lovely children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Thou is a farmer who earns approximately $2 a day. She works hard to support her family. Her husband is a construction worker in the village where he earns about $3 a day.

Aside from these jobs, Thou and her husband would like to raise a cow but lack the money to do so. Thou is requesting a $600 loan from HKL to purchase a cow for the purpose of increasing her income.

Thou hopes that this loan will bring happiness to her family. In the future she wishes to send all of her children to study at the university.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business which forms her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, tiene la edad 37 de años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposo e hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal y así obtener de el los mejores resultados. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto y en producción y lo que pretende es darle una mejora y así cosechar mayor cantidad de café. Ella quiere generar las mayores ganancias para su bienestar familiar y ayudarle a su esposo con las obligaciones. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gloria, who is 37 years old, is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and children. With this loan she plans to buy the supplies to support her coffee plantation and thus obtain better results from it. She has suitable land that is in production and what she wants is to give it some improvements and thus harvest a greater quantity of coffee. She wants to generate better earnings for the well-being of her family and to help her husband with their obligations. This will be the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve her coffee plantation

loans.name: Michael Elizabeth

texts.es: Michael Elizabeth tiene 27 años, su actividad es brinda el servicio de costura. Su negocio consiste en la reparación de prendas de vestir y además en la elaboración de prendas que sus clientes le realizan. Ella inicio esta actividad por su hija que tenía que proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios como alimento, vestimenta y educación. Para ella ha sido muy difícil continuar con esta actividad pues hay mucha competencia en el mercado pero no ofrecen el mismo servicio que Michael. El crédito es para la compra de hilos, telas, tijeras, bordados, cintas, decoraciones para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en: Michael Elizabeth is 27 years old and her business is providing sewing services. Her business consists of repairing articles of clothing and she also produces clothing that her clients request. She started out this business because she needed to support her daughter. She needed to provide her with her basic needs, such as food, clothing, and education. It has been very difficult for her to keep up her business, especially because there is so much competition in the market - although no one offers the same service as Michael. The loan is to purchase thread, fabrics, scissors, appliqués, ribbons, and decorations to produce articles of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabrics, scissors, appliqués, ribbons, and decorations to produce articles of clothing.

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bungilila, leader du groupe d’affaire «Tosheka », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 43  ans, mariée, mère de 9 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un pasteur évangéliste dans une église pentecôtiste. Elle est  vendeuse d’habits friperie dans un marché communal de Katindo. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir   son 12eme crédit auprès de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir à compléter les fonds (montants en banque) d’achat parcelle (projet encours d’exécution par sa famille). En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes  exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Bungilila, one of our clients and leader of the "Tosheka" business group, is a 43-year-old entrepreneur and a married mother of nine young children.  Her husband is an evangelist pastor in a Pentecostal church.  She sells secondhand clothing in a Katindo communal market.  For five years now, she has been working these small, income-generating activities.  At the same time, she has just taken out her 12th loan with the MFI Hekima.  This new loan should help her to round out her financing (amounts in the bank) to purchase a parcel of land (her family’s project that is currently underway).  In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and also expand her business.  This client would like to thank Hekima for its work on behalf of poor women who don’t have access to conventional banks.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of land

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya, 60 years old and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are married and have families of their own. Despite her senior age, Ligaya still wants to continue doing business as it keeps her busy and is a good use of her time. 

Ligaya sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes. She buys a variety of clothes, displays them in her store, and sometimes sells directly to her clients. She buys clothes of different designs and sizes at wholesale and then sells them at retail prices that allow her to earn a better profit. She also sells processed foods like hotdogs, bacon, and chicken as an additional source of income. She earns 800 PHP in daily sales.

She is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP that will help her to have additional capital. She will utilize the loan to buy a variety of ready-to-wear clothes and processed meats. The Christmas season is coming, and the demand for clothes and processed meat is high during this season. She wants to be ready for the orders that are about to come.  

Ligaya wants to improve her business and be more successful. She wants to extend help to her grandchildren who are now studying. Ligaya hopes that all of them will finish their studies. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows her to learn more about the life of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of clothes and processed meats

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn, 35, is married and has one child. 

He started planting cassava ten years ago. To better support his family, he also buys soy beans and resells them to the market to generate additional income.
 
Phorn has been with VisionFund since 2009. He completely repaid his previous loans to VisionFund. Now he is applying for a third loan. He wants to buy soy beans to sell to the market and also plant cassava. 

With this loan, he hopes to increase his soy bean stock and his cassava crop. This will enable him to generate more income to feed his family and build some savings for the future.

loans.use: to plant cassava and buy soy beans for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Muugano B Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Muungano B group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Moses takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have additional maize profits and to educate his kids. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest four bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Muungano B group will each plant maize plots of between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Mark. He is married, and has four children aged two, five, eight, and twelve. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help one of his brothers send his children to school. In 1996, Mark established his used clothing business. He began his business by helping his late brother and now owns his own business. Mark sells different types of men’s trousers and shirts. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Mark has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now needs a new loan to buy bales of used trousers for SLL 1,600,000, used shirts for SLL 1,100,000, and coats for SLL 1,500,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Mark plans to open another used clothing stall that his brother, who has come from the village, will operate, and to make sure his children are well cared for. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used men's trousers.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi, 28, is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 50,000, Bibi wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Ma. Elna

texts.en:
Ma. Elna is 36 years old with 3 children aged 11, 7 and 5. She sells prepaid mobile credits to her community. Ma. Elna also makes calamay, a sticky rice dish, to sell. She works hard to support her family.

Ma. Elna has requested this loan to buy more prepaid mobile credit to sell. Ma. Elna hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid mobile credit to sell

loans.name: Lidia Zoila

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lidia, tiene 47 años de edad, hace tiempo su esposo falleció y no tuvo hijos, ahora ella vive con sus padres que ya están ancianos.

Ella para ganar el sustento diario y con ello ayudar a sus padres  se dedica al comercio, compra y vende de  adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, las artesanías las compra a artesanos de la zona pero sin terminar  ya que así le sale más barato, luego ella los pinta y les da el toque final para venderlas a sus clientes a muy buen precio. Lleva más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, este negocio lo empezó con su difunto esposo y ahora trabaja sola con la ayuda de sus padres cuando pueden.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía, pinturas, pinceles y laca para darles el acabado correcto. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezaron su negocio. 

us sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank for Future of the Woman meets every fifteen days in the town of La Pila in Montecristi. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture, and you can find a wide variety of crafts there made by the inhabitants according to traditional customs.

Here we met Lidia. She is 47 years old, her husband passed away a long time ago, and they had no children. Now she lives with her parents, who are elderly.

To earn her daily living - and with it help out her parents - she does sales, buying and selling ornaments and ceramics. She has a space in her house where she sells all kinds of crafts and she works every day from 8am to 5pm. She buys the crafts from artisans of the area, unfinished though, since they are cheaper that way. Later she paints them and gives them the final touches to sell them to her clients at a very good price. She has been doing this work for 10 years and it has gone very well. She started the business with her deceased husband and now she works alone, with the help of her parents when they are able.

This loan is to purchase more crafts, paint, brushes and lacquer to give them the proper finish. She has been with the Communal Bank for over 10 years and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans.

Her dreams are to move forward with her business and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy crafts, paints, brushes and lacquer.

loans.name: Lorena Pilar

texts.es:
Lorena  tiene 26 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Se dedica de manera especial a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos los compra y los vende en la ciudad de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, líquido mata monte, ranger. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. El sueño es comprarse una casa y terrenos para sembrar más y aumentar los ingresos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cocinar toda clase de comidas para el esposo.
texts.en:
Lorena is 26 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. She has three children. 

The solidarity group Unidos Somos Más is located in the area of Marañon, in Puerto Pechiche parish, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of this group work in short cycle farming. They grow corn, rice, and beans. 

Lorena has worked especially growing corn, rice and beans for the past two years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase farm supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The support provided by this loan will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the changing climate. 

Her dream is to have her own house. 

She likes to cook all types of food.

loans.use: la comprar de insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, líquido mata monte, ranger

loans.name: Dagbegnikin Group

texts.fr: DAGBEGNIKIN est un groupement de composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la sixième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 59 ans. Philomène est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, dont deux à sa charge. Philomène vit seule et assure toutes seules les diverses charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Philomène vend des boissons et des liqueurs depuis trente ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face à ces besoins. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un dépôt de sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe DAGBEGNIKIN, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons et des liqueurs.

loans.name: Silome

texts.en: This loan helps Silome get connected to his local prepay microgrid. Silome is a 56-year-old father of 7, 8 going to school. He is a farmer and lives in a small house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, and to finally get rid of his dirty, costly kerosene lamp. Mainly, he is looking forward to being connected as it will allow him to save money - Silome and his family will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first prepay microgrid

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian started his construction company, Heartwood Industries, in 2004 in order to pursue a longtime passion and provide for his family. He supports his wife and five children, using the skills he learned from his own father. He "finds peace in building homes for people" and his business ranges from small carpentry jobs to complete home re-models. This loan will be used to hire an additional employee and stabilize his business.

loans.use: to hire additional employees for his construction company.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
My name is Marta T. and I sell new clothing for men and women, in my business I sell pants, blouses, T-shirts, skirts, socks and children's clothing also. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in my home. My husband helps tend to the business when he returns from work. The clientel is varied and also very good, because I tend to them personally and my prices are easily accesible to everyone. My business generates earnings to support my family and my home; my goal is to increase sales and to improve my business (home), to feed my family and the support the studies of my son.

Loan Use: Purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts, skirts, socks, pocketbooks, hairpins.

Mi nombre es Marta T., me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva de dama y caballero en mi negocio se venden pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, fajas, calsonetas y ropa de niño, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años y esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, mi esposo me ayuda a atender el negocio cuando el regresa de su trabajo, la clientela es variada y muy buena ya que los atiendo personalmente y los precios de venta son accesibles a la comunidad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder mantener mi familia y mi hogar, mi meta es poder incrementar mi ventas y asi poder acondicionar mejor mi negocio (casa), la alimentacion de mi familia y el estudio de mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, fajas, casonetas, bolsas, ganchos

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en: Talaitupu, 48, married, hails from a village of crab fishers. They have a special art of catching crabs and this is why their business is successful. It is also because their backyard is where they do all the fishing. This woman is familiar with the times of high and low tide and can predict when it is the right time to take out the nets to catch big or small crabs, selling to locals and other businesses in town. Crabs are a delicacy that is most loved by tourists and families from overseas.

loans.use: To purchase additional crab catching equipment

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan E. owns and operates a clothing shop in the town of Devechi’s bazaar. Devechi is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Subhan is applying for funding so that he can expand his inventory to include more seasonal clothing. Summer is approaching quickly and the styles of clothing that the public wears are becoming more modern. He wants to ensure that he will have the product that his customers are looking for.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn married in 1993 and has 3 children. She has been farming for a long time. However, after getting married she also started selling fruit in order to generate extra income for the family. She began that business in 1995. Her husband farms with her and and also works as a barber out of their home.

Thoeurn has already taken and repaid one loan from MAXIMA. Now she is asking for a second loan in the amount of US$ 300. She plans to use the money to pay to have her rice fields plowed and to purchase seed. Thoeurn feels sure she will be able to pay back the loan without any problems.

loans.use: Pay to have her rice fields plowed and purchase seed

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 42 year-old mother of three children, residing in the Vituka area. She is a tailor and specializes in making couch set dressings as well as curtains. She prepares many of them, then sells them as a vendor in the nearby trading center.

She has been doing this business for the past seven years, and wishes to expand it. She plans to do this by purchasing a larger space to run the business and to also buy another tailoring machine. She is in need of USD 350 to help expand her business.

loans.use: To further expand business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod D. was born in 1970; he has a family with three children. Currently, he sells house wares. But this is not his only source of income. Being the sole bread winner in his family, Dilshod also raises crops and re-sells cattle. Dilshod would like to get a loan to expand his house wares business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Дадабоев Дилшод 1970 года рождения, отец троих детей. В настоящее время он торгует галантерей и хозяйственными товарами. Но это его не настоящий источник дохода, так как он является единственным кормильцем семьи и что бы прокормить семью , он также занимается сельхозкультурой и перепродает скот.

loans.use: To expand the house wares business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a diligent mother of two small children. Six years ago she began selling jackets which she brought from the city of Desaguadero (on the border with Bolivia) and she sells them in the San José market in her city, Juliaca.

She began offering small items of clothing, but as she was becoming more known and experienced she decided to include jackets. Thanks to the novelty, variety of colors, styles, and above all the economic prices at which she offers her merchandise to the general public, she is experiencing high demand. Therefore she wants a loan, which will be well-invested in Yolanda’s hands, enabling her to grow her business and above all offer well-being and security to her children who are the driving force of her daily work.

With your help she will be able to make her plans reality quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda, es una diligente madre de dos pequeños niños. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de casacas, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Desaguadero ( Frontera con Bolivia) y las vende en el mercado San José de su ciudad natal, Juliaca.

Ella empezó ofreciendo pequeñas prendas de vestir, pero conforme fue adquiriendo mayor conocimiento y experiencia decidió incursionar en la venta de casacas, gracias a las novedades, variedad de colores, modelos y sobre todo a los precios económicos con los que oferta su mercadería a la población en general, está obteniendo gran demanda, por eso desea obtener un préstamo de dinero que será muy bien invertido en las manos de Yolanda, permitiéndole así crecer en su negocio y sobre todo ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hijos quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo día a día.

Con tu desinteresado apoyo podrá concretar sus planes en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio has a small company which provides curtain installation, as well as carpet installation in offices and private homes. He has three children who attend school and his wife works as well. They live in the zone called Las Nieves in the city of La Paz. This is the 10th loan from Impro, and it will be used to purchase materials for his business. His business qualifies him to receive this credit, and his experience shows he will generate enough income to repay the loan.

Julio tiene una pequeña microempresa dedicada a realiza trabajos de instalación de cortinas y rieles, también recibe contratos para el colocado de alfombras y tapiz en oficinas y domicilio particulares. Tiene tres hijas en edad escolar y su esposa es comerciante. Vive en la zona de Las Nieves ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Hilo y rieles) Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el mismo, lo cual le permite la obtención de ingresos como para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL FOR HIS CURTAIN AND RUG BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en: Rumen V. and his wife retired five years ago, and shortly thereafter began farming.  They own 60 acres of land in the village of Pavelsko, near Smolian, Bulgaria, on which they grow potatoes. Rumen is applying for a loan of $775 (1,000 BGN) to buy potatoes seeds and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: To buy potatoes seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Mansurova

texts.ru:
M. Mansurova who is 42 years old, is married and has four children. She has secondary education and is in the retail business of selling threads for sewing. She has more than nineteen years of experience in this field.

She became a client of Microinvest in 2006 with $800 in assets. This program has allowed her to purchase inventory in cash which has increased her sales and of course her profits. In the future, M. plans to start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мансурова Мавлюда – 42 года, замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Образование среднее, занимается торговлей нитями для шитья. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 19 лет.

Стала клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест в 2006-ом году с активами на 800 долларов. Продукт программы позволил ей приобрести товар за наличные что способствует увеличению товарооборота и конечно же дохода. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: To start selling wholesale

loans.name: Rahma's Kopa Ulipe Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 31 years old and is married. Rahma sells clothes. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaisha, Saana, Mwanahawa and Mwanaid, who sell clothes, charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
The business of the sale of empanadas and beautiful woven clothing bring solace to Celia and her adorable children, for whom she works hard and wishes to offer them the necessary tools so they can achieve success in the future. Celia works every day of the week in her business selling delicious empanadas and while she offers her appetizing snack she loses no time weaving with her agile and talented hands beautiful hats, shawls and gloves which she sells wholesale in the Leguna Temporal market of the city of Juliaca. Thanks to her perseverance and dedication since she became both father and mother of her 4 dear children she has the satisfaction of offering them stability and above all education.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de venta de salteñas y bellos tejidos de prendas de vestir le viene generando tranquilidad a doña Celia y a sus adorables hijos, por quienes se esfuerza y desea brindarles las herramientas necesarias para que en el futuro puedan alcanzar el éxito.Celia, se dedica durante todos los días de la semana a su negocio de venta de deliciosas salteñas, mientras ofrece su apetitoso bocado para no perder tiempo se dedica a tejer con sus ágiles y talentosas manos hermosas gorras, chalinas y guantes que vende al por mayor en el mercado Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a su constancia y dedicación desde que se convirtió en padre y madre de sus 4 queridos hijos tiene la satisfacción de ofrecerles tranquilidad y sobre todo educación

loans.use: Increase in capital to be able to continue offering her beautiful weavings

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon P., 44 years old, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Pa Saroeun, and six children. She raises pigs at her home, making US$7 each day, while her husband works as a farmer in the fields, earning US$5 per day. The family is also supported by two of their children who work in the local garment factory. Mrs. P. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a small tractor for her husband in order to help him plow his land. Moreover, it is common for Cambodians to rent out their tractors to make extra income. Through this investment, Chhuon P. believes that her family’s daily income can be increased and her standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: Purchase small tractor

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Ms. Alberta A. has had her business for about 10 years, and she runs it alone, since her husband works as a contractor and travels a lot. The couple has five children of whom two are already married and live in their own places, the rest still live with their parents since they are still young.

Ms. Alberta asked for a loan to be able to increase the variety of merchandise at her business, especially the butcher shop. The merchandise she will acquire is: cold cuts, sausage, pate, ham, etc. and distinct types of meat like loin, chicken, pork, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alberta A. tiene su despensa hace aproximadamente 10 años, ella lo maneja sola pues su marido trabaja como contratista de obras (albañil) y viaja mucho. El matrimonio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados y viven en sus propios hogares, los demás aún viven con la pareja pues son menores aún.

La señora Alberta solicitó el crédito para poder ampliar la variedad de mercaderías del negocio, especialmente la carnicería. Las mercaderías a adquirir son: fiambre, chorizo, paté, jamón, etc. y distintos tipos de carnes como carnaza, puchero, lomo, pollo, cerdo, etc.

loans.use: Buying more meat to sell

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
Leovina is a member of the Mujeres Productivas (Productive Women) Communal Bank, situated in Walter MzB Street Lt. 35 in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 30 years of age and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, Leovina decided to invest in the sale of fruit.

Currently, she sells prepared meals in a factory, and she is starting her grocery store business and needs a kiosk to place her products.

With this loan of S/ 1,500, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase provisions (such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, preserves and other items) to sell in her grocery store as well as to use for the dishes in her menu.

Leovina is thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement for the opportunity of receiving a loan that will enable her to increase the sale of her prepared meals. Her main objective is to have a kiosk so that she may expand her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Leovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Productivas, ubicado en Calle Walter MzB Lt.35, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es obrero, Leovina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de fruta.

En la actualidad ella vende comida en una fabrica como también esta iniciando en la venta de abarrotes ya que le hace falta su kiosco para que pueda colocar sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad (como arroz, azúcar, fideos leche, conservas, leche y otros) tanto para que venda como para que prepare su venta de menú.

Leovina, esta agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de facilitarle un crédito para que de alguna pueda incrementar en su venta de comida y su mayor objetivo es poder tener un kiosco y así poder agrandar su bodega.

loans.use: Purchase provisions (such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, preserves and other items) to sell in her grocery store as well as to use for the dishes in her menu.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna P., 45, has been selling a variety of groceries in the in Tlock Dangkor Market since 2003. She typically earns around US$5 per day. She lives in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province with her husband and their eight children, one of whom is married and all of whom are students. Her husband, Mr. Thy Rin, 46, is a farmer who grows rice for a living. 

To increase family's income, Vanna want to improve her business, but she lacks capital. Hence, she would like to request a loan of $1,100 USD. With the loan, she will increase her grocery inventory, buy piglets to raise, buy pig food, and buy fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, piglets, pig food, and fertilizer.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo San Isidro, estamos ubicados en la comunidad el Tablon, municipio de Danli, somos personas que ya dias nos conocemos y cada uno tiene su propio negocio. nosotros somos muy unidos y nos queremos mucho, creo que esa es una ventaja de nuestro grupo.

Nos indentificamos de esta manera:
Santos S.: soy el coordinador del grupo mi principal actividad es la de comercio, tengo una pulperia en donde vendo productos de consumo popular, mi pulperia se llama los Tres Nardos, esta ubicada frente a un campo de futbol, mi esposa me ayuda con mi negocio, gracias a Dios nuestro negocio va creciendo.
Gabriela R.: ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos, actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante, desde hace tres años que se dedica a su negocio, ella tiene una hija que esta estudiando, con las ganancias que tiene en su negocio le ayuda a su compañero de hogar a cubrir con los gastos y especialmente a la crianza de su hija.
Danubia M.: ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y ciertos productos de la canasta basica, actividad que ella realiza hace varios años, sus clientes potenciales son los empleados de la fabrica de rosquillas TITOS, ya que su negocio se encuentra en frente de dicha fabrica, su demanda es mucha en estos momentos.
Nancy V.: ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, su especialidad es la venta de nacatamales y pastelitos, ella tiene varios años de realizar dicha actividad, los clientes potenciales de ella son tambien los empleados de la fabrica de rosquillas TITOS, ya que todos los dias lleva su pruducto completo y ahi lo vende todo.  
En la actulidad todos nosotros no contamos con un capital de trabajo suficiente paqra surtir mas nuestros negocios y satisfacer las demandas de nuestros clientes, razon por la cual estamos solicitando credito para salir adelante con nuestros negocios y familias.
texts.en:
Hellow. We are the San Isidro group,a nd we are located in the community of Tablon, municipality of Danli. We are people who met a few days ago and each has his or her own business. We are very united and we like each other a lot. I think that his is an advantage of our group.

We identify ourselves as follows:

Santos S.: I am the coordinator of the group and my main activity is trade. I have a general store in which I sell popular groceries. My store is called Tres Nardos, and is located in front of a soccer stadium. My wife helps me with the business. Thank God the business is growing.

Gabriela R.: she is dedicated to the sale of new clothes and cosmetics, an activity which she does from home and travelling. For three years she has been dedicated to her business. She has a daughter who is studying. With her earnings from the business, she helps her partner to cover their expenses, especially raising their daughter.

Danubia M. is dedicated to selling tidbits and certain products for basic crates, an activity which she has done for a few years. Her potential clients are the employees at the doughnut factory TITOS. Now that her business can be found in front of said factory, her demand is very high these days.

Nancy V.: she is dedicated to the sale of tibits, Her specialty is the sale of nacatameles and small pastries. She has a few years of doing this activity. Her potential customers are the TITOS doughnut factory employees, since every day she takes her completed product there and sells them all.

Actually, all of us can't count on sufficient capital to support our businesses and satisfy the demands of our customers, which is the reason we are asking for a loan to move forward with our businesses and our families.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise and materials

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Groupb

texts.en: Juliet M. is the leader of Balitwegomba women’s group in Jinja.  "Balitwegomba" means "they will admire us," and in this case, these ladies hard work with their business skills and management, and the sky is the limit for their prosperity.  Juliet is a humble lady with a retail shop that she has owned for over 3 years now.  This is her second loan with the group, and her aim is to transform her shop into a more profitable one by using the loan to buy more products for the shop for increased profitability.  Juliet is married with 5 children, as she cares for 2 orphaned children belonging to her late brother.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge tiene la de edad de 44 años, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos de 2, 8 y 12 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian y en sus tiempo libre la mayor ayuda a sus padres. Los planes en el ámbito familiar es que sus hijos se preparen y verlos con futuro mejor Don Jorge tiene su profesión de panadero y trabaja vendiendo desde hace seis años. A futuro es obtener su propio negocio de panadería para brindarles a los clientes sus productos de calidad y ricos panes variados Gracia a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra invertir en equipo de panadería como: horno, batidora entre otros. Para comenzar a trabajar en su propio negocio
texts.en:
Señor Jorge is 44 years old, a resident of the neighborhood Laureles Sur in the capital of Managua. He is married to his wife who is a homemaker. He has three children of 2, 8 and 12 years of age; two study, and the oldest supports her parents in her free time. His family plan is that his children will be prepared and see a better future. Don Jorge is a baker and has worked for six years. In the future, he wishes to obtain his own baking business to provide customers with quality products and a rich variety of breads. Thanks to loans from Afrodenic, he will fulfill his investment in bakery equipment such as an oven, blender, among others to begin working on his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a blender, oven, and others to make bread

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeun S. is a farmer in Vath Khdey village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She cultivates both rice and vegetables. She is 55 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory. Because their workplace is far from home, they usually spend a lot of money on transportation.
