Mrs. Phoeun S. wants to buy a motorbike for her children Thus, she asked for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike and she hopes to reduce the family's expenses with this solution. Her husband, Mr. Keo Deourn, helps his wife on the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Fidenciano Candelario

texts.es:
Fidenciano es socio del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Fidenciano es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Fidenciano junto a su esposa se dedican a la venta de helados de manera ambulatoria en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Fidenciano vende ropa en las ferias de la región.
Fidenciano necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados, chompas, casacas.
Los sueños de Fidenciano son tener un puesto estable en uno de los mercados de la ciudad y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fidenciano is a member of the Community Bank Minka, a Quechua Word for “Help”. Fidenciano lives with his wife. He is 40 years old and has a son. He and his wife sell ice cream on the streets of the city of Ayacucho. He also sells clothes at the local fairs. Fidenciano needs a loan of 1400 soles, which he will use to purchase ice cream, sweaters and jerseys. Fidenciano’s dream is to have a fixed location for him business at one of the city markets

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ice cream, sweaters and jerseys

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael T. H. es Casado, en su casa vive el su esposa y un nieto el cual están a cargo. La hija del señor falleció de un derrame cerebral por lo que el niño quedo huérfano, Eduardo su nieto  de 13 años el acaba de entrar al primer año de secundaria y el señor Rafael se preocupa mucho por el bienestar de su familia por eso poco a poco le ha ido  haciendo mejoras a su casa, la planta baja ya esta terminada solo le falta la parte alta y nos solicita un préstamo para iniciar su proyecto.
El es chofer de una empresa de la ciudad y su esposa ser dedica al hogar al cuidado de su nieto.
texts.en:
Rafael T. H. is married and lives with his wife and a grandson for whom they care. Rafael’s daughter died from a brain hemorrhage, which left the grandson an orphan. Eduardo, his grandson, is just 13 years old and starting in his first year of secondary school. Rafael worries a great deal about the well-being of his family which is the reason why, little by little, he has undertaken making improvements to his house. The lower level is now completed, leaving only the top floor to finish and he requests a loan from us to start on this project. He is a driver at one of the city’s enterprises, and his wife takes care of the home and their grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for construction materials and labor.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier d’adjinamoto non loin d’adidogomé, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois , ce commerce est très rentable à lomé, elle vend à ses clients en gros et en détail, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1994, ce qui lui permet d’aider des fois son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle voudrait rehausser son stock qui s’épuise, elle demande alors un crédit à wages pour l’achat de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Adjinamoto neighborhood, not far from from Adidogomé. She's married and the mother of five children. Her business consists in selling charcoal, a very profitable business in Lomé. Since 1994, she's been selling retail and wholesale to her customers, which, at times, enables her help her husband with the household expenses. She would like to bolster her stock which is running low, and so she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES in order to purchase sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Biré

texts.fr: Monsieur potou Biré est un commerçant qui réside dans le quartier d’Akodessewa, il a pour activité principale la vente de pièces à détachées de moulin qu’il exerce dans une boutique qu’il a appelé « Frank Basi Agric », il a commencé ce commerce en 2007. Ce commerce lui réussit bien car très peu de gens l’exercent, beaucoup de détenteurs de moulin  viennent acheter les pièces pour réparer leur moulin chez lui. Le stock de marchandises dont il dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de répondre à sa clientèle, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 01 moteur Gx160, 03 dents n°1 et n°2, 02 moulin à piment et des dynamos électriques
texts.en:
Mr. Potou Biré is a merchant who resides in the Akodessewa district. His main work involves selling spare parts for mills. He operates this business in a shop he calls “Frank Basi Agric”. He started up in 2007. This commerce is doing well for him because few people work in it. Many mill owners come to buy parts from him to repair their mills. The stock of merchandise he has currently doesn’t allow him to respond to his customers. He’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a Gx160 motor, three No. 1 and No. 2 dents, two mills for chili pepper, and some electric generators.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for mills

loans.name: Oyetunji

texts.en: Oyetunji B. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30, 000 to purchase more salon materials to make her customers hair. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more salon materials

loans.name: Komlan Mathias

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’appareils électroménagers en détail, il a commencé ce commerce en 2006, il exerce cette activité dans sa boutique  qu’il a appelé « RIVER TECH ». Il veut agrandir son stock par l'achat de 15 téléviseur LG écran 14 et 10 Antennes. Il est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu issu de son commerce qu’il subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who earns an income from retail commerce in home appliances. He started this business in 2006 and works out of his shop he calls “RIVER TECH”. He wants to expand his inventory by buying fifteen LG televisions with 14” screens and ten antennae. He is unmarried, and with the revenues from his business, he supports himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy televisions and antennae

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is fifty years old. She is a wife and the mother of one child. Mary is a resourceful mother and successful businesswoman. She works hard to support her child in school.

Mary sells matches, combs, soap and small items, but she doesn't have enough working capital to expand her business. She believes that, with this loan, she will have more resources to supply her customers with available, quality stock. She hopes to earn a good income to support her family. She also want to add the sale of sachet water. She belongs to the community group called the Thank You Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase matches, combs, soaps and small items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa R. vive en un pequeño cantón ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Rosa tiene 46 años de edad,  se dedica a su negocio que es la crianza de pollos para después comercializarlos, aparte de ello Rosa cultiva maíz y maicillo también para vender,  estas son las principales fuentes de ingresos para Rosa y su familia, Ahora ella solicita este crédito para capital de trabajo en la compra de granos para su siembra de maíz y maicillo que le ayudara a aumentar su inventario al igual que sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa R. lives in a small home located in the Ahuachapán department. She is 46 years old, and works raising chickens which she sells. Rosa also grows corn to sell. These activities generate the principal income sources for Rosa and her family. She now asks for a loan to provide her with working capital to purchase grains and seeds, which will help her expand her inventory and her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains and seeds.

loans.name: Irma Martha

texts.es:
La señora Irma Martha tiene  51 años D. edad vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria , tiene 5 hijos y solo 1 depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Irma D. dedica a  la venta D. productos D. belleza como: colonias, perfumes, talcos, cremas, etc., D. las marcas Unique, Esika y Avon.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compró mas productos D. belleza lo cual le permitió aumentar su stock y vender con mayor facilidad

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,200, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. ropa para caballeros, damas y niño. Así como en la compra D. productos D. belleza.
Irma tiene como sueño tener un stand D. ropa y productos D. belleza en el mercado.
texts.en:
Martha is 51 years old, lives in Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. The businesswoman has completed 5th year of secondary school, has 5 children, and only 1 is economically dependent upon her. Today Martha sells beauty products such as: cologne, perfume, powders, creams, etc. from manufacturers such as Unique, Esika and Avon. With her first loan for 300 soles she bought beauty products which enabled her to increase her stock and sell more easily. With this loan for S./1200 soles, she will invest in her business, buying clothing for men, women and children as well as beauty products. Martha dreams of having a clothing and beauty product stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for men, women and children as well as beauty products.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with one daughter. She sells clothing at the central market in the city of Kherson. She has been in this business for 12 years. Irina is very persistent, disciplined and creative. All these character traits help her to succeed in her business. Irina's kiosk is located at a good spot at the market and she always has many customers.

Irina would like to borrow 15,222 UAH to increase her assortment of clothing for sale. She works hard to develop her business. Irina's goal is to be a successful and independent person, able to provide for her family and help others as well.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of clothing for sale

loans.name: Saa Gbein Group

texts.en:
Kumba has 3 children, all in 10th grade. Kumba sells food from her little market from whence she has been able to support all of her children. She has been able to keep them in school up to this level, and plans to continue until they have all finished.  She herself has never been to school.

She wants to expand her business to provide for her children's education and medical care. She encourages her customers by means of good conversation and has been doing so for the past 15 years.

loans.use: To buy food staples for resale

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
N. Bakhtiyor is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Bakhtiyor has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Bakhtiyor harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By these, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work. Bakhtiyor requests 5000 Somoni for purchasing young cattle. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well being and security to the members of his family.        


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 47 years old. Aida is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida sells fruit in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Den

texts.en: Den S. is 54 years old and runs a motor-taxi in the Battambang province. His business has been around for about four years and he makes US$4 every day, while his wife sells vegetables and earns US$3 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Den S. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to expand his wife’s business.

loans.use: To sell vegetables.

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.en:
D. Zarifjon is 36 years old. He is married with four children. Zarifjon is running the private small café where he cooks and sells the kebab. Five years ago Zarifjon started as the assistant cooking the kebab. Gradually he became so experienced in this that decided to open his own small café which is working already for two years. Zarifjon is planning to expand his café. Thus he need to increase the inventory, in other words to purchase coal and refrigerator for expanding his business. For all this Zarifjon requests $600 US Dollars. This is the first loan of Zarifjon. However, having the stable business he would like to ensure all that he is able to pay in time and to thank everyone for support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding of business and purchasing of inventory like coal and refrigerator

loans.name: Joseph Kaguru

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old and married with two children. He has been keeping chickens for about 12 years now and sells broilers (chickens for meat) to his customers in Kikuyu town, Limuru and at the Nderi shopping center.  

He formed his borrower group. He has never borrowed from another MFI and plans to use the loan to expand his chicken pen and buy more chickens for sale. He hopes to raise, and, one day supply, chickens in large quantities of over 2,000 (right now he supplies 200).

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more chicken (for meat) and expand his chicken pen

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Katushabe Harriet Group

texts.en: K. Harriet, 30,  is married with two school-age children. She has a used clothing business which she has been operating for over 10 years. She needs additional capital for her business in order to purchase more stock of used clothing from the Owino market in Kampala. She is an industrious business woman whose plan is to work hard for a good future for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more stock of used clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and has been a widow for many years. She has three children aged 14, 16 and 18 and she also takes care of one dependent from another family. Florence lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali.

Florence has owned a business selling soft drinks, snacks and milk for the past four years and employs three people in her business. The store is open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Florence is a proven entrepreneur. She repaid her first loan in full and on time and now she is requesting her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that she may keep growing her business. She plans to add some new goods such as juice, cakes and other delectable food supplies.

With this loan, if her plan is successful, Florence will save the additional profit and reinvest it in her business. Also, she will save a portion for her family's future in order to be more financially stable and to live less worried about money all the time.

loans.use: To add goods such as juice, cakes and other delicious foods

loans.name: Mbogo Bakyara Tweyombekye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
R. Alfred is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is 71 years old and married with 8 children while taking care of 4 dependents. Alfred is a farmer from Kigusha cell with farming experience of 29 years and at the moment, he is able to make 200,000/= as profit every month.

Alfred is a loyal person especially to his customers and in future, he would like to have a larger farm as well as educating his children to the highest level, God willing. Alfred needs a loan of 1 million shillings to be able to modernize his farm by buying farm inputs for improved output. Alfred is a determined and hard-working man.

loans.use: Modernising his farm by buying farm inputs

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona M. tiene 38 años de edad, esta en pareja, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.
La Sra. Ramona posee una despensa hace mas de 9 años de antigüedad en su domicilio, se inicio comprando a créditos las mercaderías y luego con la ayuda de su cónyuge juntaron unos ahorros para su capital propio. 
La despensa es atendida por toda la familia y la clientela la forman todos los vecinos del barrio el cual es un numero importante. Ramona comenta que mediante este negocio nunca pasamos necesidades y que su deseo era ampliar y mantenerla y por ello solicita el  crédito,  para la compra de mercaderías tales como: azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona M. is 38 years old. She has a partner and 2 school-aged children. Mrs. Ramona has had a grocery store for more than 9 years in her home. She started buying the merchandise on credit. Later, with the help of her partner, they put together some savings for her own capital. The store is attended to by the whole family and the customers are all neighbors from the neighborhood which is an important number. Ramona commented that with this business, we never suffer hardships and her wish was to expand and maintain the business. For this reason, she is requesting the loan, for the purchase of merchandise like: sugar, yerba (mate), drinks in general, baked goods and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of merchandise like: sugar, yerba (mate), drinks in general, baked goods and other things

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis E. vive casa de sus padres en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene la profesión de mecánico dental; realiza y refacciona placas dentales. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material para su taller de mecánica dental y también para poder abrir un punto viva en su domicilio y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.

Es el octavo crédito en IMPRO; su historial de pagos es  muy bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luis E. lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of the city of La Paz. He is a dental technician, and he makes and repairs dental plates. The loan he is requesting is to buy material for his dental technician workshop. Also, it is to be able to open a call center in his home. This way he will increase his income. This is his eighth loan with Impro. His payment history is very good, and he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make dental plates for his dental technician workshop

loans.name: Rhubie  C.

texts.en:
Rhubie C. R. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Rhubie C. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rhubie C. owns & operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Rhubie C. has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Rhubie C. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhubie  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. Rhubie  C. is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Rhubie  C. from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mrs. Phin Dim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan involves twenty-two people, all of whom live in Prachum Angk village, in Kandal province. All the group members are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

Mrs. Phin D. is her village bank president; she has been selected by all the members, who will use their loans for different purposes. She is a beautician in her village, while her husband, Mr. Thea S., is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. Phin D. is a mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school. This family has a problem because they do not have enough beauty supplies for Phin D.’s business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some beauty supplies.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Sonnie K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Group.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are 6, 11 and 19 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.
For 25 years, Sonnie has been selling clothes at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She says she sells good quality clothes, which keeps customers returning.  
Sonnie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her goal is to expand her business to have additional locations and to improve her living conditions.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sonnie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo M. es Agricultor y ganadero con 18 años de experiencia en los créditos que ha tramitado con anterioridad los ha cancelado sin ninguna dificultad los cuales los ha utilizado para siembra, compra de un tractor agrícola, mejoramiento de la vivienda y la finca, compra de ganado.

Actualmente lo utilizara para alquilar 4 manzanas de tierra para la siembra de arroz y mantenimiento del tractor.  
El Sr. M. ha tenido 8 créditos con la Institución y a la vez dice estar muy agradecido con Ceprodel por todo el apoyo que le han brindado siempre.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo M. is a farmer and rancher with 18 years of experience. He has paid off his previous loans without any difficulty, and invested them in sowing crops, buying a tractor, improving his home and farm, and purchasing livestock. He will use the present loan to rent several acres of land for growing rice, and to repair his tractor. Mr. M. has received eight loans from this institution and says he's very grateful to Ceprodel for the support they've always given him.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a parcel of land and repair his tractor

loans.name: Anetou

texts.fr: A 40 ans, cette femme dispose encore de beaucoup d’énergie, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente en détail de Jus de fruits, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes dont 70% représente des écoliers et des lycéens. L’avantage pour elle est qu’elle exerce son commerce à proximité d’une école. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis l’année 2000, pour faire les jus, elle va s’approvisionner en fruits au grand marché de Lomé. Le congélateur dont elle se sert pour exercer son commerce est vieux et en panne, elle souhaite acheter un autre congélateur raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter un congélateur et s’approvisionner en fruits.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, this woman still deploys much energy in her revenue-generating activity, which is the retail sales of fruit juice. Her customers are varied but 70 % consist of schoolchildren and students. She has an advantage in that she conducts her business close by a school. She has been doing this since 2000, and gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. The freezer she uses for her business is old and needs repairs, which is why she is requesting a first loan from WAGES, to buy a freezer and resupply with fruit.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer and fruit

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth
texts.en: Ana Ruth

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of them are currently in school. Jane has been practicing dairy farming for the last 20 years in Central Kenya near Murang'a town. She sells her milk to the local market. She also earns some income from a retail shop she operates in the same area. 

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 52,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will enable her to educate her two children and cater for the family's needs. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough money to purchase a good dairy cow and the unstable market prices for milk. She intends to improve on her dairy farming by acquiring four more dairy cows in future.

She says that "through Juhudi Kilimo there is hope that small scale farmers like herself will be able to develop."

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yeni Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yeni de 29 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 niños, Rosita de 10 años y Alejandro de 3 añitos.  Yeni trabaja para el MINED de la Escuela San Patricio como maestra de primaria  desde hace 7 años.  

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el proposito de mejorar su casa cambiando el techo de su cocina ya que el zinc y la madera se encuentran en mal estado.  

Tiene alto espiritu de superacion pues actualmente esta estudiando en la universidad el 1er año de Licenciatura en Pedagogia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos vivan en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Yeni is 29 years old, single and has two children, Rosita, 10 and Alejandro 3, For the past 7 years, Yeni has worked for the MINED (Ministry of Education) at the San Patricio school as a grade school teacher. This 4th loan that she is requesting is to make improvements to her house and change the roof of the kitchen, as the zinc and wood is in poor condition. She has the drive to suceed and is currently studying her first year of a degree program in Education at the university. Her greatest dream is to be able to have a nice house so that her children can live in a comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional second-hand goods to sell

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en:
Marmie R. is from the village of Mayor's Village, Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Marmie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marmie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport like motorcab services. Marmie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marmie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marmie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marmie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marmie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo.
Karina es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año, Karina viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana en donde vende ropa variada, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años. Su prestamo sera invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.
Karina sueña con que su hijo sea un profesional exitoso y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means Growing in Quechau. What she likes the most is the simplicity of the loan. Karina is in a common-law marriage, and she has a one year old child. Karina travels to the regional fairs three times a week. That is where she sells varied articles of clothing. She gets her products in Lima. She started her business three years ago. Her loan will be used to buy pants and polo-type shirts. Karina dreams of her son being a successful professional and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and polo-type shirts

loans.name: Jonh

texts.en: Mr. Jonh P. is a villager from Prey Sandaek village, Takeo province. He was born in 1960 and is the father of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Jonh and his wife, Mrs. Srey Mom Tun, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. Jonh is also a musician. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore, Mr. Jonh P. is asking for a loan to buy speakers to rent out for parties.

loans.use: To buy speakers to rent out for parties

loans.name: Geroncio Ecuador

texts.es:
Geroncio de 51 años, el es vendedor de utensilios de cocina, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Hace años atrás el era taxista pero en una tarde lo secuestraron con su taxi y dejo esta actividad debido a la inseguridad, comenzó a vender utensilios de cocina para poder mantener a su familia,  por ahora trabaja con dos personas mas que lo ayudan en las ventas, trabaja desde las 08h30 hasta las 13h00pm. Vende ollas, sartenes, platos etc. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar ollas, platos para su negocio, en el futuro el quiere tener un local para vender mejor su mercadería.
texts.en:
Geroncio is 51 years old and sells kitchenware for a living. He lives in El Guasmo in Guayaquil (a section of the city where the majority of the residents are informal merchants). Years ago he was a taxi driver, but one afternoon he was kidnapped along with his taxi so he quit this job because it wasn't safe. He started to sell kitchenware to support his family and now he works with two other people that help him with sales. He works from 8:30 in the morning until 1:00 in the afternoon. He sells pots,pans, dishes, etc. With this loan he wants to buy pots and dishes for his business. In the future he would like to have a store to better sell his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware to sell

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: LAS POSITIVAS

Jorge Luis G., tiene 31 años, casado, asume el cargo de presidente en la Alcancía, en la que conforman 07 integrantes, y todos ellos se dedican al comercio minorista.
Jorge desempeña su labor como obrero en la fábrica de calzados ATLAS (Ex BATA), lleva trabajando 03 años en horarios rotativos. Además también es microempresario  en “Chocolatería Artesanal”, este negocio empezó con la idea de su esposa, quien es ella quien se especializó en “Chocolatería Fina”, se dedican a la preparación de bombones surtidos, chocotejas, turrones y todo realizados para eventos especiales como cumpleaños, 15 años, matrimonios, bautizos, aniversarios o eventos.
 se debe a ese esfuerzo y voluntad de ambos que ellos lograron comprar sus cosas para su casita y utensilios para la preparación de chocolates.  

Esta pareja de esposos desean más adelante perfeccionar sus conocimientos e ir incrementando su economía. Como también abrir un stand de negocios en Chosica y ofrecer todo lo que es artesanía a base de chocolates.

Ahora con el crédito que EDAPROSPO le concedió, lo invertirá  cierta cantidad para la compra de implementos de negocio (moldes para chocolates, envolturas, y otros insumos) para chocolates; y el resto de dinero lo utilizará en los gastos y cuidados del parto de su esposa que lleva 08 meses de embarazo.
texts.en:
Group name: Positive People Jorge Luis G. is 31 years old, he is married and he assumes the role of community bank president. The group is made up of 7 members and they are all small business owners. Jorge is a clerk at a shoe manufacturing company, Atlas and Bata. He has been working there for three years on a rotating schedule. He is also the owner of a small business named "Artisan Chocolates". He started this business following his wife's idea to have a specialized, fine chocolate store. They make specialized assorted candies, chocolate bars, and nougats. They are all made for special occasions, such as Sweet 16 parties, weddings, baptisms, anniversaries and other special events. It is their combined efforts that have yielded these results and they are now able to purchase items for their small home, including equipment for their chocolate store. This married couple want to perfect their skills and keep improving their finances. They would like to set up a stand in Chosica, the local fine chocolate district. The loan requested from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will be invested in the purchase of implements for their business (chocolate molds, wrappings, and other materials) for the production of their chocolates. The rest of the funds will be put towards the health care and delivery of the new baby. His wife is 8 months pregnant.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase implements to be used for chocolate making.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora Luz Maria D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, esta comunidad se encuentra a 45 min  de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Nuestra socia tiene de 40 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos de 21, 20, 16, 13, 8, 7 5 y 1 año de edad, su primera y tercera de sus hijas se dedican a trabajar y son quienes ayudan a la economía de la casa, su segunda hija ayuda al trabajo de la casa al igual que su cuarto hijo, sus hijos de 8, 7 y 5 años estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo trabaja en el área de la construcción ya que es maestro albañil y gracias al trabajo conyugal y a las habilidades de su esposo como albañil hace poco tiempo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Luz se dedica a la elaboración de sogas hace 10 años ya que su mamá le ha enseñado esta labor desde muy pequeña, como pasa en la casa también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes  que los vende en su comunidad o también son para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Este es el quinto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, los anteriores le han beneficiado en la construcción de su casa, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra piola para la elaboración de sus sogas.
 
Su meta es  terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta muchos detalles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Maria D. is a member of the Vegaspamba communal bank. She lives in Vegaspamba which is located 45 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Its residents raise farm animals and are farmers. She is 40 years old, married and has 8 children who are 21, 20, 16, 13, 8, 7, 5 and 1 year of age. Her first and third daughters work and help support the household. Her second daughter as well as her fourth son help with housework. The 8, 7 and 5 year-olds go the local school. Her husband works in constrution since he’s a master bricklayer. Thanks to the couple’s work and her husband’s skills as a bricklayer they managed to build their own house a short while ago. Luz has made ropes for the past 10 years. Her mother taught her how when she was still a little girl. Since she spends her time at home, she also raises chickens and guinea pigs that she sells in her community or that are consumed in the home. This is the 5th loan she’s had in the communal bank. The previous ones were used to build the house. The new loan will be to buy cords that will be used to make the ropes. Her goal is to finish building her house because it still needs a few finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cord for rope making.

loans.name: Chito

texts.en:
Chito D. C. is from the town of Banga. He is 41 years old. Chito is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Chito works hard to improve his harvest in order to earn more. 

Chito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and his living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Chito is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 30 años, es un hombre honesto y trabajador, convive con Yohana, de 30años, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores; a los que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa de centro Pumpuriani). Desde hace 7 años que se dedica a la agricultura, todas las mañanas de levanta muy temprano, para ayudar a los operarios que contrata constantemente para limpiar sus plantaciones de plátano, yuca y café; ya que sin ellos no podría limpiar y mantener, sus más de 3 hectáreas de cultivo. Lo que más le gusta a Wilmer es poder ver los frutos crecer, fuertes y nutritivos; ya que el constante quillo (maleza que crece entre los sembríos), afecta su producción y no le permite crecer; por ello tiene que estar todo él día cuidándolos, así asegurará, la rentabilidad de su sembrío, sin embargo Wilmer está trabajando muy duro para poder tener productos de calidad, y de esa manera adquirir mayor ganancia; para construir una casa más segura y confortable para su familia. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está muy agradecida, con el apoyo que en todo esté tiempo recibió, asegurando, que sin su banco comunal, no podría lograr los cambios que obtuvo. Wilmer, tiene pensado comprar con el crédito que solicita, abono orgánico (abono natural); para sus plantaciones, como también invertirá en el salario de los peones que contrató.
texts.en:
Wilmer, age 30, is an honest and hard-working man.  He lives with 30 year old Yohana and their four minor children.  They are raising the children in their own house, which is located in the Peruvian jungle (a native community in the center of Pumpuriani).  

He has been farming for seven years.  He gets up early every morning in order to help the workers that he regularly hires clear the weeds from his banana, yucca, and coffee fields.  Without the workers he would not be able to clear and maintain his fields, which are over three hectares.  

What Wilmer likes the most is being able to see the fruits grow strong and nutritious.  The weeds that grow among his plants affect production and do not allow the plants to grow.  Therefore, he has to take care of them all day in order to assure that his crops are profitable.

Wilmer is working very hard to be able to have quality products.  That is the way he will get greater income in order to build a more secure and comfortable house for his family.

This is his fifth loan with MFP.  He is very grateful for the help he has received during all of this time.  Without his communal bank he would not be able to make the changes that he has made.  Wilmer plans to use the loan he has requested to buy organic fertilizer (natural fertilizer) for his plants.  He will also use the loan to pay the workers that he hires.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to pay laborers

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: El señor Gualberto C. López tiene 45 años casados con la Señora Mauricia Ledezma García más de  18 años, tienen 3 hijos menores dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, en la escuela rural de la comunidad, actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, arveja, cebolla, haba y maíz en su terreno de 1.5 hectáreas en la comunidad de Ucuchi, es una familia humilde de pocos recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 26 km de la ciudad de Cbba para ellos  acudir a los bancos para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.  Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Donde Don Gualberto C. López necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico, semilla de papa para la siembra de este año, don Gualberto nos comenta que la producción agrícola en este año ha sido poco por factores climáticos como la sequia, si este año no siembra no tendría alimentación ni dinero tampoco ahorro para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Gualberto is 45 years old, has been married to Mauricia for more than 18 years, and has 3 children who are minors and who are at the community primary school. His main business activity is agriculture, and he grows potatoes, oats, onions, beans, and corn on his 1.5 hectares of land in the community of Ucuchi. His is a humble family of few financial resources, but they are very hardworking. They live 26 km from the city of Cochabamba. For them, going to a bank to get a loan is very difficult. He took the initiative to go to this rural area. Gualberto needed money to buy organic fertilizer and seed potatoes for this year's sowing. Gualberto told us that the agricultural production this year has been low because of climatic factors such as drought. If he doesn't sow crops this year he will not have food or money saved-up to look after his family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and seeds. Operating capital.

loans.name: Las Iguanas (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la calle 26 De Septiembre de la ciudad de Portoviejo en un sector conocido como la calle de las iguanas por encontrarse muchos de estos animalitos en ese lugar y que son protegidos por los habitantes de ese lugar, encontR. el Banco Comunal Las Iguanas los mismas que se reúnen cada quince días.  
Este es un grupo de personas que a pesar de que este es su primer ciclo es muy unido y  sus socias muy amistosas. Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades, tales como: (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,).

Aquí encontR. a la señora Ana Cristina,  ella tiene 20 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado una hermosa bebe de 5 meses, ella estudia el quinto semestre de Ing. Civil en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí. Su marido trabaja en un taller de aluminio y vidrio.

Se dedica al comercio vende productos de Avon, Sayce y lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas). Trabaja todos los días de tres a cuatro horas diarias de acuerdo a lo que tenga que hacer ya que acomoda su horario de estudio y de trabajo, además de dedicarle tiempo a su pequeña bebe la cual deja al cuidado de su mamá cuando realiza sus labores, tiene en este negocio ya dos años y dice que le ha ido bien, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos ya que tiene varios pedidos y en especial comprar productos de oferta los mismos que luego vende al precio normal lo que representa mejores ganancias. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y poder ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
We come upon the Las Iguanas Communal Bank on 26 De Septiembre Street in the city of Portoviejo. The area around the bank is known as “Calle de las Iguanas” because so many of these little animals are found in the area and protected by the area’s inhabitants. Bank members meet every fifteen days.
Even though this is their first loan cycle, this group of people is very united and its members very friendly. The members work in different activities, including: (business, sales, production and services).

Among them is Mrs. Ana Cristina. She is 20 years old. She is in a common-law marriage that has produced a beautiful 5-month-old baby. She is in her fifth semester studying Civil Engineering at the Technical University of Manabí. Her husband works in an aluminum and glass workshop.

Ana Cristina works in business, selling Avon, Sayce and Iebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies’ accessories). She works three to four hours every day depending on what she has to do. She accomodates her school and work schedule while also saving time for her little baby. She leaves her baby in the care of her mother while she does her work. Ana Cristina has been in this business for two years now; she says it has gone well for her. She gives her products on credit and collects payment every fifteen days.

This loan is for buying products because she has several requests. She especially wants to buy products on sale, which she will then sell at the normal price, making a greater profit. Her dreams are to finish her studies and to be able to work in her profession.

loans.use: Buy beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and beauty accessories.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, de 49 años, está casada, con Julio, de 51 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos: Gerson, de 14, Ursula, de 12 y Jordan, de 10 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Rita, es la agricultura, ahí todas las mañanas junto a su esposo Julio, se dirigen a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y yuca. Los que constantemente aplican abono y cuidan, ya que, lo que más le gusta a Rita, es verlos crecer y desarrollarse satisfactoriamente; recompensa que después de cada cosecha, recibe agradecidamente en sus ganancias. Sus principales compradores son de la misma zona, ya que en los 20 años de experiencia obtuvo buenos intermediarios, que conocen de la calidad de granos que produce Rita. Razón por la cual está pensando, mejorar su producción para obtener más ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y agradece la oportunidad que le ofreció su banco comunal, donde está segura que saldrá adelante. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
49-year old Rita is married to Julio who is 51 years old. They have nine children, but only three still live with them: Gerson aged 14, Ursula aged 12, and Jordan aged 10. The family lives in their own house located in the community of Sanchirio in the rainforest of central Peru.

Rita earns her living through farming. Every morning she and her husband Julio set off to work in their coffee, banana, and yucca fields. 
They apply fertilizer on a regular basis as well as care for the crops. Rita’s greatest pleasure is seeing the crops grow and develop satisfactorily, then being rewarded by a good harvest, and finally gratefully receiving the income from the produce.

Her main customers are from the same area where she lives, as in her 20 years of experience she has developed good contacts who know the quality of her products. For this reason she is thinking of improving production to obtain more income. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity offered by her community bank to better her prospects. Rita is planning to use the money to buy several bags of fertilizer to spread on the coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Tanutsu Women Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tanutsu Women” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fanta S.. Fanta is age thirty-seven; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Fanta is a businesswoman who sells cloths. She has been in the business of buying and selling for six years now. With her share of this loan, she will, as usual travel to neighboring Guinea where she will buy bales of lace cloths and wax cloths to sell in Makeni.

loans.use: Purchase lace and wax cloths for sale

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 46-year-old hardworking married man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family, and his mission is to educate his children up to university. 

He cuts people's grass for a living and has been in this business for five years now.  Michael needs the money to buy a machine for cutting grass. His business plan is to own at least three grass-cutting machines.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for cutting grass

loans.name: Osmar Guadalupe

texts.es: Osmar de 29 años de edad es soltero, tiene 6 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza; esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa para asi de esta manera poder brindarle  mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su mayor sueño es poder seguir mejorando su casita para poder darle a su familia mayores comodidades.
texts.en: Osmar, 29, is single and for the past 6 years has worked as a cleaning man for the mayor's office of Juigalpa.  He is requesting his second loan to build a room in his house so that he can give his family better living standards.  His biggest dream is to be able to improve his little house and offer his family greater comfort.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a member of Kibera Upendo group in Faulu Kenya.  For twelve years, he has been making bangles in Kibera slums.  Charles is a married man with six children hence he works hard to provide for his family.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to get capital for his business.  

He hopes to become a major supplier of his products in the future.   He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy brass wire and bench massing.

loans.use: To buy brass wire and bench massing

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 45 years old and cares for two of her relatives who are 5 and 6 years old. Christine has a well-organized store that sells useful daily groceries such as flour, cooking oil, tomato paste and dried fish.  She has plenty of experience having owned her store for 16 years.  She employs one other person to help with the running of the store.

Christine is planning to use her loan to purchase sugar, flour and rice to sell.  She will use the profits to pay for school fees for the two relatives she cares for on her own.  She hopes that her business will allow her to satisfy the needs of those she cares for.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Mrs. Mey Sokhom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eight people who live in Kansaom Ak village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their families. Mrs. Mey S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She faces some obstacles because her field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. To improve rice production, Mrs. Mey S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. Her husband, Mr. Sokoeun Long, is a fisherman. They are supporting two children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Josefina; La socia tiene 65 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos (todos ellos independientes), la socia tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado central D. Urubamba, ella venD. chicha D. maíz, la socia también venD. en su casa los días sábados y domingos por la tarD., la socia nos comenta que ella hace esto para no aburrirse, y que sus hijos le apoyan; la socia comenta que con el crédito que ella saca del banco comunal mediante este medio, la socia pueD. invertir en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite, maíz, entre otros y que con lo que le rinD. ella pueD. pagar sus cuotas mensuales y también sus hijos le dan, La socia desea seguir con su negocio hasta dónD. la fuerza le sea posible D. llevar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, maíz.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefina is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 65 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are independent. Josefina has a vending stall at the central market in Urubamba where she sells “chicha D. maiz” (a beverage maD. from corn). She also sells from her home on Saturday and Sunday afternoons. Josefina says she works to keep from getting bored and that her children help her. Upon receiving her loan from the Communal Bank, she says she will invest in the purchase of corn, rice, oil, corn, and other products. As a result, she will earn enough to cover her monthly payments and also give some money to her children. Josefina wants to continue her business as long as she has the strength to make it possible. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and corn.

Josefina is happy with the loan being provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase  rice, sugar, noodles, and corn.

loans.name: Sinenjengo Group

texts.en:
Zibuyisile is 28 years old and married with one child, who is 7 years old. She also cares for two relatives. 

She runs a tuck shop in Nkandla in Kwa Z. Natal, South Africa. (Tuck shops are small corner stores where you can buy food, drink and other basics.) In the photo she is wearing a blue shirt and raising her hand.

She's been in this business for one and a half years and sells chips, drinks, and chicken pieces at her home. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy drinks, chicken pieces, and flour for making fat cookies. (Fat cookies are a kind of cake made from fried flour.) She hopes that the extra income from this loan will help her live a better life and build a house. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow in such a way that she can add more stock.

In her comments she adds that she does not have a shelter to sell her stock. She would like to know if WDB and Kiva can help her build her own shelter because now she is selling on the streets.

loans.use: to buy drink, chicken, and flour for making fat cookies

loans.name: Cherry Lymer

texts.en:
Cherry Lymer T. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Cherry Lymer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Lymer owns & operates a computer games & videoke services business to local community members. Cherry Lymer has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherry Lymer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Lymer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. 

Cherry Lymer is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & utilities needed to provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cherry Lymer from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed to provide service.

loans.name: Berenika

texts.en: Beremika K. is 37 years old and is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She will use her loan to stock more vegetables. She is a widow with eight children, but only two are not in school. Her future goal is to develop her business.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 18 Juillet 1967 à Bamako, Mariam S. est une femme mariée, mère de six enfants. Elle réside avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
   N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette dame s’est initiée aux activités de commerce d’achat et de vente de pagne wax et des tissus brodés, il y a plus de dix ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses articles.
   Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant environ trois ans et avec laquelle institution, elle est à son troisième prêt. Ce présent prêt est ainsi  sollicité pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes UNIWAX, 4 complets de tissus brodés, 6 pièces de pagne wax et 4 complets de bazin moins riche à Bamako et Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
   Elle dispose d’une place au niveau de marché de leur quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit.
   Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on July 18, 1967 in Bamako, Mariam S. is married and the mother of six. She lives with her husband, her husband’s second wife and their children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Not having had the opportunity to  go to school, for social reasons, she started working as a reseller of traditional colorful “pagne wax”  fabrics as well as embroidered  cloth about ten years ago. She is very sought after by her customers (mainly women) because of the high quality of her wares.

With the goal of better meeting the growing customer demand, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about three years ago and is now on her third loan with this institution. The present loan is requested to purchase 10 sets of the UNIWAX brand “pagnes” fabric, four sets of embroidered fabric, six sets of “pagne wax” and four sets of damask-type “basin” fabric of mid-range quality in Bamako and Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso).

She has a stall at the local market, where she sells her wares for cash and on credit.With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 150,000 West African Francs, which will be used essentially to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget, and pay off the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional African fabrics (embroidered, "pagne wax" and damask-type "bazins")

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio, from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon, is 66 years old and married. To make a living, Sergio has been raising pigs to sell for over six years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sergio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell, he is requesting his seventh loan for 23000 PHP to purchase medication for his livestock. Sergio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase medication for his livestock.

loans.name: Venant

texts.en: Venant is 42 years old and is married with seven children, who are between 2 and 15 years old. He sells boutique items (sugar, salt, rice, maize, etc.) He has 12 years of experience and he employs one person to help him. He works from 6 am until 10 pm every day. Venant has requested his first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cooking oil, beans, sorghum, sugar, salt, rice, maize and so on. With these profits, Venant will reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, rice, maize and so on.

loans.name: Fabian Geovany

texts.es:
Fabian Geovany tiene 30 años, es soltero vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Fabian se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es culminar la carrera profesional.

Le gusta ser una persona alegre, hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Fabián Geovany, 30, is single living with his parents.  He does not have any children.  He lives in Agua Clara belonging to Chillanes Canton.

There are 14 members of the “Virgen del Huayco” communal bank located in Loma de Guacalgoto 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members of this communal bank are corn and bean farmers and some sell flour or animals.

Fabián is a corn and bean farmer.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and in San Pablo and his sales take place in the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

The loan will help him buy farming supplies.  The loan has helped him increase crop yields.  The challenges he faces are infestations and crop illnesses.  His dream is to finish his professional career.  He likes being a cheerful person, to play sports and to celebrate the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.pt:
Natural  de Manjacaze, povincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 10 a 25 anos. Fez a 2a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Manjacaza para Maputo a procura de emprego, é pencionista no Ministerio de Administração Estatal ha mais de 30 anos e tem uma pensao de 5.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu quarto emprestimo no valor de 10.100.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (cimento, areia, barrotes, portas e outros) para a construção da sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e iniciar um negocio ,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Vicente is from Manjacaze in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  He is the father of four children who range in age from 10 to 25.  He studied through the second grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports two grandchildren that live with him.

He left Manjacaza for Maputo in search of employment.  He has managed pension accounts at the state ministry of administration for more than 30 years.  He makes 5,500 meticals per month and applies it towards his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his fourth loan in the amount of 10,100 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams, doors, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His first loans were for 8,000, 10,000, and 10,000 meticals.

His dream is to finish his home to provide his family with greater comfort and to start his own business, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa is married and has four children. She sells maize in small and large quantities at Elmina, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a tailor. Abenawa uses her income to pay utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Abenawa will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Maryleny

texts.es: Maryleny tiene 33 años, vive en casa propia, es conviviente y vive junto a sus tres hijos y su pareja con quienes realizan las actividades del hogar. Cuatro veces por semana Maryleny se dirige a su chacra, que esta ubicado en el sector de la hoyada, un puerto de botes que se inunda en época de lluvias, pero en temporada de verano se convierte en una playa y ahí se puede realizar sembríos. Lleva ya tres años con este trabajo y lo realiza a lado de su conviviente. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues considera que es bueno no ser dependiente de alguien, además puede disponer de tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades. Ahora planea instalar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo que espera poder pagar todo a tiempo ya que siempre se consideró una mujer responsable. Con el dinero que solicito, comprará semillas de verduras para sembrarlas.
texts.en: Maryleny is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their three children.  Together, they all take care of their home.  Four times a week Maryleny heads to her small farm, which is located in the La Hoyada district.  The district is a port that floods in the rainy season but has beach in the summers.  That is where they have their farmland.  Maryleny has been doing this work for three years.  She works together with her partner.  Maryleny likes her work a lot because she thinks it is good to not be dependent on anyone.  In addition, she can take advantage of her extra time to do other things.  She is planning to open a small grocery store in her home.  This is Maryleny's second time requesting a loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to make all of her payments on time, as she has always considered herself to be a responsible woman.  With the requested money, Maryleny will buy vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Safoura

texts.fr:
Âgée de 43 ans et native de Sikasso, Safoura est une femme mariée qui est mère de trois  enfants  et qui réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités d’achat et vente de pagnes wax et de tissus brodés. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelques années. 
Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association AMIDEF de Banconi), elle est à son premier prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter, 23 complets complets de bazin moins riche  de “4 mètres” chaque complet, 13 complets de bazin moins riche “5 mètres” chaque complet et 5 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle effectue  généralement ses ventes  à Bouaké (R.C.I). Elle dispose  également d’une place au niveau de marché de son quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femme.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: At the age of 43 and a native of Sikasso, Safoura is a married woman and the mother of three children. She resides with her husband and their children in Banconi, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to go to school due to societal reasons, Safoura soon became interested in the business of buying and selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and embroidered fabrics. She is much in demand especially by her customers (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her products. Concerned about further satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association, the (Association AMIDEF de Banconi) in her district, she is now on her first individual loan, which she will use to buy: 23 "4-meter" outfits of moins riche damask,13 "5-meter" outfits of moins riche damask, and 5 lengths of Wax pagne cloth. Safoura general makes her sales in Bouaké (Republic of Cote d'Ivoire). At her spot at her district's market where she sells her goods, she accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed essentially of women. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 110,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for covering family expenses and the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth and damask fabrics

loans.name: C5655 Wisigara Group

texts.en:
Faustin is 40 years old and married, with four children aged between 2 and 12 years old.  He is the first person on the right side.  His business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling crops.  His business hours are from 10 am until 4:30pm every day. He has two years of experience and he currently employs two people to help him.
