Faustin and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more crops for sale. With any profits, Faustin and his team will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future. They will also be able to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more crops for sale

loans.name: Muso

texts.ru:
Мусо умный, целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и у них один любимый ребенок. Он старается содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и он хочет чтобы его ребенок вырос здоровым и был всегда счастливым. Более 7 лет он занимается услугами таксиста, он любить свою профессию и с удовольствием занимается этим. Он всегда старается, чтобы его клиенты были довольны. Мусо запрашивает займ для покупки нового автомобиля с целью расширения бизнеса. Он очень надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его, и он заранее хочет поблагодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие. Спасибо! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muso is a smart, goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and has one loved child.  Muso tries to provide good living conditions for his family and wants his child to grow up healthy and always be happy.  He has been providing a taxi service for seven years and loves his business and does it with satisfaction.  Muso tries to make sure that his customers are happy.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new car in order to expand his business.  He hopes that the creditors will support him and wants to thank all creditors in advance for the support and mercy.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gladys; la socia tiene 29 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos  de 7 y 4 años de edad, la socia trabaja en agricultura y en la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, y también vende en el mercado de Cusco cereales como trigo, tarwi, La socia produce en su chacra estos productos y por ahora ella desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra e invertir así en el cultivo de cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en: Gladys belongs to the "Virgen Del Carmen De Yuncaypata" community bank located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in a village called Yuncaypata. This is a typical village that maintains all of its pure Andean culture, and the entire community supports each other during the planting and harvest seasons, caring for children and animals. This is a beautiful place where Quechua is spoken, and it's located in the department of Cusco. Gladys is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 4. She works in agriculture and raising small animals like guinea pigs, pigs and sheep, and she also sells grains like wheat and tarwi (a local grain) at a market in Cusco. She grows these products on her farm, and she is requesting the loan to purchase of seeds for the new planting season and in this way invest in her grain crops. Gladys is grateful and values loans through this medium, and she promises to be disciplined with her payments, as she has been with her past loans.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Oumane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme agé.Il exerce le commerce de férail.Avec sa charette, il achéte du férail de récupération qu'il revend à d'autres commercant qui l'écoulent vers la capitale.Il entretient sa famille avec cette activité et demande actuellement un pret de 75000f à l'UIMCEC pour acheter 200kg de fer de récupération.
texts.en:
This borrower is an older gentleman who sells scrap metal. With the help of his cart he buys recyclable metals, which he then sells to other merchants who in turn resell the materials in the capital. This activity allows him to support his family.

He is seeking a loan of 75,000F from his U-IMCEC branch to buy 200 kg of recyclable metals.

loans.use: to buy 200 kg of recyclable metals

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Dior est une femme qui vie dans une ville limitrophe de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle est couturière et s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le but d'acheter des marchandises comme des tissus des popelines des pour faire des habits prêts à portés qu'elle va revendre dans sa boutique. Espérant augmenté son chiffre d'affaire en gagnant beaucoup de profit elle envisage avec le bénéfices qu'elle va avoir subvenir à ses besoins et aider son mari dans les taches ménagères et aux frais de scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Dior is a woman who lives in a town adjacent to the capital of Senegal.  She is a dressmaker and has been working in this field for more than 30 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as poplin fabric in order to make ready-to-wear clothes which she sells in her store.  She hopes to increase her sales and earn a lot of money.  She plans to use the profits that she makes to meet her needs and help her husband with the household expenses and their children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a 46-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. Herminia has been an Avon dealer for 24 years. In addition to Avon products, she also sells ready-to-wear clothes to the people in her community. Herminia plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shoes, sandals and clothes. Herminia hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and clothes to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula, 30 years old, is married to Maksi who is a taxi driver. They are blessed with two children namely: Yohanis, 4 years old and Vanessa, 6 months old. 

In order to support her husband in covering their daily needs, Paula sells kerosene. She has been engaged in the business since 2008. In addition to selling kerosene Paula also sells cakes and pudding based on customers' orders. 

Paula dreams of enlarging her cake business; she hopes that she can buy a freezer, stove and an oven to support her business. She is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000. She hopes that TLM can assist her to get the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, stove and an oven.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela de 64 años, madre de 8 hijos se separó de su pareja hace 20 años. En todo este tiempo ha educado a todos ellos. Ahora vive con su hija Norma de 25 años y 2 nietos, en una casa propia en el anexo de Santa Rosa de Yapaz en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro. Manuela se dedica a la agricultura. A su edad y a pesar de su separación ha vencido obstáculos para brindarles a sus hijos el sustento y educación necesarios. En sus terrenos de cultivo siembra principalmente café, que es el producto que más ingresos le genera. Por ser una actividad anual, los meses restantes del año, trabaja como operaria en parcelas de vecinos y familiares. Al día gana de 20 a 30 soles en ese oficio, “este tipo de trabajo es pesado para las mujeres, limpio las plantas, quito la mala yerba, pero no me hago problemas, tengo muchas fuerzas para hacer lo que me gusta”, comenta. Con la ayuda de su hija, puede mantener su hogar y pagar diversos servicios básicos. Manuela vive cómoda, pero no se conforma, quiere ampliar sus sembríos de café y añadir a sus tierras plantaciones de yuca y plátanos. Los deseos de Manuela se consolidan en adquirir mas ingresos de sus negocios, ampliar su casa y comprarse unos muebles, además de vivir muchos años y ver a sus nietos crecer. Gracias a su ayuda, esta incansable mujer accedería a su préstamo número 5 de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. En cuanto a “Los Cafetaleros” (su banco comunal), manifiesta sentirse contenta y agradecida por el sistema de trabajo solidario. Manuela necesita personal operario para la limpieza y cosecha del café, por esa razón contratará como mínimo 10 peones, a quienes pagará 20 soles al día.
texts.en:
Manuela, 64, is the mother of 8 children.  She separated from her partner 20 years ago.  In all this time she’s educated all of them.  Now, she lives with her daughter, Norma, 25 and two grandchildren in a house of her own in Santa Rosa de Yapaz Annex in San Luis de Shuaro District.  Manuela is a farmer.  

Despite her age and her separation she has overcome obstacles to provide her children with necessary sustenance and education.  She grows mostly coffee on her farmland which is the product that produces the most profits.  Because this is an annual activity, the rest of the months of the year she works as a laborer on parcels belonging to neighbors and family members.  She earns a daily wage of 20 to 30 soles for this work.  “This type of work is hard on women: pruning plants, removing weeds, but I don’t make problems for myself.  I have the strength to do what I enjoy,” she comments.  

With help from her daughter she’s able to maintain her home and pay for basic utilities.  Manuela lives comfortably but she’s not complacent; she wants to expand her coffee crops and add manioc and banana crops to her farmland.  The fulfillment of her wishes depends on her acquiring more income from her businesses, to expand her house and buy some furniture as well as to live many more years to see her grandchildren grow up.  

Thanks to your help, this tireless woman will acquire her MFP loan #5.  She commits to be very punctual with her monthly payments.  As far as “Los Cafetaleros” (The Coffee Growers), her communal bank, goes she states that she feels happy and grateful for the system of communal work. 

Manuela needs personnel to weed and harvest the coffee so will hire a minimum of 10 laborers that she’ll pay 20 soles per day.

loans.use: to hire ten laborers.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Alie. He is married, and has 3 children aged 5, 11 and 16 years. 

In 2008, Alie established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant and to take good care of his home. He also started the business in a stall and now owns a store. Most people prefer used clothing to new products and he has a lot customers. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alie has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used clothes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. 

In the future, Alie plans to own another shop in a town nearby where a market day is organized. He also wants the profits to increase so as to care for his family. He serves customers of all ages and mostly males. Most of his suppliers are located in Freetown. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James Mburu, a 54-year-old herbal medicine doctor in Voi, is a married father of six who has operated this business for the past two years. James was introduced to KADET by one of our staff, and this marks his first loan to expand his business. He plans to buy more herbs for his clinic and use the anticipated profits to repay his KADET loan and boost his business. 

His dream is to have a happier, more comfortable family and a more profitable herbal clinic.

loans.use: to buy more herbs for his clinic.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 43, a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in Kator, South Sudan, for four years. Cecilia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Rogelio provides "motorela" or motorcycle transport services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline for his business.

Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his transport service.

loans.name: Dougoutiguila Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Dougoutiguila Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  CHATA , 1 ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 3" are married women averaging 47 years of age and six children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with CHATA, the first one seated from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy sundry equipment, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining  0.75 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Kpedetin Group

texts.fr: KPEDETIN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Chantal Hortense (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Chantal Hortense est veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Chantal Hortense  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Chantal Hortense et son mari. Pour cette raison, Chantal Hortense vend du maïs, de l'huile végétale et de l'igname depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Chantal Hortense s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Chantal Hortense sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe KPEDETIN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de l'igname, du maïs et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mwazani lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. Mwazani owns a small tailoring mart and she has employed two assistants to help her. She has had entrepreneurship training and small business management from Youth Self Emloyment Foundation (YOSEFO).

Mwazani is on the path to expanding her business. To succeed in this, she needs to add two sewing machines, employ one more assistant, and increase the stock of sewing materials. This business expansion will help her increase her income, thus meet consumption expenditures, including school fees for her children. Mwazan is in need of USD 950.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy different vegetables for her grocery

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is 47 years old and lives with 5 members of her family in District 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a carpenter and works with members of her family in her home because her husband is dead.

She took one loan and rented a house for her carpentry shop, and now she wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials for working and furthering her business. It is one of her best wishes to be a success and help her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for carpentry

loans.name: Keat

texts.en: Mrs. Keat S. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a grocery store at home and typically makes around $10 in revenue, while her husband helps in financing the household by selling charcoal to many places in the province. Two of her children are students, and the rest are too young to attend school. Keat S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a car for her husband’s business, so that it is more comfortable to operate his transportation business. In the future, she would like to be able to expand her inventory in order to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband's business.

loans.name: Amiraslan

texts.en: Amiraslan N. is 27-year-old farmer who keeps a sheep herd and lives with his wife and two children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Amiraslan is an internally displaced person who fled to Saatli from Nagorniy Karabakh during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He has kept a sheep herd since 2001. From the money he saved, he purchased his first five sheep. He sells mutton to the local and capital bazaar traders. Amiraslan does not have a bachelor degree and his family was too poor too allow him finish high school. Amiraslan started to help his father when he was fifteen. Currently, selling mutton is the only source of revenue in their family. The mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat meat at home and in the cafes. He applied for $1000 USD to purchase 15-16 sheep for estimated cost of $60-70 USD each.

loans.use: To enlarge his sheep herd

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32 year-old mother of three, resident of Vituka area in the Dar Es Salaam City suburb. She owns a shop selling garments, vitengi and Kanga -- a business she has been running for the past seven years.

She now wishes to expand her stock in preparation for the Christmas season. She is in need of USD 800 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand clothing sales business

loans.name: Oneng

texts.en: Oneng is a 36-year-old mother of an 11-year-old son. She lives with her son and also her parents and she is the one who provides all the family's needs. She sells household goods and some foods such as Indonesian aalad (gado-gado). She can earn $10 per day. She requests a $50 loan to expand her business and hopes that she can earn more money to finance her child's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
Selling food is a competitive business, which is why we find so many establishments in food sales. But Maria Teresa has been dedicated to this business for 6 years, with the great advantage that she is an excellent cook, and her meals are in great demand in her neighborhood.

Starting is always hard, and Maria began her business by investing her small savings to buy what she needed to start selling in the Chinandega market. Still, seeing the need to grow her business, she requested micro loans from Ceprodel in order to set up a place in her home to run her business. After 4 years working with Ceprodel, Maria Teresa has been able to build her business from her home, and diversify her menu. With her increased profits, she has been able to continue supporting her two children, one of whom now attends school, and the other, an infant, who needs a lot of care and attention.

La venta de comida es un negocio de mucha competencia por lo que son varios los establecimientos en los que podemos encontrar venta de alimentos. Consiente de esta situación, la señora Maria Teresa se dedica a este negocio desde hace seis años con la gran ventaja de que es una excelentísima cocinera y por ende es muy solicitada en su localidad.

Como todo inicio es difícil, ella inició su negocio hace 6 años con capital propio (C$ 300) los cuales los invirtió para la compra de los enseres y los ingredientes y una vez contando con estos, se dedicaba a vender en el mercado de Chinandega. Sin embargo al ver la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, solicitó créditos a Ceprodel los cuales le fueron otorgados (actualmente 16 créditos) para lo cual decidió remodelar su casa para poder implementar el negocio en su hogar.

Actualmente, con cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel, la señora Teresa ha podido implementar su negocio en su hogar y a la vez ha diversificado su menú de los alimentos que ofrece por lo que ha logrado obtener mejores ingresos para continuar apoyando a sus dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos cursa la educación primaria y el otros es un infante que necesita de mucho cuido y atención por lo que es recién nacido.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED FOR THE SMALL RESTAURANT SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME.  HER BUSINESS HELPS HER SUPPORT HER TWO YOUNG CHILDREN, ONE WHO ATTENDS SCHOOL AND THE OTHER WHO IS JUST AN INFANT.

loans.name: Belleza Duradera Group

texts.es:
Lasting beauty is the name of the association comprised of a group of enterprising young women that are dedicated chiefly to marketing of all kinds of merchandise; from clothes, articles for the home, plastics, and merchandise that in some cases they make themselves.

Toward this end, many of them have sales locations in strategic market centers that very are busy, as much in the city of La Paz as in the city of El Alto.

They need capital to be able to increase their profits and increase the quantity of merchandise. Only in this way will they be able to achieve the purchase, enlargement or restructuring of their homes, since a great percentage of these associates lack a home of their own or adequate conditions for the number of children and relatives that live with them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Belleza Duradera, es el nombre de la Asociación integrada por un grupo de mujeres jóvenes y emprendedoras que se dedican principalmente al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería, desde ropa, artículos para el hogar, plásticos, y mercadería que en algunos casos ellas mismas confeccionan.

Para este fin muchas de ellas cuentan con puestos de venta en estratégicos centros de venta que son muy concurridos, tanto en la ciudad de La Paz, como en la ciudad de El Alto.

Ellas precisan de capital para poder incrementar sus ganancias, variando la cantidad de mercadería, solo de esta manera podrán en algunos casos acceder a la compra, ampliación, remodelación de sus viviendas, ya que un gran porcentaje de estas socias, carecen de una vivienda propia o en condiciones adecuadas para el número de hijos y familiares con los que viven.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resales such as clothes, articles for the home, and plastics.

loans.name: Zulfiay

texts.ru:
Zulfiay M. live in Yavan, she is 27 years old, is married and has 4 children. She has a secondary specialized education and is a tailor by profession. She sews dresses to order and for sale. Zulfiay has been in this business for 10 years. She will use her loan to purchase fabric to make national dresses. This business is the main source of income for her family and also gives locals access to these services at affordable prices. She plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмадиева Зулфия Сайфовна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 27 лет, замужем имеет 4 детей.Образование средне-специальное.По профессии швея. Шьет платья на заказ и на продажу. Занимается этим видом деятельности около 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести материал для пошива национальных платьев.Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Кроме того это позволяет населению пользоваться данными услугами по доступным ценам.Погасить кредит клиентка в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu J. is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  He sells goat meat in the market and, in the evening, his wife sells roasted goat meat in one of the night clubs. The couple work hard to improve their living status. Amadu would like to increase his business and would like a loan of Le.3, 000,000 to purchase a number of goats for the meat and to raise some for the future.

loans.use: To build his supply of fresh meat and purchase goats for future use

loans.name: Aunaka

texts.en:
Aunaka is 23 years old and is a single woman. Aunaka sells coal. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more coal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coal for her business.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia has been selling chicken soup for 25 years. She used to go out in a street-cart and offer the soup in “La Parada” and “Ventanilla”. Later, she started selling it in her neighborhood’s market. However, four years ago, Mauricia started a soup restaurant in her house. She is open from 5 a.m. to noon.

The loans received have been used to improve the restaurant with furniture, like tables, chairs, tv, etc. Mauricia would like to sell “anticuchos” (small pieces of grilled skewered meat) in the restaurant during the evening, but she needs capital to be able to hire personnel.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Mauricia vende caldo de gallina desde hace 25 años. Ella salía con su carreta y ofrecía su caldo en La Parada y Ventanilla. Luego, empezó a vender en el mercado de su barrio. Pero, desde hace 4 años, Mauricia tiene su restaurante de caldo de gallina en su casa. Ella abre todos los días a las 5 de la mañana y cierra al mediodía.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para mejorar e implementar el restaurante con nueva infraestructura, como mesas, sillas, televisión, etc. Mauricia quisiera vender anticuchos en su restaurante por la noche, pero le falta capital para poder pagar el personal de atención.

loans.use: To hire personnel and be able to open restaurant for longer hours

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amélé H. was born on June 10, 1972 in Sévagan in the Vo Prefecture. She is married, and her principal business is the sale of grocery staples in the Tokoin neighborhood of Lomé.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to stock up by buying 20 tins of oil, 2 cases of milk, and 2 cases of wine.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée, madame H. Amélé est née le 10 juin 1972 à Sévagan dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier de Tokoin à Lomé.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat 20 bidons d’huile, 2 cartons de lait et 2 cartons de vins.

loans.use:
purchase of staple grocery items

Achat des produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Peter Anyah

texts.en:
Peter Anyah T. is a thirty-three year old widower with two children. He has already lost many loved ones: his wife, one child, his father, a brother and a sister. Now a single father, Peter's greatest goal in life is to care for his children and send them to school.

Peter joined GHAPE in 2004 to find a steadier source of income and care for his children. He says that he enjoys being a GHAPE member, “It makes me work very hard.” He has already successfully borrowed and repaid three loans totaling $375. These loans allowed him to buy dyes, which he uses to color thread. He then weaves the colored thread into bags and wall hangings in the traditional Cameroonian style. The profits from this business have already allowed him to begin a small pig farm and pay his children’s school fees.

Peter is requesting this new loan to continue his weaving business, expand his pig farm, and begin raising poultry as well. The largest part of the loan will go to buy additional pigs, since they are the most profitable, but pigs require time to grow and reproduce. So he plans to add poultry to his farm, since they can be raised in just three months, turning a faster profit. Meanwhile, he will add about $30 to the capital in his weaving business. He says that his businesses will succeed, because pigs, poultry, and woven bags are in great demand in his community, and his local production saves people from having to travel to the city to buy these items.

Peter plans to repay his loan in 18 months. The first repayment will be due on the fourth month following disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs, poultry, and dyes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Mr. Juan F. is 65 years old and has been married for 30 years to Ms. Blasida Villalba, 51 years old. They have 4 children, of which one of them recently died at 23 years old due to an accident on the job. Their other children, ages 26, 22, and 20 continue to live with them and the youngest one is studying Business Administration at the National University.

This is a family business where everyone helps the parents in the raising of chickens, pigs and the sale of milk, which is milked from their own animals, with the goal of improving the business and increasing the family income.

Juan is retired from the Instituto of Prevision Social [social security s] and receives a pension.

He is requesting this loan to purchase chickens, pigs and cattle, and with that will increase production to be able to provide milk on a permanent basis, chickens, and pork to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Juan F. de 65 años de edad está casado hace 30 años con la señora Blasida Villalba de 51 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 4 hijos de los cuales uno falleció no hace mucho a los 23 años en un accidente que tuvo en el trabajo, los otros hijos de 26, 22 y 20 años de edad siguen viviendo con ellos, la menor de todos está estudiando en la universidad nacional la carrera de Administración de Empresas.

El negocio es de la unidad familiar donde todos le ayudan a sus padres en la cría de pollos, chanchos y a la comercialización de leche que extrae de sus propios animales con el fin de que cada día crezca su negocio y aumentar el ingreso de la unidad familiar.

El señor Juan es jubilado del Instituto de Previsión Social recibe en forma mensual su pensión.

Solicita este préstamo para la compra de pollos, chanchos y animales vacunos y con eso aumentará su producción para poder ofrecer en forma permanente leche, pollos faenados y carne de chanchos a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs, and cattle.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac G. is married and has 2 children. He has received no formal education. Isaac sells firewood, which is the major source of fuel to the fishmongers at Ayiso, which he has done since 1999. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other utility bills. Isaac will use the loan to purchase more firewood for sale to meet the increase in demand of his costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to increase sales to enable him get enough money to offer his children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to meet the increase in demand of his costumers.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: La señora Flor de Maria habita el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 37 años de edad, se encuentra acompañada por el señor Ricardos Lago, el es traductor y ambos tienen dos hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad. Actualmente la señora  Flor es secretaria en  la empresa Unión Fenosa, hace 12 años, ella junto con su esposo han trabajado con mucho esfuerzo para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y a la vez en darle condiciones de vida  digna, por tanto desea a través de este crédito de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses,  poder mejorar el cuarto de su casa, donde requiere comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su habitación.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria lives in the Reconciliación neighborhood located in the capital of Managua. She is 37 years old, married to Ricardos Lago who works as a translator, and has two children of 15 and 8 years. She has been a secretary for Union Fenosa for the past 12 years. Flor and her husband have worked together with much effort in order to support their children’s education and to give them decent living conditions. Accordingly, Flor is requesting a loan of C$ 6,000 for a period of 9 months in order to improve a room in her house for which she needs construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to improve her home

loans.name: Brigida's Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to add to her inventory; and toys for the Christmas period.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to keep running a small business.

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: Lagi F. is 34 years old and single.  She has 1 year of experience in the cigarette business. She sells to the village people five days a week. She is a new member of SPBD.  Lagi expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~$40USD).  SPBD loans are Lagi’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan of $275 to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to maintain and improve her business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana B. is a twenty-nine year old woman. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. She is a seamstress. She sews all forms of ladies wear of various styles to suit the taste of her customers, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

Christiana wants to use this loan to buy more fabrics (like linen) and materials (like threads and thimbles) to increase her output and efficiency. She sews dresses and supplies to shops in her community who also sell. She hopes to raise good income to provide her children with quality education. Christiana’s photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Masitula's Group

texts.en: Masitula N. is one of the executive members of the Lugolole Group in Jinja. She is a married woman and has a business of selling bananas (matooke). She has been in this business all her life and hence has the experience of ensuring that she has high yields since most of the matooke she sells come from her garden. She will only go to her fellow matooke growers if she does not have enough to sell to her customers. Apart from the matooke, Masitula also has other sweet potato plantations, cassava, and groundnuts that help to boost her income. She also keeps animals like cows and goats at home and has bicycles that help to transport her produce to the desired market areas. Masitula needs a loan to help buy fertilizers for her farm and to employ manpower on those farms.

loans.use: To pay for more fertilizers and labor on her farm plantations

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng 41 tuổi. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2007.  Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà nhưng hiện tại với thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và mức vốn vay lớn hơn chị đang đầu tư vào buôn bán đồ nội thất tại nhà. Anh Nguyễn Văn Hiền chồng chị  ngoài thời gian giúp đỡ vợ buôn bán  còn có thêm nghề hàn xì nên thu nhập của gia đình rất ổn định ( 2.000.000đ/ tháng) Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi H. is 41 years old. She has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2007. At the beginning, Mrs. H. used her loan to raise chicken. As her farm gets bigger and she is now qualified for bigger loan, Mrs. H. wants to use her fund to invest in furniture retailing at her house. Her husband Mr. Nguyen Van Hien, a solderer, also helps her with the store. Thus, her family income is pretty stable (2,000,000 VND/month, or 120 USD/month). She wants to borrow 10,000,000 VND (or 600 USD) to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Maxime Komlan

texts.fr: D. maxime a abandonné très tôt l’école et s’est lancé en 2004 dans l’apprentissage de la prise de photo, aujourd’hui il a ouvert sa propre boutique de photographie qu’il a appelé  « LA VOLONTE DE DIEU », beaucoup de personnes lui font confiance et sollicitent ses services lors des évènements comme les mariages, anniversaires. Son matériel étant un peu vétuste, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 cartouches de pellicules et 02 appareils photos. Il est un célibataire et c’est grâce à cette activité qu’il subvient à ses charges
texts.en:
Maxime D. left school early on and took up an apprenticeship in photography. Today he has opened his own photography studio that he calls « LA VOLONTE DE DIEU » (God's Will). Lots of people trust him and come to him when they need photography services for events such as marriages and anniversaries. His equipment is somewhat obsolete, so he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 30 canisters of film and 2 cameras. He is single and it is with this business that he earns his living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing canisters of film and cameras

loans.name: Nakubulwa Justine‘S Group

texts.en:
Justine is 32 years old and a single mother of three children between 10 and 14 years old. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people and doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has no access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Justine sells second-hand clothes door to door She uses public transport to and from shopping, buying from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, which is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include rent for her accommodation and school fees for her children.

Justine sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for over ten years now. This is her fourteenth loan ever since she joined MCDT seven years ago, working with the same group-mates. Justine wants to use this loan to buy more clothes for resale. She aspires to growing her business and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rene Lucia

texts.es:
Rene Lucia Dávila V. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada.
Doña Rene tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Rene es la venta de mercadería en general. Doña Rene es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 7 años que de se dedica a este negocio. Doña Rene dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenia que mantener a sus hijos. El propósito de Rene es proporcionar a sus clientes diversidad en sus productos y satisfacer a sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de ropa, prendas de oro laminado, plata, bolsos, calzado entre otros. El deseo de Rene es de proporcionarle a su hijo la educación necesaria para que sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Rene Lucia Dávila V. is 29 years old, and married. Rene has 1 child and sells general merchandise. Rene is a very determined and enterprising woman, which leads her to greatly enjoy her business. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 7 years. Rene began this business due to her desire to get ahead in life given that she had to support her child. Rene’s intention is offer her clients variety in her products and to please them. The loan is destined to serve as work capital, and the money will be used to purchase clothing, gold plated jewelry, silver, bags, and shoes amongst other items. Rene hopes to give her son the necessary education so that he becomes a skilled professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase clothing, gold plated jewelry, silver, bags, and shoes.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy  S.  âgée de trente  six (36) ans est une marchande ambulante elle vend des chausses et des habilles dans les maisons de quartier.les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarités de ses enfants mais aussi de participer aux frais d’entretien de la maison au même titre que son mari. Elle jamais eu de prêt avec ce premier prêt elle compte accroitre son fonds de roulement en achetant plus de marchandises et réduire les couts de transport.
texts.en:
Amy S., age 36, is an itinerant merchant. She sells shoes and clothing to homes in the area. The revenues derived from her work enables her to pay the school fees for her children and also to help with the costs of maintaining the house, just like her husband does. She has never had a loan before. With this initial loan, she intends to grow her working capital by buying more merchandise and reducing transport costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tuti

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Тути Хаитова около 7 лет занимается торговлей. Ее товар - это детская и подрастковая одежда. Товар Тути покупает у поставщиков, затем продает его на вещевом рынке города Истаравша, в этом городе она и проживает вместе со своей семьей. 
Муж Тути Азим работает строителем. Его средний ежемесячный зароботок сотовляет 200 сомони. У Тути и Азима растет сын. Он хорошо учится, его родители мечтают отправить сына на учебу за границу. И поэтому работают не покладая рук.
Для того, чтобы заработать больше денег, Тути требуется увеличить свой товарооборот. Для этого она обратилась в нашу организацию. Она считает что условия кредитования нашей организации ей идеально подходят. Она запрашивает сумму в размере 1000 сомони.
texts.en:
Tuti H. has been involved in sales close to 7 years. Her merchandise includes children’s and teenage clothing. She buys the merchandise from suppliers and then sells it at the clothing market in Istaravshan, the city where she lives with her family. Tuti’s husband, Azim, is a construction worker. He makes 200 somini every month. Tuti and Azim are raising their young son. He is a good student, and his parents dream of sending him to study abroad. This is why both Tuti and Azim work very hard. Tuti needs to increase her goods turnover in order to earn more money. She thinks that our organization’s lending conditions are ideal and reached to us for a loan. Tuti is requesting a sum of 1000 somoni.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1 Group

texts.en:
With four children and 14 grandchildren, Altagracia is an absolutely wonderful grandmother who is currently on her seventh loan cycle with Esperanza. She owns a little building next to her house from which she sells gasoline to the passing motorcyclists and vehicles. She also offers repairs and she supplements these sales with her own homemade cookies, sweets and other treats. One of Altagracia’s grandchildren, Leonard, helps her with running the business when it comes to repairing motorcycles. Much of his time is spent working on motorcycles and repairing them, while Altagracia focuses on the sales of the gasoline and baked goodies.

Altagracia is excited to see her business continue to grow. Through the loan cycle progression at Esperanza, she was able to buy the little building next to her house and she has continually increased her inventory. Most recently, her loan has gone to buying gasoline, baking goods and parts for repairing motorcycles. She loves her business and for now is almost completely focusing on its growth and putting extra profits back into her enterprise. However, in the future, Altagracia wants to fix up her home a little bit, including finishing off a cement floor throughout her entire house. For now, most of her house has a floor – but some of it is still dirt.

Altagracia (second from left) is the coordinator of this group of five women within the Mujeres Unidas Bank of Hope near Samaná, Dominican Republic. Altagracia is very thankful for any help you can provide!

loans.use: To buy gasoline, motorcycle parts and baking supplies

loans.name: Hushvaht

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хушвахт  Бобоев занимается животноводством, дома у него 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. Проживает Хушвахт в городе Истаравшане.
С раннего утра Хушвахт готовит корм своему скоту, его жена доит молоко и поит скот. Так начинается утро Хушвахта и его семьи. В течении дня ухаживать за скотом ему помогает брат Суюнбой.
Дополнительно Хушвахт занимается сельским хозяйством. Он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони, для того чтобы использовать ее для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Hushvaht B. is involved in animal husbandry. He has 7 heads of cattle at home. Hushvaht lives in the city of Istaravshan. Early in the mornings, Hushvaht prepares feed for his livestock, and his wife milks the cows and gives them water. This is how mornings start for Hushvaht and his family. His brother, Suyunboi helps him look after the livestock during the day. In addition, Hushvaht is involved in agriculture. He is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 somoni to use it for feeding livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding livestock

loans.name: Help The Poor (Malana) Group

texts.en: Upon completing high school, G. got involved in the sale of dry goods (rice, oil, onions, etc.) and has been in the business for the past 3 years. His greatest challenge was at the beginning of the business when there was no financal help at all.  He’s currently dreaming of extending the size of his table in the market and purchase more goods and also wants to continue his schooling.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, onions, etc. for resale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is from the village of Lugait Mismis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Lorna is married and has 15 school-age children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business, making and selling specialty food products in the local community. Lorna has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 31 years old. Mercy is married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica C. D. G. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Rosa tiene 66 años D. edad vive con su hija y su pequeño nieto. Rosa es madre soltera ha sido muy trabajadora y responsable para darle lo mejor a su hija, hace veinte años instalo una tienda la cual hasta el día D. ahora es la que genera el ingreso fijo D. Rosa, el deseo D. ella es seguir en su negocio y es por ello que solicita este crédito, para surtir su tienda la cual necesita D. mercadería nueva para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica C. D. G. resides in the department of Ahuachapán. Rosa is 66 years old and lives with her daughter and young grandson. Rosa is a single mother and has been very hard working and responsible so that she could give her daughter the best. Twenty years ago she set up a store, and to this day she generates an income for herself. Her desire is to continue her business. It is for that reason she requests this loan, to stock her shop which needs new merchandise to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en: Joshua W. is 36 years old and married with three kids. He is the leader of his group in Mukono. Joshua would like to use this loan of 300,000 USH to expand his business and buy the proper supplies to begin sand quarrying.

loans.use: more construction supplies

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 37 years old and is married to Mary Wanjiru. They have 4 school-going children. He has run his small retail business in Naivasha town for the past year.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy more retail products to sell in his shop in order to boost business and draw in more customers. He hopes to enter the transport business some day and buy his own cab to increase his income.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more retail products to sell in his shop

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie D. is from the village of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old. Girlie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Girlie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her "sari-sari store " general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, sugar, candies,salt, eggs,soap & toothpaste in the local community. Girlie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Girlie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and used for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresa Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Manuelita Sáenz se reúne en barrio Jocay de la ciudad de Manta en la costa de Ecuador, Manta es el primer puerto atunero de Sudamérica es una zona de mucho movimiento económico.

La señora Teresa Z.  es oriunda de Quevedo en la provincia de Los Ríos, llegó a vivir a Manta hace 20 años, aquí  formó su familia, actualmente se encuentra casada  y tiene tres hijos jóvenes universitarios, el esposo es de profesión chofer que trabaja en un taxi en la ciudad.

Teresita es una mujer dedicada a la costura, de profesión modista, se preparó cuando era muy joven sus padres fueron los que la impulsaron a que estudie y se prepare, se graduó en  esta profesión y desde hace 5 años trabaja en éste arte, confecciona ropa deportiva, vestidos de novia y ropa intima,  en su casa  tiene un pequeño taller, ella diseña los modelos de sus prendas,  cuenta que ahora el  negocio está un poco bajo porque algunas personas prefieren comprar la ropa ya confeccionada por eso opto por confeccionar y entregar a almacenes para que comercialicen sus diseños, cada prenda tiene un costo de 30, 50 o 70 dólares dependiendo del diseño y la complejidad de confeccionarlo.

 Teresa está solicitando un nuevo préstamo a la Fundación para invertir en  la compra de  telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y otros implementos para la confección de sus prendas  y entregar a tiempo los  nuevos pedidos, para ello  ella  viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil  y Portoviejo para adquirir la materia prima por un costo aproximado de 800 hasta 1000 dólares en cada  compra.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Manuelita Sáenz" meets in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta on the coast of Ecuador. Manta is the first tuna port in South America and it is an area with a lot of economic activity.

Señora Teresa Z. is a native of Quevedo in the province of Los Ríos. She came to Manta to live 20 years ago and formed her family here. She is currently married and has three young children who are in college. Her husband is a taxi driver in the city.

Teresita is a woman who makes a leaving by sewing and designing. She learned when she was very young and her parents motivated to study and practice. She graduated and has worked for more than 5 years in this field. She makes athletic clothing, wedding dresses, and lingerie. She has a workshop in her home where she makes her designs. She tells us that her business is a little low right now because some people prefer to buy clothing that is already made, and that is why she chose to make and deliver her designs to department stores. Each piece of clothing costs $30, $50, or $70 depending on the design and how complex it is to make.

Teresa is requesting a new loan from the Fundación to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items to make her clothing so she can deliver her orders on time. She will travel to Guayaquil and Portoviejo to acquire these materials at a cost of approximately $800-1,000.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies like fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and more to make her designs

loans.name: Murotjon

texts.en:
Murotjon R. is 27 years old and he lives with his wife and three children.  He has grown vegetables and wheat for more than four years.  His small plots are close to his home, which gives him plenty of time to care for his crops, family and children. The hard part is transporting his products into cities to sell, because of the scarcity of buses.  Murotjon gets most of his enthusiasm from his family. He will use his loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, to increase his production and therefore his income. With your help, Murotjon will get ahead. He is counting on your help. 

--------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
--------------------------------------
IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds  fertilizer for sowing wheat and seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Vicente Rodolfo

texts.es:
Vicente Vélez de 40 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento tiene dos servicios básicos como agua y luz sin alcantarillado, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio con ella tiene 5 hijos uno de 15 años, 13 años, 11 años, 9 años, 6 años todos estudiantes de una escuela fiscal. 

Vicente comenzó hace 12 años atrás con el negocio de la tienda para que su esposa y el trabajen juntos, ahora Vicente hace las compras y su esposa atiende la tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h30 de lunes a domingos, venden arroz, pollo, verde, aceites etc. Una de las complicaciones son los ladrones en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar, atún, pollos para poder agrandar mas el negocio, en el futuro quiere arreglar su casa para que cada  uno de sus hijos tenga su propia habitación.
texts.en:
Vicente Vélez, age 40, lives in a suburban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His cement house has the two basic utilities– light and water– but no sewage system. His wife helps him with his business, and together they have 5 children, ages 15, 13, 11, 9, and 6, who are all students at a public school. Vicente opened his store 12 years ago so that he and his wife could work together. Now, Vicente does the shopping, and his wife works in the store from 6:00 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. Monday through Sunday. They sell rice, chicken, fresh vegetables, oils etc. One setback are the thieves in their area. With this loan, Vicente wants to buy oil, sugar, tuna, and chicken in order to expand their business. In the future, he wants to remodel his house so that one of children can have their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, and tuna

loans.name: Ely

texts.es:
Ely, de 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada junto a su querido hijo y lo que más desea es brindarle un buen futuro.
Su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños. Desde muy joven incursionó en este trabajo y ahora tiene su propio taller de confecciones donde elabora prendas infantiles, la cuales posteriormente lleva a vender a su puesto, donde son compradas rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta a Ely de su trabajo es confeccionar prendas para los niños más pequeños, ya que le causan mucha ternura, lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es darle el acabado a las prendas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado y paciencia. 
Para el futuro, espera comprar mejor maquinaria y aumentar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Ely con MFP, está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de ropa.
texts.en:
Ely, 32 years old, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in a rental house with her beloved son and what she most desires is to offer him a good future. Her business is making children's clothes. When she was very young, she became involved in this work and now, she has her own sewing shop where she makes outfits for infants, which she then takes to her stall and they are rapidly purchased. What Ely likes most about her work is to make outfits for the smallest infants, becuase they create tender feelings. She has been doing this work for 6 years and the most difficult part is finishing the outfits, which requires much care and patience. In the future, she hopes to buy a better sewing machine and increase her production. This is Ely's first loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time, since she wishes to borrow again in the future. She is a very active member of her communal bank who feels solidarity with other members. With the 1,000 New Sols she is requesting she will buy new materials so she can make a larger quantity of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TEXTILES FOR SEWING INFANT OUTFITS

loans.name: Srey Oun's Group

texts.en:
This group bank loan consists of four members and Mrs. Srey Oun M. has been selected by the members, each of whom will use their loan for a different purpose. All the members live in Sam Raong village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Srey Oun M. is 28 years old and is the mother of two children who are too small to study or work. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Bun Chhean Chhoen, is a tobacco seller.

In order to improve the conditions of her family living, Mrs. Srey Oun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more tobacco for her husband to sell, which can generate high profits.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco for her husband to sell

loans.name: Gwenotwom C Lalam Christine Group

texts.en: L. Christine is a business woman who is 38 years old and single. She has four children in school. She has owned a grocery store for three years. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as tomatoes, charcoal and eggplant to sell. She is adding capital into her business. Her future hope is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for land

loans.name: Yelba Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Yelba Argentina L. Ampié, tiene la edad de 25 años, vive con su esposo, en el humilde Barrio San Ignacio, ellos son una familia de 4 miembros, y dentro de los principales sueños que tienen para la familia, está el mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ellos son agricultores desde hace 5 años.

Fue con el apoyo de su papa, que comenzaron a cosechar y uno de los principales problemas que han tenido, ha sido la afectación de las plagas y las enfermedades de las tierras, es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo para la compra de fungicidas y abonos, para brindarle mantenimiento a su producción, esto les traerá un aumento en el volumen de sus ventas y de esta  forma mejores condiciones económicas para futuros proyectos que les favorezcan a su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelba Argentina Lopez Ampie, 25, lives with her husband in the humble neighborhood of San Ignacio. Her family of 4 has lots of dreams for the future but one of the most important is to improve their standard of living. They have operated a farming business for the last 5 years. They started their first crop with help from her father but the soil is exhausted and they have problems with pests so they need a loan in order to buy pesticides and fertilizers. By improving their output, they can increase their sales and, in turn, their economic condition and future financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticides for farming business.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji E. is 29 years old and married to a driver. She has two children who both go to school. Keji is currently in the business of selling dried fish and tomatoes at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is 32 years old and since 1979 has earned a living as a farmer on a plot of land that she owns. She grows all kinds of produce and is able to raise two crops a year. She is also the devoted mother of three children; all of them are living with her in the family home. 

K. has been married for many years to Mr. Seang Thei, 40, who earns an income from farming. K. has requested this loan to grow crops as the rainy season is coming.

loans.use: To grow crops

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is married with 4 children and they are doing well in their respective school. She is 39 years of age and she lives with her husband who is a civil servant in Lagos. She sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. She works hard to make sure there is food on her children’s table. She opens her shop every day of the week in order to make more sales and profit. She started the business since 15 years ago and she like the nature of the business. 

She needs more capital to invest into the business, she is requesting for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to sell. She promise to pay promptly and says thanks to Kiva and LAPO for their wonderful initiatives.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Hatarinas” se encuentra ubicada en la zona de El Agustino, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 10 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 1 año. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades de producción, comercio y servicio.
María del Carmen quien a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 44 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad académica, se dedica a la venta de café en granos y servicio de internet desde hace 1 año, se inicio ya que como ella vendía productos de belleza y tenia clientes decidió vender café en invierno y tuvo una buena acogida, así que decidió continuar en esta actividad, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria María del Carmen ha comprado artefactos para su vivienda y esencialmente ha apoyado en la educación de sus hijos, ya que desea que sean profesionales. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en el título profesional de su hija.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (niños en la foto, hijos de los socios)
texts.en:
The Hatarinas Communal Bank is located in the El Agustino area in the Lima department. It is comprised of ten members. They have been working with Edapropa-Prosperidad for one year. The members do diverse activities in production, commerce and service. María del Carmen is the president. She is 44, married, and has three school age children. She has been selling coffee beans and providing internet service for one year. She started because she sold beauty products, and she had customers. She decided to sell coffee in the winter, and it was well received. So, she decided to continue this activity. With the effort of her daily work, María del Carmen has bought appliances for her home. She has essentially helped with her children’s education because she wants them to become professionals. She will use the loan for her daughter’s professional certificate. All of our members are grateful for the support, and they are committed to making their payments according to Prosperidad’s timeline. (The children in the photo are the members’ children.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter’s professional certificate

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en: Mekie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 37 years old, single and has three children between nine and 19 years old, all of them in school. She also cares for one sibling. Mekie was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. For 10 years, she has been selling used clothes on Camp Johnson Road, down town Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. Her hope is to improve her business and take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Lenie's Group

texts.en:
Lenie T. is from the village of D'ban. She is 44 years old. Lenie is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

Lenie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling dry goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately $60 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for her children's education. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda E. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Erminda is married and has two adult children. Erminda owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling banana cue in the local community. Erminda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Erminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Erminda is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: San

texts.en:
