Apart from selling jewelry and catalogue items, she also makes clay crafts and ceramics to sell.

For the past four years she has been selling items from catalogues.  She tells us that this has gone very well, and that she also buys clothes and resells them.  In the patio of her house she has a small room where she keeps her materials to make her clay and ceramic crafts.  She intends to invest the funds from this loan in merchandise for her catalogue sales, since she has a number of orders and for lack of capital has not been able to fulfill them.

Little by little she has taught herself how to make the crafts that she makes today.  She sells her crafts from the room that she has.  She keeps it orderly and clean since this is where her customers come and see her crafts and the items she offers from the catalogues.

Patricia gets up very early.   She does her household chores, and during the day she sells her merchandise, and at night she paints her crafts.  She is a woman who has made great progress through her own efforts.  The process of teaching herself has taught her about herself and has helped to improve her self-esteem.  With this loan she will have more capital to be able to continue selling her products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to build her inventory of clothes, perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a forty-five-year-old married woman with eight school-going children. Her husband Hare is a retired teacher who contributes to the provision of  basic family needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Josephine has operated a green grocery for the past fifteen years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the market to her sales point. She dreams of having a wholesale grocery shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it understands its clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva  is 66 years old, widowed, and has four adult children.  She is from Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, Primitiva owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She earns 5,000 PHP a month and has been in this business for five years. 

Primitiva has been a member of GDMPC for almost six years. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Primitiva is requesting a new loan for 20,000 PHP,  which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, Primitiva's plans to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 53 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Since 1974, Ganbaatar has been working as a welder and he opened his own home welding business in 2005. His wife and daughter help with his business and his son works in city. Ganbaatar is well known for his excellent work and his equipment is portable equipment which gives him an advantage over his competitors. 

Ganbaatar recently received a mass order from a company and he is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy thin and thick iron.

loans.use: to buy iron

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri de 26 años, hace 10 años convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 11, 8, 5 y 3 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shaoriato. Yuri desde niño se dedica  a las labores del campo. La agricultura es la actividad en la que se desenvuelve con libertad y sabiduría. Gracias a la fertilidad de los suelos y a la destreza en los negocios, está convencido de que saldrá adelante. En las 2 hectáreas de terrenos de su propiedad cultiva kión y en otras 2 café.  “Depende de cómo negocies, por ejemplo el café es más rentable en mayo y abril. El kión en estos meses, no me puedo quejar”, explica. Además comenta que falta de capital fue uno de sus problemas principales para invertir en el pago de operarios. “Pago 15 soles para el macheteo (corte de maleza con el machete), 18 soles para la siembra y 25 para la limpieza del kión”, manifiesta.
Yuri espera ampliar su casa con la construcción de más cuartos, para ello seguirá trabajando igual o más que ahora. Esta sería la primera vez que Yuri contaría con un préstamo de MFP, se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos. En cuanto a su banco comunal:”San Pablo Shima”, se siente contento por que dentro del grupo encuentra amigos confiables. Con el dinero del crédito podrá continuar con las siembras. Invertirá en el pago de personal contratado y algunas bolsas de abonos.
texts.en: Yuri is 26 years old and has been married to his wife for the 10 years. They have four children, ages 11, 8, 5 and 3, and they all live in a home they own in the community of San Pablo de Shaoriato. Since he was a young boy Yuri has made a living working in the fields. Agriculture has given him his freedom and his wisdom. Thanks to the fertility of the soil and his knowledge of the business, he was convinced he could get ahead. He owns two hectares of land on which he cultivates ginger, and has two other hectares where he cultivates coffee. "It depends on the business," he says. "For example coffee is more profitable in May and April. Ginger during these months, I can't complain." Furthermore, he says that a lack of capital is one of biggest problems in investing in his business. "I pay 15 soles for cutting weeds with a machete, 18 for planting and 25 for cleaning the ginger," he says. Yuri wants to expand his house by adding more rooms, and to do that he will keeping working just as hard or even harder. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his payments. In his community bank, "San Pablo Shima", he feels content to be part of a group of trustworthy friends. With the money he is requesting, he will be able to continue his planting by hiring workers and buying some sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace, 58, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, Alejandro, is her business partner, and father to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this she also oversees their Jeepney unit (a public utility vehicle) that gives them additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Grace hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tayson lo conforman  tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Cecilia del Carmen  quien es la coordinadora del grupo propietaria de una pulpería la cual inicio con 50 dólares y poco a poco fue aumentándola.  El crédito lo invertirá en productos (granos básicos, carne, productos lácteos…etc.) para mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel de 47 años quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 25 años y Juana Bertilda quien es costurera desde hace 30 años.
texts.en: The Tayson Communal Bank is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people, one of whom is Cecilia del Carmen who is coordinator of the ownership group of a grocery store, which she started with 50 dollars and gradually expanded. She will invest the loan in products (basic grains, meat, dairy products, etc) in order to improve her business. The other members of the communal bank are Maribel, 47, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for 25 years and Juana Bertilda, who has been a seamstress for 30 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa has produced kenkey (corn flour dumplings) to sell at the village of Akotokyire near Abura for the past 3 years. She is married with 6 dependents. Her husband is a security officer. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their children. She needs this loan to purchase maize in bulk for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Adjoa wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for her kenkey.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Mirasol has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mirasol has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 33 year old married man. He has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 10. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail stall where he sells sugarcane. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a populated and viable area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of transportation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugarcane for sale. His business goal is to run a wholesale business of sugarcane within 5 years. His hope and dream is to be a big and successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane for sale

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is 28 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4 years, not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 3 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Four years ago, Irma wanted to support her husband with the family’s expenses and she started to work in a small business preparing tacos (a typical meal). She is a 46 year old woman who is very active, her husband works in a factory, and they have three children. Two years ago, she decided to work by herself and now rents a small place in front of the main square of her town where she sells TACOS during a few hours each day. In addition to this activity, she sells bedspreads and sheets to her clients.

She is requesting a loan for $ 475 USD to buy raw materials to prepare the TACOS and she expects to repay in a term of 6-12 months. In the future, she would like to create a restaurant and offer a complete menu of meals all day long.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Hace cuatro años que Irma quiso apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia y comenzó a trabajar en un negocio preparando tacos (comida tipica), ella es una mujer de 46 años muy activa, su esposo trabaja en una fabrica y tienen tres hijos. Hace dos años se decidió a establecerse por su cuenta y actualmente renta un pequeño local enfrente de la plaza principal de su pueblo en donde ofrece la venta de TACOS durante parte del día. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, ella también vende sábanas y colchas entre sus clientes.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 USD para comprar materias primas que utiliza en la elaboración de los tacos, y piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses. En un futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante y poder ofrecer todo un menú de comidas a lo largo de todo el día.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. has been in the electronic repair business for the last five years and the business has been able to provide for his family. He is married and has two children, one that attends school. He also takes care of his aging parents. He has taken loan management and business skill training with the Rural Agency for Development (Rafode).

He is seeking a loan of $950 to buy spare electronic parts in bulk to sell to his clients who come for his services. He will also sell to other electronic repair dealers in the area. He will use the profit to diversify his business, buy a cow for his parents, and save for future use. He is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Buy electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le and her husband were born in 1972. They have two daughters, 16 and 14. The eldest daughter has stopped attending school, and the youngest is an eighth grade student. They have a little land for their hut and a pigpen. They earn about $10 per person per month from making baskets and raising pigs. They are requesting a loan of $75 dollars in order to raise more pigs and make more baskets. This will increase their income and standard of living.

loans.use: Materials needed for making baskets and raising pigs

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto sells and fixes kitchen stoves and other household appliances. He learned the family trade from his father over 25 years ago. He started off with a small stand in the fairs of Guayaquil four years ago, but now he has a larger spot in the markets. His son works with him at the location and his wife sells the products door to door.

Ernesto is seeking his second loan from Kiva and Mifex. He paid back his first loan completely on time and saw positive results in his business. He needs this new loan to continue investing in new and used merchandise. With these goods he adds new inventory to his business and increases sales. The extra income has allowed him to get started with his plans to improve his home which is now made of wood.

loans.use: Invest in new and used kitchen appliances

loans.name: Naite

texts.en: Naite is a mother of six children. Her husband and herself are never careless in taking care of  their school fees and fares. So being a responsible mother, Naite does not rely on others for that. She is always in attendance whenever there is a seminar being held outside the village and there she gains knowledge and skill to operate a business. She sells her products at the Flea Market at Savalalo and she opens six days a week. Her sales amounts up to $1600 and earns a profit of $800 a week. She is looking forward to expand her business in producing more of the goods that earns her more profit.

loans.use: : “Buy hooks, paints, chains, materials for designing hand bags, and niddles for sewing Samoan caps for protection from the sun.”

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn E. is 35 years old. She has 4 children and she has been the secretary of her union in LAPO for 5 years and an active client. She sells provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to people living in her community and the business gives her joy. Evelyn has been in this business for the past 5 years. She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$ 325 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She believes she can repay the loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs & drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Gilberto Félix

texts.es:
Gilberto is a young man with a great desire to get ahead in life. He is trying to get a start in life and save money so that he will be able to marry. He realizes that when this happens, he will be the principal income earner for his family, so he is preparing himself to assume that role. He has been working in agriculture for the past four years and, at the moment, he is working his parent’s land. Little by little, by working in each planting season and harvest season, he is saving his money so that he can eventually buy a large and fertile piece of land.

He lives in his parent’s house and shares the humble home with his mother, two younger brothers, and one of his sisters, who has a baby. He is in charge of the providing for them because of his father’s absence. The fields still aren’t completely planted due to the lack of capital for making investments. For this reason, he is hoping for help from your generous heart so that he can receive the loan amount he has requested for the purpose of buying a greater amount of seed and fertilizers. His goal is to increase his income, for the wellbeing of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilberto, es un joven con inmensas ganas de superación, está emprendiendo un prominente proyecto para formalizar su hogar posteriormente, él reconoce que cuando este hecho suceda se convertirá en el principal sustento de su familia y se está preparando asumiendo desde ya a cabalidad este rol.Desde hace cuatro años viene dedicándose a labor agrícola y por el momento está trabajando las tierras de sus padres; poco a poco con su desempeño en cada época de siembra y cosecha está ahorrando para adquirir un terreno de cultivo extenso y fértil. Aún vive en la casa de sus padres y comparte las humildes instalaciones de su hogar con su madre, dos de sus hermanos menores y una de sus hermanas con un pequeño bebé, él está a cargo de su manutención y bienestar por la ausencia de su padre. Los campos aún no están cultivados en su totalidad por la falta de capital de inversión, a raíz de este hecho solicita la ayuda de tu generoso corazón para obtener la suma que solicita y adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes a fin de obtener mayores ganancias para el bienestar de su querida familia.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Erika De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Erika de los Ángeles A. is a single woman, mother of one son, and she very much wants to develop her business in order to support her family and at the same time improve the quality of life in order to be able to provide an education to her son.

It is important to note that Mrs. A. has been a seamstress for 8 years, making clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, and shirts as well as curtains for the home. Her sales have grown due to the variety of products she offers. Her initial investment was US$3000 from savings.

Mrs. A. has worked with Ceprodel for a year and she feels very satisfied with the support, as she has been able to expand her business and satisfy her client’s needs. She has a history of five loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Erika de los Ángeles A. es una mujer Soltera madre de un niño, esta muy deseosa de desarrollar su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia y al mismo mejorar el nivel de vida para poder brindarle educación a su pequeño.

Es importante señalar que desde hace Ocho años la Sra. A. se dedica a la costura elaborando prendas de vestir como son Faldas, pantalones, blusas y camisas así como cortinas para uso del hogar, sus ventas incrementaron, debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece. Su capital de inicio fue de U$3,000.00 (dólares) de ahorros.

La Sra. A. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Un años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. Ella tiene un record de Cinco créditos.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make clothing.

loans.name: Jonikul

texts.ru:
Jonikul A. is 49 years old, has secondary education, married and has 4 children. Jonikul has been in animal husbandry for the past 12 years. He wants to use the loan to increase the number of heads of his cattle. He plans to sell each one after 40-45 days. He will use the profits to buy younger cattle and the rest of the money he will use to support his family.

Jonikul plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Артикулов Джоникул , возраст – 49 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Джоникул занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 12 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота. Он планирует продавать скот через каждые 40-45 дней. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать на приобретение нового молодого скота, а оставшиеся средства на содержание своей семьи.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying and selling of cattle

loans.name: Mbalwa A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Naluwaga M.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more hair oils and chemicals. Naluwaga is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a builder. She has 5 children ranging from age 7 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Naluwaga makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for the children. Naluwaga has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Naluwaga is joined in her small group by Eunice M., Gladys B., Catherine N., and Florence N.. Eunice M. has a business selling snacks and wants to boost business. Gladys B. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more stock. Catherine N. operates a business of poultry farming and wants to buy more chicks and chicken feed. Florence N. is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add in salon business and widen customer base

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia has not neglected her noble roots and decided to stay in her homeland of Tingo Paccha to build a life full of satisfaction. She is a humble farmer who year after year labors on the land to proviD. daily sustenance. She cultivates potatoes principally, and she also cares for animals. Her dedication to raising cows has helped her econically through tough times, especially when early freezes hurt her harvest. She desires to keep working and wishes to acquire larger quantities of feed for her animals and seeds for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Dalia, no ha negado sus nobles raíces y decidió quedarse en su tierra natal D. Tingo Paccha para construir una vida llena D. satisfacciones, es una humilD. agricultora que año tras año labró y sigue labrando la tierra que le provee del sustento diario para vivir, cultiva papa principalmente, y también está dedicada al cuidado D. sus animales, su dedicación por la crianza D. vacas le permite sostener la economía D. su hogar en tiempo D. escasez, más aún cuando en muchas oportunidades la helada perjudicaba su cosecha, ahora ella está muy deseosa D. seguir trabajando, y desea incrementar su capital D. trabajo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. comida balanceada y semillas para sus campos D. cultivo.

loans.use: Purchase feed for her cattle and seeds for her potato fields / Compra de comida balanceada para sus vaquitas y semillas para sus terrenos de cultivo.

loans.name: Afadule

texts.en: Afadule A. is fifty-eight years old and the mother of five children. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells local foods like banku, which is prepared from maize and eaten with either peanut or palm nut soups. She has a lot of customers because her meals are very delicious and nutritious. Through the business, she has managed to send three of her children to learn apprenticeships to provide them with better skills to earn a living. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, cartons of frozen fish, palm fruits, peanut butter, spices, etc., to avoid price hikes and also to increase sales. She plans to save from her income to build a house for her family. Afadule has a personal guarantor to repay the loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, beef, and frozen fish.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29 year-old Joyce K., who is married and has four children aged between 1 and 9. In 2007, Joyce established her poultry business. Working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $110 every month from this business. Joyce now requires a loan to purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics, and she hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $43. In the future, Joyce plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about ‘kuku,’ the Swahili word for ‘chickens.’ Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons that raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a widow. She has raised two sons, Alexander and Vasilyi, all by herself. Oksana works hard to provide for the needs of her family. Sometimes, she has to work long hours, running her men and women’s clothing sales business in the central market of Pavlograd. Oksana has been in this business for 15 years and presently is able to make about US$600 in net profit, as well as has goods in the inventory worth US$4,000.

Oksana has a flawless credit history with Nadiya Ukraine - she has always been very reliable in paying back her loans. Oksana also has talent in dealing with clients. She is cheerful and friendly to every potential buyer who comes to her kiosk. Currently, one of her business goals is to purchase summer footwear for sale. The profit that Oksana hopes to make she will invest in a much needed remodeling of her house.

loans.use: Purchase of summer footwear

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Doña Manuela L. T. is 31 years of age, is married and works as a buyer and seller of traditional clothing. Her business is located in the community of Caserio Chilopizab, Aldea Palacal in the Nahualá, Sololá region of Guatemala. She is well known in the community for her participation in all types of activity, for her generosity with the people, and for being a hard worker. She has earned the trust of everyone in the community, and thanks to her daily efforts to make progress she has established her small business. Because of her growing clientele, Manuela does not have the capital to keep up with the demand for her products. She saw the need to go to the ASDIR offices for a loan so that she could continue to meet the needs of her customers. Manuela is known in the community as a responsible person with good principles. Currently she employs one person in her business.

Translated by Melissa Hays, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Manuela López T. tiene 31 años de edad, es Unida, de oficio Comerciante (Compra y Venta de Ropa Típica) su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Caserío Chilopizab, Aldea Palacal, Nahualá, Sololá, y reside en la misma comunidad, actualmente es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad por su participación en todo tipo de actividad y su generosidad con las personas y por ser una persona muy trabajadora en la comunidad se ha ganado la confianza de toda la gente de su comunidad, y gracias a sus esfuerzos diarios por seguir adelante logro tener un pequeño negocio en Compra y Ventas de Ropa Típica, y con su buen comportamiento en la comunidad de Chuilopizab este negocio fue creciendo su demanda de clientes por tal razón que Doña Manuela López T. no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela, se vio en la necesidad de acudir a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR, para que su negocio siga creciendo y solo así las personas sigan percibiendo dicho beneficio que ofrece la señora Manuela López en su misma comunidad y tanto ella podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida. A doña Manuela, se le conoce en la comunidad como una persona responsable y de buenas principios como su participación y generosidad con las personas actualmente cuenta con 1 trabajador en su negocio de compra de ropa típica, la cual esto ha generado oportunidades de trabajo.

loans.use: Increase inventory  for her business of buying and selling traditional clothing

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly O. is a 53-year-old seller who sells groceries in Korkthlork Commune, Chykreng District, in the Siem Reap Province. She typically earns about 10,000 Riel (US$2.5) per day. Her husband, Mr. Sharin Soun, a 65-year-old farmer, earns approximately 4,000 Riel (US$1.00) per day. He has four children living in the family’s home. Two of his children are married, and one daughter is a garment worker in Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Ly would like to request a loan of 2,000,000 Riel (US$500) to purchase more grocery stocks to sell. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase a plot of farmland to expand their farming business. The loan allows her to improve her business to sustain her family's daily income. Mrs. Ly's husband is pictured with daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks to sell and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina E. S. tiene 46 años y vive en el caserío Campo Bello que pertenece al distrito de Mache en la provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Ella estudió  hasta el cuarto año de educación Primaria, porque solamente hasta ese grado había en la escuela donde asistía.
Es madre de tres hijos pero ya ninguno depende económicamente de Cristina.
Actualmente vende abarrotes en una pequeña bodega ubicada en su casa de Campo Bello, empezó con ese negocio porque en aquel tiempo era la única que tenía una tienda por la zona.
Recuerda que el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles, con los que compró abarrotes para surtir su negocio, los devolvió en 4 meses.
Manifiesta que ahora ya no se venden mucho los abarrotes, porque hay mucha competencia.
Con este préstamo de 2,500 soles, comprará una vaca con ternero para vender la leche y hacer quesillo.  El préstamo lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache y es una buena socia.
 Su gran sueño es tener un  bonito establo lleno de vacas y abastecer a toda su comunidad de buena leche.
texts.en:
Cristina E. S. is 46 years old and lives in the hamlet of Campo Bello, in the district of Mache of the province of Otuzco, which is in the departament of La Libertad, Peru. She only studied up to grade 4 as that was all her school offered. She has 3 children and none of them depend on her financially.

She currently sells household items in her tiny grocery store located in her home in Campo Bello. She started her business because at the time, it was the only store in that area. She remembers the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, 300 soles, she used to keep her store well stocked. She repaid it in 4 months. She says that she doesn't sell much now because there's a lot of competition.

With this loan of 2,500 soles ($1 US = 3 soles, approx.), she'll buy a cow and a calf in order to sell the milk and make curd. She'll repay the loan in 4 months.

Cristina is a member of the "Banco Comunal Mujeres" (Communal Women's Bank) of Mache and is a good associate. Her big dream is to own a beautiful stable full of cows and supply good milk to the entire community.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy diverse grocery items

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda inició el negocio después de que se divorcié tuvo la necesidad de meterse a trabajar para poder ayudarse, pero el salario era muy bajo por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 2003, cuando una amiga la convenció para que se dedicara al transporte escolar, ya que se dio cuenta que llevaba a algunos hijos de mis vecinos, le dio la idea de que hablara con sus mamás para llevarlos todos los días y que le pagaran semanal o quincenalmente. Siguió su consejo y en la actualidad transporta a 37 niños y gracias a las recomendaciones de las maestras, cada año tiene una lista de niños que transporta y le ha ido muy bien y gracias esto he podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar unas refacciones y afinar su camioneta, además que necesita rotularla, todo esto para brindar un servicio cómodo y seguro para sus pequeños clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda started the business after she got divorced as she needed to work to help herself, but the salary was very low. For this reason she decided to start her own business. She started her business in March 2003 when a friend convinced her to start a school transport service, as she realized that she took some of her neighbors kids to school and this gave her the idea of talking to some of the mums about taking their kids to school each day and they could pay her weekly or fortnightly. She followed this advice and now takes 37 kids to school thanks to recommendations from teachers, and each year she has a list of kids to take to school and it has gone very well for her and thanks to this she has moved forward.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, to buy spare parts and to tune up her bus, and she also needs to put a sign on it. All of this is to bring a more comfortable and safer service for her young clients.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tune up her bus/comprar refacciones y afinar su camioneta

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank. 
Prudencia is a single mother. She is 52 years old and has two children. She has a stand in the Magdalena market where she sells red meat, which she buys in the Nery Garcia market. Prudencia works from 6am to 2pm each day.  Prudencia needs a small loan of 800 soles to buy pork and mutton.  Prudencia’s dreams are to get ahead in life, for her children to grow up to be working professionals, and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Prudencia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Prudencia es madres soltera, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Prudencia tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne roja, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, las carnes los adquiere en el mercado Nery garcía.
Prudencia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de porcino y ovino.
Los sueños de Prudencia son salir adelante, sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio aumente.

loans.use: Buy pork and mutton

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phan Thị Lập tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2007. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại xã Gia Xuyên huyện Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm thuê còn chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và kinh  doanh hàng tạp hoá. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn  và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị Lập đạt khoảng 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập này  gia đình chị Lập cũng có thêm điều kiện để  cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm các mặt hàng tạp hoá về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phan Thị Lập has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. She currently lives with her husband and two young children in Gia Xuyên cummune, Gia Lộc district, Hải Dương province. Each day, her husband goes to work as a day labourer while she stays at home and raises animals and runs a small grocery. Thanks to her hard work and effective use of previous loans, Lập's family income is now about 3,000,000 VND per month. With this level of income, Lập's family now has the ability to improve their standard of living and to invest in their children's education. In the next lending cycle, she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to buy more goods to sell in her grocery shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoun S. was born in 1950. She and her husband, Heang Touch, 51, are residents of Siem Reap Province. They have five children, three of whom are single; another two are married and live away from their parents' home. Three of their children are employed; their first child is a fish seller, their second child raises pigs, and their third child is a construction worker.

The couple makes a living selling fish in the local Rolosh Market, collecting fish from fishermen and using a motorcycle to transport them to where they retail the fish. They normally earn an income approximately of US$ 10 per day and have been in their business since 2000. Recently, they are facing difficulties with their old motorbike that frequently has problems, thus they would like to ask for a US$ 500 loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace their existing one.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to replace their existing one which is often broken

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Delia es soltera, tiene 27 años y vive con sus padres, Delia es docente y trabaja en zonas rurales, Delia vende cosméticos por catalogaos sus productos los ofrece a sus amigos, colegas y sus ventas son al crédito.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1500 dinero que será invertido en la compra vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Los sueños de Delia son ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank Kantuta. Delia is single. She is 27 years old and she lives with her parents. Delia is a teacher and she works in rural areas. Delia sells cosmetics from catalogues. She offers her products to her friends, co-workers, and she takes orders on credit. Delia needs a loan of 1500, money that she would invest in the purchase of a cabinet to display her products. The dreams of Delia are to increase her business and to have a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cabinet to display merchandise

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three women who live in Battambang Province. The leader is K., 28, who has two very young children. K.'s husband Sovann, 33, works in an organization with a salary of $80 a month. K. sells various kinds of breakfast foods such as rice with pork, porridge, and noodles. She gets up early every morning to prepare the foods she sells. She has gained a lot of customers. Now Konthera is looking for a loan of $300 to buy tables, chairs, and other equipment for her shop. She dreams of having a good house and providing her children with a good education. 

The two other members of the group are: 
H., 51, who has a shop where she serves breakfast foods. She is applying for a loan to renovate her shop. 
S., 34, who is sells groceries. She is looking a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and other equipment

loans.name: Mr. Meng Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Meng T. is the 49 year old village bank president. He and his wife, M.. Chhun Bunthon, are cooks who are hired to cook at wedding ceremonies, festival ceremonies, parties, etc. This couple has eleven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are laborers at pig breeding businesses. Four are attending the local school and the remaining stay at home because they are too young to work or study. Mr. Meng T. is requesting a loan to buy sugar cane to make juice and start a business to earn more income. 

Six members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane to make juice and start a business to earn more income.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children. Currently two are in school, and the eldest is a taxi driver. She lives in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Vida is very hardworking and dedicated to the upbringing of her children. She sells sweet potatoes and maize. And it is this business that has supported her family. 

Vida distributes the food stuffs to her customers on a credit basis. She takes delivery of stock from the surrounding farming communities and has been in this business for two years now. She needs a loan to buy more sweet potatoes and bags of maize so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance. Vida belongs to a group called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help'. She also hopes to receive the loan to progress her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy bunches of potatoes and bags of maize.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla S. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale dans un quartier populaire de Lomé. Elle détient ce commerce depuis 3 ans. Elle a une forte potentialité d’accroître son commerce car la concurrence n’est pas forte dans sa zone d’intervention. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour augmenter ses recettes afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla S., age 45, is married and the mother of four. She is the owner of a grocery shop in a working-class district of Lomé. She has been in this business for three years. She has a strong potential for growing her commerce because competition is not strong in her area of operation. She is counting on this opportunity to increase her receipts in order to respond better to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti

texts.en:
Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti (DNR.M-0661) is 24 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti has successfully repaid the previous loan of 1,0000,000 IDR taken from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from DINARI. Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family members.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti - (DNR.M-0661) merupakan 24 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Yeni Kisyanti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité “Primicia” se formo con la intencion de progreso y superacion de sus integrantes.  La mayoria ya realizan una actividad productiva y reciben un crédito promedio de 500.000.  El credito lo va a utilizar para ampliar y diversificar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta de bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc. 

Todas las integrantes desean que sus hijos no pasen las mismas carencias acdemicas y laborales que ellas pasaron por eso se esfuerzan el doble para lograr sus objetivos.

Las integrantes son:  

Zunilda P..  	Vta de mercaderías  varias. 
Marcia G.. 	Modista.  
Graciela A.. 	Vta de carbón. 
Pabla G.. 	Vta de cosméticos.  
Lourdes M.. 	Vta de artesanias.  
Luz A..	Vta de artesania.  
Norma E..  	Vta de ropas. 
Maria P.. 	Vta de artesania.  
Sol y mar G..	Vta de comestibles.  
Lourdes L..	Vta de merceria.  
Anatolia E.. 	Vta de Chipas.  
Susana P.. 	Vta de comestibles.  
Balbina A.. 	Vta de ropas.  
Lilian F.. 	Vta de chipas.  
Mercedes E.. 	Fca y venta de productos de limpieza.  
Blanca B..  	Vta de comestibles.  
Claudia F..	Vta de comestibles.
texts.en:
The members formed the Primicia committee with the intention of progressing and improving. The majority of them are involved in activities that are productive, and their average loan is $99. The loan is to increase and diversify their current activities. For example, to make meals they will buy milk, sugar, herbs, flour, salt, bread, and vegetables. They will also buy drinks such as soft drinks, beer, wine, etc. to sell. All of the members hope that their children do not experience the same lack of education and jobs that they have experienced. This is why they work twice as hard to achieve their objectives. The members are: Zunilda P.. Sells various merchandise Marcia G.. Seamstress Graciela A.. Sells coal Pabla G.. Sells cosmetics Lourdes M.. Sells handicrafts Luz A.. Sells handicrafts Norma E.. Sells clothes Maria P.. Sells handicrafts Sol y mar G.. Sells food Lourdes L.. Sells merchandise Anatolia E.. Sells chipas, a typical corn-bread street snack in Paraguay Susana P.. Sells food Balbina A.. Sells clothes Lilian F.. Vta Sells chipas Mercedes E.. Makes and sells cleaning products Blanca B.. Sells food Claudia F.. Sells food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, bread.  Make and sell typical food like sausages, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum S., 42, has been chosen to be a group leader of this loan by the other members. Chum S. is a widowed mother blessed with four children; all four children are teenagers and live in the family home. Two of her children are employed in different occupations: a daughter is a staff member for hotel and a son works in building place. At the moment, Chum S. sells flowers and decorating equipment by mobile transportation. She will be using this loan to order extra flowers to sell and the rest to repair her old house that needs repairs. The other borrowers who have joined this loan are:
K., will use the loan to buy zinc to cover the roof of her house.
M., is a rice seller, asking for a loan to order rice in bulk and re-sell to gain income. 
S. is a massage therapist for a hotel and requests a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To order extra flowers to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga and her husband live happily in the village of Nabbotuan Solana, Cagayan, where farming is the main livelihood of most residents. Her husband has a skill in woodcarvings and carpentry thus, sometimes works in that type of labor on a part-time basis. They are blessed with 10 children who serve as their inspiration to improve their humble living conditions. 

Raising pigs in their backyard is her source of income. In lieu of this, she is borrowing a loan of PHP15,000 from Kiva lenders to support her hog raising business financially and to buy enough supply of feed to further grow her livestock. She hopes that through this, she can help her husband generate more income for the studies of their children, which she really wants to give their children more than anything else.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
Bosede lives in Lagos. She sells hair extensions and she is also a stylist. Bosede learned her business in 3 years and she has been in the business since the year 1985. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children.

Bosede has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years and the loans have helped her to increase her productivity and profitability. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Namerta

texts.es:
Namerta es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Namerta es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Namerta viaja a las diferentes ferias en donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra queso, animales menores, productos que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Namerta tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Namerta necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños D. Namerta son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Namerta is a member of Kusikuy Village Bank, which means be happy in quechua.

She is a 36-year-old married mother of four children and makes a living traveling to different markets to sell fruits, where she also buys cheese and young animals to sell in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, she has a small grocery store at home.

Namerta requests a loan of 1050 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil.

Her dreams are to educate her children so that they can become professionals and also to buy a car for the transport of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Madolyn

texts.en:
Madolyn P. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Madolyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Madolyn is just starting this business.

Madolyn joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Madolyn plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura  composé de femmes : 3 mariées et 2 célibataires, avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Sanoubougou 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe, le premier a été correctement remboursé. 
Elles font comme activités  la vente de pagnes en bazin, des fruits, des tissus et de  l’atiécké dans le cadre de la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  6 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 6 sacs d’oranges, 3 cartons de pommes, 4 sacs d’ananas, 4 balles de tissus,  2 sacs d’atiécké et quelques paquets de condiments pour  la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les différents marchés de façon fixe et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres ouvrir un magasin de vente.

loans.use: Achat de divers articles.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 38-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has owned a clothes shop since 2002 to earn income to help her husband in the household. Today, Suzanne is requesting to borrow $1000 to purchase more merchandise to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es:
El socio Wilbert, es natural de la provincia de Quillabamba, el pertenece al banco comunal,” Fuerza Compartida”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de huanchac.

Nuestro socio tiene 35 años de edad, el tiene 1 hijo y esta separado; el trabaja en comercio minorista, nuestro socio tiene un stand de venta de frutas, el socio trae de Quillabamba las frutas a la ciudad del Cusco, nuestro socio trabaja vendiendo frutas en el mercado mayorista virgen asunta, el socio es nuevo en este banco y recién está aprendiendo la mecánica de trabajo de bancos comunales. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en su mercadería, trayendo más frutas que de costumbre.

El socio agradece la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y de este modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Wilbert is a member of the communal bank "Fuerza Compartida," which is located in the city of Cusco in the Huanchac district. He is originally from the province of Quillabamba. He is 35 years old, and is separated with one son. He works in retail trade; he has a fruit business where he brings fruits from Quillabamba to the city of Cusco and sells the fruits in the wholesale market "Virgen Asunta." He is a new member of this bank, and is learning the mechanics of working with a communal bank. He needs a loan to invest in his merchandise, so that he can bring more fruit than usual. He is grateful for the opportunity that is provided through these means, and is committed to making the payments on his debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase gumboots and other shoes to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia vende muebles de madera y ferretería en el segundo paradero de san Sebastián; el esposo de nuestra socia es carpintero y ella vende todos los fines de semana en esta feria los muebles que su esposo hace, desde sillas, camas, armarios, roperos, mesas, cómodas, veladores y mucho mas. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar madera al por mayor y así seguir fabricando muebles y trabajando juntos por el bien de su familia.


Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Yolanda, belongs to the bank "ALLIN MUJU", located in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. She is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her various household chores with her business, selling wooden furniture and hardware at the second stop in San Sebastian. Her husband is a carpenter, and every weekend at this fair she sells the furniture that he makes, including chairs, beds, wardrobe closets, tables, dressers, night stands, and much more. Our partner is requesting this loan to be able to buy wood wholesale and thereby continue making furniture and working together with her husband for the good of their family. She is thankful for and values the loan granted through this medium, and likewise is committed to fulfilling her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood wholesale

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: S. Alimatou est née en 1969 à Dassa dans les collines au Bénin. Mariée à GOUNDOMEDE Barthélémy, Alimatou est mère de quatre enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec leurs parents au quartier Tokpota à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Alimatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Alimatou a fait seulement le cours primaire. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Alimatou vend des produits vivriers (riz, maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, etc.) et des divers (savons, sucre, piles, conserves, omo, etc.) dans sa boutique sise au carrefour Ave Maria à Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. C’est en vue de renforcer son capital et d’accroître son activité en cette période de fêtes de fin d’année, que Alimatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Alimatou was born in 1969 in Dassa in the hills of Benin.  Married to GOUNDOMEDE Barthélémy, she is the mother of four children, of whom three are in her care.  All of the children are in school and live with their parents in the Tokpota district in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  Alimatou works in aid of her husband to support the family. Alimatou attended primary school only.  For twenty years, she has sold staple foods (rice, corn, cassava flour, etc.) and a variety of goods (soaps, sugar, batteries, canned foods, Omo, etc.) in her shop found at the Ave Maria crossroad in Porto-Novo. She is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid the two loans she obtained from ALIDé.  With the aim of bolstering her capital and growing her business during this year-end holiday period, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grains (sacks of corn and rice), and various goods (boxes of soap, canned foods, sugar)

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Ms. Aisha N. is a resident of Kukyeka Kamukuzi division in Mbarara district. She is a businesswoman and owns a grocery shop which she has been operating for over five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery items (drinks, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and so forth) to meet the demands of her customers. She is a widow and runs her business on her own. She hopes to earn enough from her business to be able to afford to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
El Sr. Catalino O. de 56 años de edad, esta casado hace 27 años con la Sra. Eva Nuñez de 53 años de edad. 
El matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales los dos mayores ya están casado y los restantes de 22,20, 17 y 13 están viviendo con su padre y solo la menor de todos sigue estudiando actualmente termino su 6to. 
Grado y el resto ya culminó su secundaria, todos están trabajando con su padre en la carpintería, la señora es empleada del Instituto de Previsión Social, y están viendo la forma de hacer estudiar el año próximo a sus hijos una carrera universitaria.
El Sr. Catalino tiene este negocio de carpinteria y aserradero hace 25 años, prepara diferentes tipo de muebles y que luego comercializa con las mueblerias y también realiza cortes de maderas en su aserradero. 
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas,  terciadas, clavos, pegamentos y con eso poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
56-year old Sr. Catalino O. has been married for 27 years to his wife Sra. Eva Nuñez who is 53 years old. They have six children, the two oldest are already married, and the remaining ones are 22, 20, 17, and 13 and live at home. Only the youngest daughter is still in school and has finished 6th grade. The others completed high school and are now working with their father in his carpentry business. His wife works at the Ministry of Social Services. They are hoping to find a way for their children to go to university next year. Sr. Catalino has had his carpentry and sawmill business for 25 years. He makes different kinds of furniture and then sells it to furniture shops. He also cuts wood in his sawmill. He is asking for a loan to buy wood, plywood, nails, and adhesive so that he can complete all the orders that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy carpentry supplies

loans.name: Intiquilla Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIQUILL.” situado en L. ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito D. Huanchac a 15 minutos D. L. plaza central D. esta ciudad. 

Nuestros socios tiene más D. 3 años en este banco comunal, ellos son 15 miembros activos, los cuales comparten sus diferentes actividades con el comercio, L. mayoría se dedica a L. artesanía, estos socios necesitan el dinero para L. compra D. materia prima para L. elaboración D. sus trabajos hechos en arcillas, otro grupo pequeño D. socios solicitan el dinero para comprar ropa al por mayor D. L. ciudad D. Lima y traerL. a vender a L. ciudad del Cusco, L. cual no tiene fábricas D. ropas, otros dos socios necesitan el préstamo para pequeños gastos en el hogar hasta que el sueldo D. jubilados que tienen por ser docentes les llegue y D. este modo estar pagando poco a poco su deuda.

Nuestros socios agradecen y les hacen llegar  un enorme abrazo y los mejores deseos para este nuevo año y se comprometen n cumplir con los pagos D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the “IntiquilL.” Communal Bank, which is in the city of Cusco, Huanchac District, and located 15 minutes away from the main city square. This Communal Bank has been in existence for more than three years and currently has 15 active members. They participate in different commercial activities, but the majority sells handicrafts. These members need funding to buy raw materials for making works of clay. Another small group of members needs a loan to buy clothing in bulk. Two other members are requesting funding to help pay small household expenses. They are retired school teachers who are using this as an opportunity to gradually pay off their debts. The members are appreciative and wish to offer a big hug and best wishes for the New Year. They promise to complete their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials, supplies, and merchandise for their various businesses

loans.name: Lyn Ang's Group

texts.en: Lyn A. is from the village of Culpan. She is 65 years old. Lyn is the group leader of a 2 member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Lyn is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lyn owns & operates a snack vending business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Lyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His youngest daughter, who is 13 years old, attends a local secondary school, and his wife helps with the family business. 

Ganbaatar operates a taxi service in his town. He transports people from Arhangai province to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ganbaatar started his taxi service business in 2005 and besides his transportation business, he manages a consumer goods trading business in order to supplement his earnings. He says, "I am working hard in order to save some money for my children." He is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and some consumer goods for his other business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Mr. Him Soen Group

texts.en:
Him S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members of the loan; they all will use the loan for different purposes. This village bank loan has 20 members, who are villagers in Prey Totong village in Kandal province. 

Him S. and his wife, Sokchan Chork, are farmers who own a small plot of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family. The idea is to provide the farmland with proper care, so that the crops will produce the best possible sale price when the time comes to sell them. Thus, Him S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel for his crop field. He is the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the other is too young to go to school or work. All the members are shown in the picture, but some faces are just slightly blocked by others.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel for crops

loans.name: Gregorio Arsenio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio Arsenio A. R., tiene la edad de 41 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos domésticos, él es albañil y tienen bajo su responsabilidad a 4 niños, son una familia de recursos muy escazos, que solicitan apoyo par mejorar dia a dia su estado social.

El lugar donde ellos habitan es muy humilde y reporta un alto índice de inseguridad social, dentro de los principales anhelos de la familia es el mejorar la infraestructura del hogar, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y de esta manera comnezar la edificación de un muro trasero en su hogar y de esta manera ofrecerle a su familia una mayor seguridad y la tranquilidad personal de ofrecerles a ellos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Gregorio Arsenio A. R. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. He is married and his wife performs the domestic work. Gregoria works as a mason and is responsible for his four children. His family resources are very scarce, so the support he is requesting will improve his daily social status.

The place where they live is very modest and is situated in an area that reports a high rate of social insecurity. Improving the infrastructure of the home is the main desire of his family, which is why this loan is being requested. Gregorio will buy construction materials to begin building a wall behind his house to provide his family with better security and peace of mind, as well as offering better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall behind his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of wheat in bulk

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is made by four modest women living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sok H., 54, has been selected as group leader by the other members. She and her husband are good parents who are blessed with four children; two are married and have already started new families and the other two are single and attend school. The family earns their daily income by fishing in and around the Tunle Sap River and selling their catch at the local market. They have been fishing for more than 19 years and earn around $5 per day to meet their family’s needs. Sok H. always uses an old boat when fishing. Unfortunately, her boat has broken and the fishing action has been suspended for a while, so her income has been affected. To solve the problem, Sok H. has requested a loan in order to repair her broken boat. The other three borrowers are:
- V., who will use the loan to buy a used boat for fishing;
- S., who also requests a loan to repair her fishing boat; and
- K., who is applying for a loan to add to her savings to build a house.

loans.use: To repair her broken boat.

loans.name: Samuel Muiru

texts.en:
Samuel Muiru is 30 years old and is married to Irine Wamboi, a 21 year old business lady. They live in Kabarnet Town and have three children: Michael (6 years, Top Class), Mary (3 yrs: Baby Class), and Jane (9 months old).

Samuel runs a boutique, which he started eight years ago. Residents of Kabarnet Town are his clients. He gets a monthly profit of KES 50,000 from the boutique. He was introduced to KADET by one of KADET's clients. He has never borrowed from another source before. 

Samuel has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET. He will USE KES 30,000 to purchase new clothes, KES 5,000 to purchase bags and KES 5,000 for shoes. All these items are for resale.

If this loan boosts his business, Samuel will use the extra profit to open a M-PESA mobile money transfer business. His hopes and dreams is to open a M-PESA shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock.

loans.name: Auxiliadora De La Cruz

texts.es:
Auxiliadora de la Cruz A. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y decidida quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, calzado, plástico, truchas etc.  Este negocio lo inicio en 1998 vendiendo ambulante actualmente tiene un pequeño local en Rivas.

A. es una madre abnegada que ha trabajado arduo por sacar adelante a sus seis hijos de los cuales solo el menor de diez años  depende de ella. Esta invertirá el crédito en mercadería para mejorar las ventas especialmente porque se acerca el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora de la Cruz A. is a hard-working, dedicated, and determined woman. She sells clothes, footwear, plastic, and trout, etc. She started this business as a street vendor in 1998. She currently has a small place in Rivas. A. is a self-sacrificing mother. She has worded arduously to get her six children ahead. Only her ten year old child is still dependent upon her. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to improve sales, especially because Mother’s Day is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing, footwear, plastic, and trout

loans.name: Ndèye Sow

texts.fr: Ndèye Sow W. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis 2002. Elle est vendeuse de bijoux et d'encens, elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle tire profit de l'existence du marché hebdomadaire pour s'approvisionner en marchandises et ensuite vendre dans les villages environnants. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise de la famille tout en renforcent son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ndèye Sow W. is a 40 year old married mother of four young children. She has been a member of the DIAOBE MANDING Banc Villageois since 2002, and has been selling jewelry and incense for over five years. She buys merchandise at the weekly market and then sells it in local villages. She helps her husband support the family and adds to his savings.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios D. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 42 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios runs a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Remedios is just starting this business.

In 2005, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen A. has spent her entire life cultivating crops on her own land. She specializes in growing potatoes, a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young.
