She also harvests the crops when they are mature and sells them in bulk to local industries that turn them into snack foods. Chhen A. is now married and has four school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing potatoes is an annual operation with which she has had great success for several years. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Chhen A. wants to plant the next potato crop since the farming season is approaching, but Chhen A. doesn’t have capital to use on her farm. So, she decided to borrow a loan from Kiva to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith L. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: pig fattening and fishing. She lives in Prk 1 Pasil, Malabugas, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,700. 

Judith is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can use it as additional capital for her pig fattening business. This will be her 14th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Judith aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Bok Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK XALAAT est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame FATMA THIOUBOU D., debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de grand boubou en thioup, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants.

Elle achète des matelas et chaises qu'elle met en location. En plus de çà elle vend du gaz butane en bouteille. Elle fait également de l'élevage de poulets de chaire (par lot de 50 sujets). Elle a une expérience de 05 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter ses chaises et matelas et des poussins et aliment de volaille pour l’élevage. 
Son objectif est d’augmenter son niveau d'épargne. Participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale. Par ailleurs, acheter une bâche afin de confectionner une tente et de la mettre en location.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok Xalaat was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 10 women who are all from the same neighborhood. They know each other from friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Fatma Thioubou D., standing on the right side in the photo, wearing a Grand Boubou made of thioup, is the group's leader. She is 57 years old. She is married and has 9 children. She buys mattresses and chairs that she rents. In addition, she also sells bottled butane gas. She raises chickens for their meat (in groups of 50). She has been doing this for 5 years. With her loan she is going to buy more chairs and mattresses, along with baby chicks and chicken feed. Her goal is to increase her sales and to help take care of her family's expenses. She would also like to buy a tarp so she can make a tent and rent it out.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her business

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mr Enkhjargal T. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children ages 1, 9, and 18 in a suburb of Darkhan (the second largest city in Mongolia). He has been running a taxi business since 2008. Before 2008 he used to make noodles and sell them in the local market. But he had to close the business because it had a too many competitors and he could not make a decent income. Now his taxi business is the only source of family income. His wife is looking after the baby. His eldest son Dorjrencen,18 studies in an auto mechanic’s course and graduates this December. His other son, Buyandorj, age 9 attends a local public school. Mr Enkhjargal is planning to sell his old car and buy another second hand one because of the safety regulations of the  transportation authority. The loan he is requesting will be used to replace his old car for newer second hand one in better condition.

loans.use: To replace his old car with newer second hand one in better condition

loans.name: Namataba Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
In Namataba-Mukono, there is a sand quarry that is well known for employing energetic youth who work hard everyday to make ends meet. Out of curiosity, I took it upon myself to visit this riveting place. There is a semblance of beehive activity as young people go about their work. 

M. Muhammed, who started the quarry three years ago, is a good humored and easily approachable lad who has one child. He belongs to the Namataba Development  group. He traces his business roots to selling maize or corn, which he says was of paramount importance in getting him on his feet. He makes 80,000 shillings a week. Muhammed also ekes further profits from selling fresh food. 

Paying the employees of his quarry has been an experience that has often dampened and played havoc with the smooth operations of his business. This loan will help him pay his employees.

loans.use: To pay salaries of the manpower he employs

loans.name: Nassulu

texts.en:
M. Nassulu is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school.  Nassulu has a business of a retail shop, which he has had for 9 years.         

To help expand his business, Nassulu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items like soap and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Nassulu hopes to generate greater profits and take care of his family.  In the future, Nassulu hopes to add more to his business by buying more inventory like soap and sugar.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Grace Jemaiyo

texts.en:
Grace Jemaiyo M. is 40 years old and married to Samwel Kerebei, who is a farmer. They have five school-going children between the ages of five and 17. They live in Cheplasgei Eldoret, Kenya. Grace has been operating a general store for the past four years and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES.

Grace learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area. She is applying for her fourth loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, eight bags of sugar and 10 crates of soda. With the anticipated profits she plans to buy a posho mill machine.

In the future, her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar and soda

loans.name: Daisy Jamileth

texts.es:
Daisy es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla, provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil convivientes y tiene 01 hijo, la señora actualmente sigue estudiando.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, nos cuenta que su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de perfumes, polvos entre otros para su negocio

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la unión y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Daisy is a member of the Mujeres Triunfadoras community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is 22 years old and partnered with one child.  She is in school now.

Daisy approached Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a loan 2 years ago and she tells us that she first borrowed S/.500 new soles, money that she used to stock her beauty products business.  She will use this loan of S/.1,500 new soles to buy perfumes, powders, etc. for the same business.

Daisy's greatest hope for the future is to own a store of her own.

What she most likes about the community bank are the meetings and the fellowship.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Yolanda Patricia

texts.es:
la señora Yolanda Patricia C. C. tiene 33 años de edad y vive en union libre con el señor Roger Alberto C. con quien tiene dos hijos, doña Yolanda es una mujer luchadora que se dedica al comercio, tiene casa propia en donde tiene una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia Dos Hermanos.
sus clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
su deseo es que su familia este bien de salud.
texts.en:
Yolanda Patricia C. C. is 33 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Roger Alberto C.. They have two children. Yolanda has a fighting spirit and works in business. 

She has her own home where she has a convenience store that operates under the name “Two Brothers” convenience store. Her clients like her for her kindness. The store is open from Monday through Sunday. In her business, she sells everything related to the basic basket of goods a family needs. 

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her store. Her wish is for her family to have good health.

loans.use: To purchase beans, lard, oil, margarine, refreshments, coffee, bread, cookies, soaps, pastas, pills, condiments, toothpaste, toilet paper, juices, sardines, chili, flour, and sanitary napkins

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Célestin M. est commerçant.  Il est célibataire, et son niveau d’éducation est l’année 7eme.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les œufs et les vendre.  Son stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, est la diversification des produits.  Il voudrait l’augmentation ou la capacité d’accueillir beaucoup de clients.  Il voudrait aussi se marier dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Célestin M. is a merchant.  He is single and has had seven years of schooling.  He is going to use his loan to buy eggs to sell.  His strategy for growth is to increase his savings and to diversify his products. He would like to attract a larger clientele.  He also hopes to marry in the future.

loans.use: to buy and resell eggs

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: Lem C., 48, is a housewife. C. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a security guard, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase used clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Tek

texts.en: Tek S., 38 years old, owns a small shop located in a parking lot in Banteay Meanchey province, where she sells different soft drinks and exchanges foreign currency. Tek S. runs her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. She typically makes around $8 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She was married, but she divorced from her husband many years ago. She has one child who drives a motor taxi. Presently, Tek S. wishes to have more funds to buy more drinks for sale and to replace an old motor-bike for her son. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale and replace an old motor-bike for her son.

loans.name: Samuel Churu

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last six years. He is 32 years old, married to Josephine Wanjiku and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertiliser and pesticides for his farm.

In the future, Samuel hopes to expand his snow peas business to a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy fertliser and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Flambeau Group

texts.fr:
Louis est le coordinateur de son groupe Flambeau.

Louis habite dans la région Limonade d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Louis a dirigé son commerce de sous-vêtements pendant les dernières 5 années.

Louis voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de vêtements a revendre..

Louis espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à ouvrir un grand shop parce que maintenant il vend ses vêtements dans le marche.

Des autres membres de Flambeau ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits cosmétiques et du charbon.

Louis dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause de chômage.

Louis dit que son rêve est de voyager a Panama pour qu’il achète plus de sous-vêtements moins chers et d’une meilleure qualité.
texts.en:
Louis is the coordinator of his group called "Flambeau" (Torch). He lives in the region of Haiti known as "Limonade" where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He has run his little business selling underwear for the past five years. He would like to use this loan to invest in more underwear for resale. He hopes that this loan will help him to open a big shop since he presently sells his clothing in the marketplace. 

The other members of "Flambeau" need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics and charcoal. 

Louis says his primary challenge is that he lacks repeat customers because people are out of work. His dream is to travel to Panama to buy more underwear at cheaper prices and in better quality.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Ma. Rosemie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosemie is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: charcoal sales and food production/sales. Her husband Edwin, who is 33 years old, works as a bus driver to earn his living.  They have three children who are between 5 and 9 years old. Ma. Rosemie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Rosemie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ma. Rosemie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. sells salt in both small and large quantities at the Jukwa Market, a major market near Abura, Cape Coast. She has made her living this way for five years. She was educated up to junior high school level. 

Esi is married to a blacksmith and her earnings help pay for their four children’s school fees as well as household expenses. With the goal of expanding her business, Esi will use the loan to purchase additional bags of salt to supply her customers. She plans to save the new profits earned from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of salt to sell.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “Mapuamulen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica a la extracción de mariscos del mar, rubro que desempeña desde hace 12 años, en compañía de sus hijos, quienes se encargan de bucear, para adquirir los productos del mar. Su horario es flexible, ya que ella  sólo se encarga de vender lo extraído y reponer la implementación utilizada; específicamente trajes de buzo, mangueras, redes, para la extracción del producto. 
Adriana en éste momento se encuentra sin bote, ya que a causa del terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero de 2010, lo perdió completamente, por ahora sus hijos se encargan de arrendar el transporte (bote con motor compresor), ya que es muy costoso adquirir otro. 
Con el préstamo comprará mangueras y dos pares de aletas.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y así pueda invertir en él, de manera independiente. Su anhelo a nivel personal es ampliar su casa y cocina, además de decorarla. Por lo que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son específicamente para concretar sus sueños. 
Adriana está muy agradecida de los créditos obtenidos por Fondo esperanza, ya que con estos préstamos ella ha progresado en su negocio y ha podido superar diferentes obstáculos. Debido a esto ha invertido en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos. Respecto a las capacitaciones ella ha aprendido a distribuir mejor sus ingresos.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Adriana belongs to the Mapuamulen Communal Bank, located in the city of Concepcion.  She has been extracting seafood from the ocean for some 12 years now.  Her children assist her; they are in charge of diving for the products of the sea.  Her schedule is flexible, since she only sells what is extracted, and replenishes equipment; specifically, diving suits, hoses, and nets to extract the product.

At present, Adriana lacks a boat, due to the earthquake of February 27th, 2010, which completely destroyed hers.  Now, her children lease a boat with a motor-compressor, since it is very expensive to buy one.  With this loan, she will purchase diving hoses and 2 pairs of flippers.

Adriana's dream is for her business to grow and to be able to invest in it in an independent manner.  Her personal wish is to expand her house and kitchen, and to decorate them.  So, her motives for wishing to continue in the business are specifically to realize her dreams.

Adriana is very grateful for the loans she has obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since with these, her business has progressed and she has been able to overcome different obstacles.  It has made it possible for her to invest in her business and generate greater income.  As a result of the training classes, she has learned to better distribute her income.

Concepcion is located at the mouth of the Biobio River, one of the country's largest.  The region is in the south of Chile.  It has been important in Chile's history as the location of many battles and sieges, especially during the Arauco War, due to its location on the frontier of Mapuche territory.  At present, the city is undergoing important economic and demographic development, becoming one of Chile's most relevant urban, administrative, financial and commercial centers, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: TO BUY DIVING HOSES AND TWO PAIRS OF FLIPPERS FOR FISHING

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
El señor Marvin es un hombre trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor de 36 años. Él tiene una pulpería y una agencia de lotería. El inicio con la venta de loterías hace 7 años y luego con las ganancias puso una pequeña venta.
Él tiene tres hijos los cuales  son su inspiración para seguir adelante y el invertirá el crédito en mercadería para la pulpería.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 36-year-old hard-working, striving, enterprising man. He has a general store and a lottery agency.  Marvin began selling lottery tickets some 7 years ago, and with the earnings, he set up a small booth.

Marvin has 3 children who are his inspiration to forge ahead. He will invest the loan in merchandise for his general store.

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, DRINKS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 37 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and her husband is in business. They have two children aged 21 and 20 who are living on their own. 

For ten years Aminata has run a small shop where she sells soap, bread, drinks and other products. She opened the shop with the help of her husband and likes being in business because it makes her respected in the community. 

Aminata has requested a loan to purchase more soap, bread and drinks. In the future, she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim B. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Ibrahim has a small retail shop business, which he has run for over ten years. He also has a second business operating a video hall.
To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ibrahim hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale.

loans.name: Hortencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hortencia de 46 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos, con su propio negocio la venta de tortilla y con más de cinco años en la venta con el fin de poder apoyar  a su familia.
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa que junto a su esposo lo han logrado. Pero aun le falta lo que recurre al financiamiento para poder terminar el cuarto, lo que repellara, y pondrá techo. Siendo Afodenic una puerta al desarrollo para la conclusión de su casa.
Materiales a comprar: arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, láminas de zinc, perlines, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en: Hortencia is 46 years old, married, and she is the mother of four children. She has had her own tortilla business for the past 5 years. Her goal is to support her family. Her objective has been to build a house and she has managed it together with her husband. But she still needs a loan to finish a bedroom. She will plaster it and add a roof. Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) is a door to finishing the construction of their house. Materials to buy include: sand, construction blocks, steel, zinc sheets, rebars, and to cover the labor expenses.

loans.use: to finish building a room to improve the living space of her family.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar, 56, is a married construction worker specialized in cement making and building. He works hard to do everything in his projects, including building, blending cement and making the cement covering. Ammar is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy raw materials needed to make his cement blend.

Ammar is an honest and good standing borrower who works hard to please his customers. He is a hard worker and seeks perfection in his business. He  hopes to expand his work and widen the region in which he sells cement.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino D. 59 años convive con Leonarda D. 48 años con quien tiene 6 hijos, juntos  residen en el centro poblado D. Canayre ubicado en L. majestuosa selva ayacuchana donD. tienen su casa propia. A pesar D. no tener una profesión, los conocimientos lo adquirió con los años D. experiencia, por algo ya lleva casi 45 años en L.  actividad agrícoL., donD. aprendió las técnicas D. cosecha y post cosecha y el manejo agronómico y esto es gracias a sus padres y por tal los agradece eternamente. Actualmente cultiva y comercializa cacao y café a los grandes mayoristas, negocio que le esta dando buenos resultados económicos, pero sabe que aún hay por continuar explotando en este negocio. Generalmente el trabaja por cuenta propia durante 12 horas diarias, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. sus familiares. Sus planes a futuro es D. aperturar una tienda D. abarrotes, con el propósito D. tener una ventaja competitiva con respecto a las demás comerciantes, además D. aplicar estrategias D. venta como ofrecer productos D. calidad a un bajo precio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Constantino se siente a gusto con el trabajo D. su banco comunal ya que todos lo acogieron con mucha cordialidad. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles, Constantino desea invertir en su siguiente siembra, por ello va a fertilizar y arar L. tierra.
texts.en:
Constantino is 59 years old and lives with his partner, 48 year-old Leonarda.  The couple have six children and live together in their own home, in the village of Canayre, which is located in the majestic Ayacucho jungle.

In spite of not having a profession, Constantino has gained knowledge through years of experience.  He has been farming for almost 45 years now.  He learned how to manage his crops, harvest his crops and deal with them once harvested from his parents and for this he is eternally grateful to them.  Constantino currently grows and sells cacao and coffee to big wholesalers.  His business is providing him with good financial results but he knows that there is always still work to be done in this business.  Generally, Constantino works by himself for 12 hours a day but sometimes he receives help from his family members.  His plan for the future is to open a grocery store with the aim of having a competitive advantage over the other store owners, applying sales strategies such as offering good-quality products at a low price. 

This is Constantino's first loan from MFP and he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  He feels happy with the work of his community bank since they all welcomed him with a lot of warmth.  Constantino would like to invest his 1,000 Peruvian soles in his upcoming sowing season when he will fertilize and plow the earth.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize his land

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casada  e mãe de 1 filho de 3 anos de idade. Fez a 10ª classe e parou porque perdeu a vaga quando engravidou. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e comerciante permanente a mais de 4 anos e tem um rendimento de 12.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhos que tambem sao clientes  este e o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria para o seu negocio (cervejas, oleo, refrescos,vinhos, e outros ),o primeiro emprestimo foi de : 8.000.00mt.
sonho e casar oficialmente com a sua esposa, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Angelica was born in the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo in southerin Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of one son, who is 3-years-old.  She studied through the 10th grade and stopped because she lost her spot when she got pregnant.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She never left Maputo.  She has had a business for more than 4 years.  She makes 12,000 meticals a month that she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of the institution.  This is her second loan in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to buy merchandise for her business (beer, oleo, soft drinks, wine, etc.).  Her first loan was for 8,000 meticals.

Her dream is to officially marry her husband, for which she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (beer, oleo, soft drinks, wine, etc.)

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is a hardworking 28-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the last four years she has been selling secondhand household goods to help pay for her family’s needs.

Hyline is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy gas cylinders, carpets and DVDs. In the next five years she wants to have opened up another stall. She has a dream that her business will grow and expand to give her ample capital.

Hyline is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing her a loan to use to add stock to her stall.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders, carpets and DVDs to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Francisca Sarbelia

texts.es: Francisca Sarbelia D. 60 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo Miguel D. 61 años y sus dos nietos. Francisca  tiene un negocio humilD. instalado en una galera D. lamina en el cual venD. tortillas, ubicado en su hogar D. residencia. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y desD. mucho tiempo trabaja duramente para colaborar un poco con los gastos del hogar y sacar junto a su esposo adelante a sus nietos que son todo para ella. Cuenta con buena clientela y cada día la demanda D. sus ricas e higiénicas tortillas aumenta. Esto ha motivado a Francisca a solicitar a INTEGRAL este crédito que le permita invertir en las principales materias primas como: Maíz, agua, gas propano, harina etc. Con esta inversión espera y confía que obtendrá mayores ingresos que le permitirán seguir ayudando a su familia  y podrá brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca Sarbelia, age 60, lives in her own house with her 61 year old husband, Miguel, and their two grandchildren.  Francisca has a modest business in a metal galley at her house where she sells tortillas.

She is an enterprising woman.  For a long time she has been working very hard in order to help a bit with the household expenses.  She works with her husband in order to get their grandchildren, who mean everything to her, ahead.  She has good customers, and every day the demand for her delicious and wholesome tortillas increases.

This has motivated Francisca to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  She will use this loan to buy the main raw materials like corn, water, propane gas, and flour, etc.  With this investment she is confident in expecting that she will get greater income.  This income will allow her to continue helping her family, and she will be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, water, propane gas, and flour, etc.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano de 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Mariano desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  También cuenta con sus tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa a un buen precio en los diferentes mercados.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mariano es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es mejorar económicamente para que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Mariano, 50, lives with his wife and children in their own house which does not have basic utilities.  It is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande District which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicraft activities.

For several years now Mariano has been raising and selling sheep.  He keeps them in a large pen behind his house and gives them balanced feed and natural fodder.  When they reach full development he sells them at the different markets in the area and earns a good profit which he uses for the daily household expenses.  He also has cropland where he grows lemons which he sells for a good price at different markets.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and fertilizer to improve his cropland.  He will use the income he gets to pay back the loan and improve his family's lifestyle.  Mariano is a hard worker and very responsible.  His goal is to improve his economic status so his children can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and cropland fertilizer.

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 27 years old and single. He supports his parents. He has operated a butchery for the last four years.

He learned about KADET through a KADET customer; thus, he has applied  for his first loan. He has been loaned 40,000 Kenyan shillings. He plans to to buy cows for slaughter for sale  in his butchery business. He hopes to make a profit and use the returns to open another butchery.

His dream is for his business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter for sale  in his butchery business.

loans.name: Demtha

texts.en: Demtha is a businesswoman aged 27 and she is married. For the last 12 years, she has been operating a greengrocery  business to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business  into many branches in her region. Her dream is to become the supplier of vegetables and fruit in the area. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruit, onions and vegetables. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy fruit, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El señor Cirilo tiene 65 años de edad, está casado con la señora Patrocinia quien es docente jubilada, tienen 2 hijas ya mayores de edad y con ingresos independientes, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá,. Poseen una despensa en su domicilio hace mas de 30 años, allí surte a vecinos y a ocasionales clientes con lácteos, bebidas en general, azúcar, arroz, yerba, carne, sal, panificados, carbón y otros insumos de primera necesidad, ademas vende artículos de librería, bazar y artículos para regalo.
Antes de iniciar este negocio estuvo mucho trabajando en la Argentina como empleado, el señor Cirilo sostiene que esta actividad ayudó a su familia a realizarse como profesionales ya que una de sus hijas es docente y la otra es masajista profesional, las mismas lo ayudan a en la manutención del hogar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, yerba, carne, sal, panificados, carbón y otros insumos para abastecer su despensa.
texts.en:
Señor Cirilo is 65 years old, he is married to Señora Patrocinia who is a retired teacher and they have two grown-up, financially independent daughters. They live in a well known neighborhood in the city of Itá. They have a store in their home where they provide their neighbors and drop-in customers with milk, other drinks, sugar, rice, herbs, meat, salt, baked goods, coal and other basic necessities. They also sell books, stationary and gifts.

Before starting this business Señor Cirilo worked as a clerk in Argentina for a  long time. He maintains that this helped his family to become professionals as one of his daughters is a teacher and the other is a professional masseuse and they both help out with the maintenance of the home. 

He is requesting the loan to buy sugar, rice, herbs, meat, salt, baked goods, coal and other supplies to stock his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, herbs, meat, salt, baked goods, coal and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy his own motor vehicle.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognogotala est un regroupement de cinq  femmes de la ville San, région de SÉGOU. Elles ont en moyenne 45  ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Kotognogotala font la vente de tissus de condiments et de divers. Pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter les membres ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents elles sont à leur troisième prêt afin de mener à bien leur commerce. 
Mariam débout au milieu sur la photo compte utiliser son prêt pour aller s’approvisionner a Bamako en achetant une douzaine de pièces wax et pièces de Bazin riche. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et au comptant et espère réaliser un  bénéfice de 45000 FCFA par mois. En dehors du remboursement du prêt, elle utilisera une partie de son  revenu  pour l’entretien de ses enfants et d’autres dépenses de la famille. 
En ce qui concerne les autres femmes du groupe elles espèrent  sur un bénéfice de 40.000 francs FCFA par mois. 
Les femmes du groupe Kotognogotala sollicitent l’appui de Soro Yiriwaso infiniment pour agrandir leurs fonds de commerce et diversifier les sources de revenus.
texts.en: The Kotognogotala group is a group of five women from the city of San, region of Ségou. They are on average 45 years old, married, and mother of at least five children. The members of the Kotognogotala group sell fabrics, condiments, and diverse products. To satisfy the needs of their clientele that hasn’t stopped growing, the group members decided to work with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After having properly repaid two previous loans, they are on their third loan in order to grow their business. Mariam, standing in the middle of the photo, plans to use her loan to stock up in Bamako by buying a dozen Wax cloth pieces and rich damask cloth pieces. She sells for cash or credit and hopes to earn 45,000 FCFA per month. Other than repaying her loan, she will use a portion of her earnings to care for her children and other family expenses. As for the other women of the group, they hope to earn 40,000 FCFA per month. The women of the Kotognogotala group are seeking the support of Soro Yiriwaso to grow their businesses and diversify their revenue sources.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  To earn a living, he runs a greengrocery, mainly selling bananas.  He has been in the business for four years.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business.

Daniel hopes to expand his business in five years.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas.

loans.name: Twigishanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Claire est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite la localité de Rutonde de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce des habits usagers (friperie) depuis 9 ans. Elle avait un restaurant avant de changer pour cette actuelle activité. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Salvator et ont ensemble 2 enfants dont 1étudie. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de beaucoup plus d’habits usagers (friperie) à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWIGISHANYE II»
texts.en:
Claire is a 29-year-old storekeeper who lives in Rutonde, in the province of Gitega in the center of the country. She has been in the business of selling secondhand clothing for 9 years. She used to have a restaurant before starting this business. She completed 6 years of schooling. She is married to Salvator and they have two children together, with one in school. 
The Kiva loan of 300,000 francs will help her to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of secondhand clothing in order to resell them at a high return and to increase her savings.

She is a member of the community group "TWIGISHANYE II."

loans.use: to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of secondhand clothing in order to resell them at a high return and to increase her savings.

loans.name: Carolina Aida

texts.es:
La señora carolina Aída tiene 48 años de edad y está casada con el señor florentino quien es campesino, con el cual tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo miguel estudia, está cursando el tercer año de preparatoria, ya que los otros 2 están casados, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual lleva mas de 25 años 
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado en el campo y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también para continuar apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios, y pueda tener una muy buena carrera profesional, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, leche, huevos, aceite, sal, crema, agua, arroz, etc. Para tener un poca mas surtido su negocio.
Una de las metas que tiene doña ofe (como la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante construir un local, para poner su comedor, comprar sillas y mesas y tener una mejor producción, ya que así mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios de kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá de mucho, puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina Aída is 48 and married to Mr. Florentino, a farmer. They have three children: Miguel is in his third year of preparatory school, and the other two are married. Carolina has a grocery store, which she has run for over 25 years. She says that she decided to invest in this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household costs, since he works too much in the fields and does not make enough for them to have good economic solvency. She also wanted to continue supporting her son in his studies so that he can have a good professional career. Carolina will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise such as: pop, milk, eggs, oil, salt, cream, water, and rice. This will allow her to have more stock.
As one of her goals for her business, Mrs. Ofe (as she is known in the community) wants to see it grow. She is thinking about building a restaurant in the future, and buying tables and chairs and making food. This way she will increase her income.
She thanks Fundacion Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all of our support and confidence in her. This loan will be very helpful for her, since she can now continue to invest in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as: pop, milk, eggs, oil, salt, cream, water, rice.

loans.name: Sayragul

texts.ru:
Сайрагуль 43года, замужем.  Муж уехал на заработки в Россию, Сайрагуль живет с дочерью.  
Основная деятельность Сайрагуль – это откорм и перепродажа скота и полеводство.  Начатое еще в 1992 году с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, сегодня насчитывает три коровы и тридцать баранов и приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   В данный момент, семья Сайрагуль обрабатывает 2,2 га орошаемой земли , где выращивают картофель и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Сайрагуль обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Сайрагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины.
texts.en: Sayragul is 43 years old and married. Her husband went to Russia for work. Sayragul lives with her daughter. Sayragul's main line of work is fatting and reselling cattle and agriculture. She began this in 1992 with an initial investment of 3,000 som; today she has three cows and thirty sheep, bringing in around 15,000 a month from selling dairy products. At this moment, Sayragul's family cultivates 2.2 hectares of irrigated land, where they grow potatoes and perennial grasses. In order to further increase her count of livestock, Sayragul has approached Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som to purchase additional livestock. With the income from the loan, Sayragul plans to invest in further increasing the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. For the future. she dreams of establishing a shop to sell her clothes.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rocio Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCIO DEL AMANECER” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: servicio, trabajo en minerales, producción, comercio. 

La señora Maria Luisa indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de una promotora que llego a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trabajo en minerales (orfebrería) que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su padre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de minerales) que adquirirá de los centros mineros y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializa a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta sus servicios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ROCIO DEL AMANECER" is beginning its second cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Centro Villa Exaltación.  It is comprised of eight members and chaired by Mrs. Maria Luisa, who is the president.  The different businesses of the members include: services, minerals-related work, production, and commerce.

Maria Luisa says this is her second cycle as a member of Pro Mujer and she joined through an invitation from a representative who visited her home.  Her current business is working with minerals (jewelry making), which she learned from her father.  She has been in business for several years.

The loan she is requesting is to expand her business (buying minerals) through mining centers.  She then will make and sell her products based on orders.  This source of income allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can.  She is a widow and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the services it provides.

loans.use: To buy minerals.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 36 years old and married. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. 

Rosalinda has been growing and selling rice for two years. She earns 3,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Rosalinda has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Rosalinda hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest. Rosalinda also hopes to have enough money to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr:
Angèle habite dans la région du sud sénégal agée de 31 ans ,marée elle a 2 enfants ,un à l'école primaire en classe de 6em le plus petit à 11 mois est avec sa maman.Angèle faisait le commerc de fruits dans le passé ,par la suite dans la zone ou elle habite,il y'a pas un vendeur de boisson fraiche ni de la glace .
Angèle décide d'achéter un frigo neuf pour faire de la glace et vendre de la boissons fraiche ça marche trés bien chez elle , car elle est la seule détanteur d'un frigo dans un quartier.
Angèle décide dans l'avenir faire un n'autre crédit pour acheter un 2em frigo apres avoir soldé ce crédit pour mieux satifaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Angèle, age 31, lives in South Senegal. She's married and has two children. One is in sixth grade, whereas the youngest one is 11 months old and stays with his mother.

In the past, Angèle used to sell fruits. Since there was nobody selling cold drinks or ice in her neighborhood, she decided to purchase a brand new fridge to make ice and sell cold drinks.

This business is very successful since she's the only fridge owner in the neighborhood. In the future, after completing this loan, she would like to get another loan to buy a second fridge, in order to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es: La Sra. Jasmin es casada 24, tiene 24 años de edad  y 1 hijo Jasmin   es integrante  del grupo “San Judas Tadeo”, grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas    actividades de comercio.  Jasmin  se dedica a la venta y preparación de comida es decir vende almuerzos, también vende gaseosas este negocio está situado en su  casa y tiene clientes fidelizados, Liseth inicio este negocio hace 4 meses a su vez también trabaja en una orquesta donde ella es cantante. El sueño de Liseth es con el tiempo ser  una mejor cantante y afrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para  comprar insumos y platos cubiertos. Jasmin cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agrade el préstamo a  Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Ms. Jasmin Liseth is married, 24 years of age, and has one child. Jasmin is a member of the group "San Judas Tadeo" made up of nine members who earn their living at a variety of commercial activities. Jasmin earns a living by selling and preparing food, that is to say, she sells lunches. She also sells soft drinks. This business is located in her home and she has loyal customers. 

Jasmin Liseth began this business four months ago and at the same time she works for an orchestra where she is a singer. Liseth's dream is to be a better singer in time and offer a better quality of life to her family. In hopes of continuing to grow she has requested a new loan to purchase supplies and covered dishes. Jasmin Lisbeth will reach her goals with much work and effort. She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and covered dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, settled in Sumgait city and has 2 children. This 43-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 5 years. Arzu sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. Now Arzu needs a loan amount of $1100 to be busy with selling the clothing.

loans.use: To be busy with selling the industrial goods

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en:
Floriano has 10 years' experience with his business, selling various goods in the suburban streets. He first worked selling kitchen utensils which were not yet sold by the competition. His strength at this point is sales of cases for remote controls, cell phones, tv antennas, tv controllers and other accessories for electronic articles. He works every day of the week from 8 am to 6 pm. He always rests one day of the week, since his business is walking.

Floriano would like this credit to invest in other products that he doesn't sell due to lack of capital. He would also like to include baby's clothes in his sales.

Floriano is married. He has 4 children who live with him. One of them works and helps him with home expenses. His wife also works, doing domestic tasks for a family. His wish is to be able to improve his income to give a better education and nutrition to his children.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Floriano tiene una experiencia de 10 años con su negocio de venta de artículos varios recorriendo las calles del suburbio. Se dedicaba primero a vender utensilios de cocina los que ya no vende por la competencia. Su fuerte en este momento es la venta de estuches de control remoto, de celulares, antenas de televisión, controles de televisores y demás accesorios de artículos eléctricos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Siempre descansa un día a la semana ya que su negocio es caminar.

Floriano desea el crédito para invertir en otros productos que no los tiene a la venta por falta de capital. Desea también incluir ropita de bebe en sus ventas. /p>

Floriano es casado. Tiene 4 hijos los que viven con el. Uno de ellos ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su esposa también trabaja realizando quehaceres domésticos para una familia. Su deseo es poder mejorar sus ingresos para darles una mejor educación y alimentación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old and has a small shop to sell shoes. He has five children, and two of them work with him. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for this shop. He wants to enhance his standard of living and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: To develop his shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Houdzeko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houdzeko T., 38, is the mother of seven of the children of a polygamous marriage. She manages to earn her living through selling groceries on a small scale. Unfortunately, she often confronts the problem of having certain items run out because she cannot afford to reorder quickly enough; thus her customers’ needs may go unmet and she risks losing her clientele.

In order to be able to satisfy their needs, T. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will serve as capital for wholesale purchase of grocery items that she can then stock and resell. The success of this venture will do much to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 38 ans, Madame T. Houdzeko est mère de sept (7) enfants dans une famille polygame. Elle fait essentiellement le commerce des produits vivriers qui lui procure assez de revenus. Malheureusement, elle est très souvent confrontée au problème de rupture de stock à cause du manque des moyens financiers surtout et les commandes de clients ne sont pas satisfaites.

Pour faire face aux besoins exprimés par sa clientèle, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat en gros, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. Le succès de cette activité permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: wholesale purchase, stocking and resale of grocery items

loans.name: Delia Patricia

texts.es:
Delia is 43 years old and has 23 years of experience in weaving. She works in the humble home she shares with her husband Cilso. Throught the dint of hard work she has been able to purchase two looms. So far, Delia's work has supported the family but her husband has recently taken a job as a miner. It's hard and dangerous work, especially for a man of his age, and it will take him har from home. Delia continues to weave ponchos and other garments in order to support her family and see that her children can get the education they need to advance professionally, an opportunity she never had. She is asking for a loan of $200 to buy alpaca wool so she can continue to weave. By increasing her production of beautiful woolens Delia hopes to better support her family. She promises to repay the loan in six months.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Delia tiene 43 años de edad y desde hace 23 años se dedica a la artesanía, trabajo que emprendió en su humilde hogar junto a su esposo, Cilso y con qúién a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo adquirir dos máquinas de tejer para la fabricación de sus productos. Hasta hace poco con su desempeño diario en esta labor solventaron los gastos que generaba su familia; pero ahora al observar su incremento día a día, su esposo decidió buscar trabajo como obrero en una mina muy lejana de la ciudad en la que radica su querida esposa e hijos, y se ha convertido en un miembro más de este oficio esforzado, duro y muy peligroso para la edad que tiene. Mientras tanto Delia sigue dedicada a su labor elaborando hermosas chompas, pantalones y chullos, con el único objetivo de brindarles una carrera profesional a sus hijos, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo por sus bajos recursos económicos, es por esa razón que recurre a tu persona y apoyo desinteresado para solicitarte un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la compra de más lana de alpaca para seguir elaborando sus hermosos tejidos y así obtener mayor beneficio económico para el sustento de su familia, comprometiéndose a realizar la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. “Con nuestra ayuda Delia podrá darles la oportunidad de seguir una carrera profesional a sus queridos hijos”

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
We found Maria working hard farming beautiful gladioli, which later she sells. They are quite popular among the whole population and merchants due to the beauty and quality of her products. She has to work due to the constant economic needs at her home. In a very short time she has been able to provide a big economic support to her family. For this reason she works diligently with only one wish, to offer a higher education to her dear children. The desire of this model mother is to improve the quality of her gladioli, so she needs to buy more fertilizers and seeds in order to offer better products to her demanding clients. She is requesting a loan to fulfill her desires. Let's help Maria continue with her noble intention of improving her quality of life and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a María trabajando afanosamente en el cultivo de hermosos gladiolos, que posteriormente vende siendo muy solicitados por toda la población y comerciantes debido a la belleza y calidad de sus productos, ella se dedica a esta labor, debido a la constante necesidad económica que existía en su casa En poco tiempo ella se ha convertido es un gran apoyo económico en su hogar y por esta razón trabaja diligentemente con un solo objetivo, ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos. El deseo de esta ejemplar madre es mejorar la calidad de sus gladiolos, para lo cual necesita comprar mayor cantidad de abonos y semillas con el objetivo de ofrecer mejores productos a sus exigentes clientes. Para cumplir sus objetivos solicita un préstamo. Ayudemos a María a continuar con su noble propósito en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and seed to improve the quality of her products.

loans.name: Guillermo Rody

texts.es:
Rody is a man who, upon seeing the needs of his neighbors, took the initiative of installing a telephone in his small bodega with the aim of alleviating the communication difficulties within his community. With this new service, the communication between family members has grown and brought cheer given that the telephone better allows for the sharing of happy news. He and his children attend to the calls each morning and communicate with neighbors to stay apprised of new calls. Since oftentimes there are long waits in between calls, he has opened a small store in his home so that the wait is more enjoyable and his patrons can indulge in a beverage or some candy while they wait for word from their families. He is looking for a loan to reach his goals, and you can be of great assistance toward his endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rody, es un hombre que al ver las necesidades de sus vecinos tuvo la iniciativa de instalar un teléfono en su pequeña bodega para aliviar las dificultades de comunicación que existían en el interior de su comunidad.Con este nuevo servicio, la comunicación entre las personas de su comunidad con sus familiares se ha tornado más continua y les ha traído muchas alegrías ya que a través del hilo telefónico pueden compartir noticias agradables.Él y sus hijos todos las mañanas atienden las recepciones de las llamadas y comunican a sus vecinos para que se mantengan atentos en espera de las nuevas llamadas.Ya que muchas veces por los largos minutos de espera entre una y otra llamada sus vecinos aguardan en las instalaciones de su casita ha decidido implementar una pequeña bodeguita para que sus esperas sean menos agobiantes y más entretenidas ya que pueden degustar de alguna bebida y/o dulce mientras esperan noticias de sus familiares. Solicita un préstamo para alcanzar sus metas, usted puede ayudarlo.

loans.use: Implement small bodega to offer goods in conjunction with phone/communication services business.

loans.name: Usmonali

texts.ru:
Usmonali M. is 31 years old and has a secondary education. He is married and has three children. Usmonali raises livestock. He has been raising livestock for 2 years. He also has a small plot of land that he wants to plant wheat on. He will use a portion of the loan to purchase fuel for his tractor so he can plow the fields before he plants wheat. He wants to use the other portion of the loan to purchase food for his livestock as they cannot graze during the winter. He is planning to sell the wheat to local residents who would have a chance to purchase wheat at lower prices to make flour for bread. Usmonali plans to repay his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Мирзоев Усмонали, возраст – 31 год, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Усмонали занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Также он имеет небольшой участок земли, который он хочет засеять пшеницой. Часть полученного кредита он хочет использовать на покупку горюче-смазочных материалов для того чтобы на тракторе обработать землю для посева, а на другую часть планирует приобрести корм для животных. Данный кредит даст возможность Усмонали засеять свой участок, а также приобрести необходимое питание для своих животных, так как зимой им требуется усиленное питание. Полученный урожай он планирует продать местным жителям, тем самым давая им возможность приобрести пшеницу по приемлемым ценам для переработки в муку и выпечку хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fuel for tractor and food for cattle

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokouvi K. was born in Lomé on December 31, 1979. He is married and the father of two children, with four other children in his care. A driver by profession, he works for a third party as a taxi driver and makes daily returns. Through this project, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 with which to buy his own vehicle so that he can fully enjoy the fruits of his labor. This will enable him to better meet the needs of his family and grant him financial independence.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Kokouvi est né à Lomé le 31 décembre 1979. Marié, il est père de 2 enfants, il a en charge quatre 04) autres enfants. Chauffeur de profession, il travail pour un tiers comme conducteur de taxi et fait les recettes journalières. A travers se projet, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour acquérir un véhicule de transport propre à lui-même afin de jouir pleinement des fruits de son travail. Cela lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr:
Having lived in Lomé for around 20 years, Mrs. Anne-Marie H. was born in Bénin on September 13, 1965. She is married and the mother of three children whose school fees and living expenses she provides. She sells cookies and sweets both wholesale and retail, a business she began in 2006.

The loan in the amount of US$ 1200 that she is requesting will allow her to expand her inventory by buying 15 cases of cookies and 24 cases of candies. This should enable her to increase her turnover and thus make substantially more profit from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Installée à Lomé depuis plus d’une vingtaine d’année, Madame H. Anne-Marie est née au Bénin le 13 septembre 1965. Mariée, elle et mère de trois enfants dont elle assure la scolarité et le suivi. Revendeuse de confiserie en gros et en détail, elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006.

Le crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat de quinze cartons de biscuits et de vingt quatre cartons de bonbons en vue d’améliorer son chiffre d’affaires de et réaliser beaucoup de profit.

loans.use:
to expand her inventory of cookies and sweets

Augmenter son stock de confisserie

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en:
Hanane is a 33 year old woman. She has five children. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh, with her family.

Hanane is in the agriculture business. This is the first time she has asked for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy agricultural inputs to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: Shazia is 35 years old, and is married to  M..  She resides in the city of Kasur in Pakistan, which is famous for its sweetmeats. She lives in a 4 room brick house. Shazia is a mother of a six year old son who is in kindergarten. She runs her own cloth business, and has applied for a loan of $1,150 to aid in the expansion of her cloth business.  She has been joined in her loan group by a few more local businesswomen:  Bashira wants a loan to repair her rickshaw; Ghulam wants a loan to embroider shoes; Rukhsana wants a loan to start decoratively embroidering clothes; Rani wants a loan to start welding work, and Nusrat wants a loan to buy a machine for her leather work.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Maritza Carolina

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Carlona lives in Ciudad Arce located in La Libertad District. Over the past 20 years she has dedicated herself to selling panes con gallina india (a hen sandwhich with tomato sauce typical in El Salvador). Thanks to this business she has raised her two children who are now studying in primary school.

She has been a client of Apoyo Integral for several years and during this time she has managed to keep improving her business. Her profits have been put to good use to meet the demands of her growing clientele.

Another project she is working on with her profits is the construction of a home for her family. She is just starting and needs to build a retaining wall to protect her home from the landslides which often occur in the winter. Her plot of land is 4 meters above the street level and this creates an insecure situation for the inhabitants of the building. Due to all this, Mrs.Maritza is requesting a microloan to continue building her home which in turn will help her provide safety and protection for her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Construction of a reinforced concrete retaining wall

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a single mother of five daughters. Only three of them live with her as the other two live with their grandmother. She was unable to support all of them and her mother helped her with the others. Today her finances are better but her children do no want to come back to her. She tries very hard to give them what she could not give them before. Five years ago she started her business selling skin creams which she has kept afloat together with her family, as two of her daughters help her with sales.

She needs a loan of US$400, which she will pay back in 6 months, in order to repair her car. She has no other method of transport to use to visit her clients to offer them products and to collect payment. For this reason it is urgent that it is repaired, and with your help her business will stay afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes es mama soltera que tiene 5 hijas, solo 3 viven con ellas ya que las otras 2 viven con su abuelita a ella no le alcanzaba para mantenerlas a todas y su mama le ayudo con las demás, hoy su economía es mejor pero sus hijas ya no quieren regresar con ella. Se esfuerza mucho para darles lo que en su tiempo no pudo darles. Hace 5 años inico su negocio de venta de cremas para la piel lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante junto con su familia, ya que 2 de sus hijas le ayudanm a vender.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para reparar su auto ya que no tiene otro medio de transporte para como visitar a sus clintes para ofrecerles productos y para cobranza por lo que le urge repararlo, con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Repairs to her car which is necessary for her work

loans.name: Chiku's Tukumbuke Group

texts.en:
Chiku is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 1. She has sold charcoal and firewood since 2001. She works at her business every day and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Chiku is now hoping for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Raya and Sada, who have businesses dealing with selling clothes and bread.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more undergarments, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 38 años, ella y su esposo siempre han trabajado en diversas actividades para mantener a sus ocho hijos que están en la edad escolar.   Cada día, después de dejar la comida preparada en su casa, sale a trabajar, ahora se dedica a lavar ropa a mano para diferentes personas, le pagan 3 soles por 12 prendas, su esposo a veces trabaja de albañil, o de lo contrario se va la caza de animales del campo, típicos de la zona, como el cutpe o sajino, estos animales María los vende a los restaurantes, y de es modo luchan juntos por el sostenimiento de su familia. A ella no le gusta lavar ropa, porque suele enfermar por el esfuerzo que conlleva esta labor, por ello tiene en mente dedicarse a la compra y venta de ropa por las zonas de cultivos.  María es una madre abnegada, y muy sacrificada, todos los trabajos que realiza son para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Acceder al préstamo, es para ella una bendición, porque le dará la oportunidad de comprar ropa y convertirse en negociante, considera que le va ir muy bien en sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old. She and her husband have worked various jobs to support their eight school aged children. Each day, after leaving the food prepared at home, she leaves for work. Right now she washes clothes by hand for different people. They pay her three soles for 12 pieces. Sometimes her husband works as a day laborer, or if not, he hunts animals in the country - animals typical for that region like cutpe or wild pigs. María sells the animals to restaurants and in that way they work together to sustain their family. She doesn't like washing clothes because she is prone to illness due to the intense work involved. She has in mind buying and selling clothing in the rural areas. María is an unselfish mother and very dedicated. All of the work that she does is to feed and educate her children. To receive this loan is a blessing for her because it will give her the opportunity to purchase clothing and turn herself into a businesswoman. She believes that she will do well in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adquirir prendas de vestir para dedicarse a la venta de estas.

loans.name: Olga Angelica

texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Chiara Village Bank. 
She is 42 years old and married with two daughters. Olga and her sister raise and sell guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy). Olga has two sheds where she raises the guinea pigs and also has a plot of land where she grows alfalfa to feed them.  Olga needs a loan of 600 soles to buy alfalfa seed. Olga dreams of having her own business, that her son will study Business Administration, and of having some time for herself to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Chiara.
Olga es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijas, Olga se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cuyes, actividad que realiza con su hermana, Olga tiene 2 galpones de crianza, y terreno en el que siembra alfalfa para la alimentación de los cuyes, los cuyes los comercializa en los recreos.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla de alfalfa.
Olga sueña con tener una empresa, su hija estudie administración de empresas y tener un recreo propio.

loans.use: Buy alfalfa seeds to feed guinea pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Thanh Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị T., sinh năm 1959 ( Ms 010105040029). Gia đình chị làm nông nghiệp nên rất cần vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Anh chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.028.000 vnđ để mua ngan, gà về nuôi. Hàng ngày, chị còn đi chợ buôn bán chè búp. Thỉnh thoảng chồng chị đi làm them đem lại tổng thu nhập của cả gia đình khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chi được mọi người tin tưởng và bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Ngô Thị Lan, sinh năm 1964 ( Ms 010105040034),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng bánh kẹo tại nhà, chị có thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 70.000 vnđ/ngày.
 Vương Thị Vân, sinh năm 1966, ( Ms 010105040037),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ  để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Vân, sinh năm 1969, ( Ms 010105040035),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ  để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hai vợ chồng chị có thu nhập ổn định từ lương  khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng 
 Vương Thị Nụ, sinh năm 1958, ( Ms 010105040038),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ  để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ /tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Minh, sinh năm 1947, ( Ms 010105040031),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lơn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Vương Thị Tỵ, sinh năm 1965, ( Ms 010105040026),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ để bán hàng ăn sáng  ( bán bún, phở, cháo,…). Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/tháng.
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị T. was born in 1959. Her family are farmers so they have a great need for capital to invest in raising animals. Her brother hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to buy ducks and chickens to raise. Each day, she goes to the market to trade in tea buds. Sometimes her husband goes to find extra work, which brings the income of the entire family to about 3,000,000 VND (178 USD) per month. Mrs. T. has the trust of everyone and was elected the leader of the group comprised of: Ngô Thị Lan, born 1964, hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to buy candy and snacks to sell from her home. Her income is about 70,000 VND (4 USD) per day. Vương Thị Vân, born 1966, hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to invest in raising pigs. Nguyễn Thị Vân, born 1969, hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to invest in raising pigs. She and her husband have a steady income from wages of about 3,000,000 VND (178 USD) per month. Vương Thị Nụ, born 1958, hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to invest in raising pigs. The average monthly income of her family is about 3,500,000 VND (208 USD). Nguyễn Thị Minh, born 1947, hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to invest in raising pigs. The average monthly income of her family is about 2,000,000 VND (119 USD). Vương Thị Tỵ, born 1965, hopes to borrow 4,028,000 VND (239 USD) to invest in a breakfast stand selling bún (rice noodles), phở (noodle soup), cháo (rice porridge), etc. The average monthly income of her family is about 3,500,000 VND (208 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs, candy and breakfast sales

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
