Mrs. Chanthou Y., age 47, is a widow with two children: one son who is married and lives outside the family house, and one daughter, who attends school. She also has three brothers and sisters who live with her. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthou has been selling food and soft drinks for one year, a skill she learned by herself since her husband died. She buys ingredients from Prek Phnao market to cook and sell in her village. She hopes that she will be able to support her children to study as long as possible. She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to school.

loans.name: Adilia Yudith

texts.es:
ADILIA YUDITH VÁSQUEZ D. CALENZANI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 556-B del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 45 años D. edad, 06 hijos, su esposo trabaja en petróleos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos D. belleza D. marca Unique en poca cantidad, su esposo le ayudaba en su trabajo, en la venta por catálogos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, implementa más su negocio; invertir en productos chinos y artículos D. perfumería y belleza.

Muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Adilia Yudith Vasquez D. Calenzani is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" located in Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 556-B in the district of Callería. She is 45 years old and has six children. Her husband works in the oil industry. The first loan Adilia received was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase Unique brand beauty products in small quantities. Her husband used to help her in her work in catalog sales. With this loan in the amount of $650 she will further establish her business by investing in Chinese products, perfumes and beauty products. She is very happy with the support that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Further establish her business by investing in Chinese products, perfumes and beauty products.

loans.name: Ni Komang Wiriasih

texts.id:
Sebagai seorang pedagang Kakao , Musim hujan merupakan kendala utama dalam menjalankan usaha ini , Disamping hasil panen petani yang turun hingga 80 % juga hasil yang ada kwalitasnya juga kurang baik .Hingga tak jarang banyak pedagang kakau yang mengisi waktunya dengan berjualan buah-buhan yang lagi musiman. Demikian juga halnya yang dilakukan oleh Ni Komang Wiriasih . Istri dari I Komang suarya ini  disamping mencari /membeli kakao juga memanfaatkan modal yang ada dengan berjualan Rambutan dan Durian yang saat ini lagi musimnya, hasil yang di dapat cukup lumayan untuk menambah biaya keperluan di dapur. Ni Komang Wiriasih Telah Menyelesaikan Pinjaman tahap Keduanya Yaitu Rp 5.000.000,-dan Bermaksud meminjam lagi untuk tahap ketiga dengan Nilai yang lebih Kecil Yaitu Rp 1.000.000,-yang akan di pergunakan untuk modal membeli barang dagangan buah-buahan .   
Dengan tambahan modal ini Wiriasih berharap bisa membeli barang Petani dan memperoleh keuntungan sambil menunggu musim kemarau dimana musim kakao kembali ramai.
texts.en:
The rainy monsoon season is a challenge for cocoa trade as it decreases the farmers' productivity up to 80% and it also reduces the produce quality. This motivates a lot of cocoa traders like Ni Komang Wiriasih to seek side businesses, such as selling seasonal fruits. Ni Komang Wiriasih is married to I Komang Suarya. Besides selling cocoa, she also trades Rambutan and Durian that is in season during the rainy season. The profit is sufficient to supplement her income to pay for daily expenses. Ni Komang Wiriasih just paid back her second loan of $500, and is applying for another loan for $92 that will be used to purchase more fruits. With this additional funding, Wiriasih hopes to purchase more produce from farmers and reap more profit until the summer when cocoa season peaks.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cacao

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr:
Né en 1965 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin, K. Donatien réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Donatien est père de six (06) enfants dont cinq (05) sont scolarisés. Donatien est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. L’électronique étant une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens, Donatien ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et se faire  plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour rendre plus performant son atelier que Donatien sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin, Mr. K. Donatien resides in the 3rd district of Porto-Novo. He is the father of six children, of whom five are in school. Donatien is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for allowing him to satisfy the large number of customers and for earning enough to meet his various responsibilities. Thus, in order to make his workshop more competitive, he’s requesting a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita,
Maribel es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Maribel tiene un puesto en el mercado Nazarenas en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su mama.
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lenteja, garbanzo.
Los sueños de Maribel son vender por mayor y que su hijo estudie en un buen colegio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita (Morenita Communal Bank). Maribel is single, is 23 years old and has a son. Maribel has a stand in the Nazarenas Market where she sells groceries in general. She works everyday with the casual help of her mother. Maribel needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of lentils and chickpeas. Maribel’s dreams are to increase sales and that her son will study in a good school.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of lentils and chickpeas.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en:
Bismarck O., 37, married, is the father of a 10-year-old boy who is currently pursuing his education in primary school. The family lives in a rented apartment at Oda, a farming community in the eastern region of Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers.

Bismarck is a petty trader and trades in palm nut fruits. He purchases the palm fruits in bulk from farmers in the villages and supplies them to retailers in the cities. From this business, he supports his family and pays for his son's schooling.

He wants to use the loan as an opportunity to purchase palm fruits in bulk so that he may keep a supply in store, thus avoiding price hikes as well as cutting back on frequent traveling. He hopes to increase his income in order to continue to pay his son’s school fees.

He is a member of the trust group called “Adehyee Mma” (translated as "Royals"). In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and they support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: A 44 year old husband and a father of 4 children, Mr. Dante A., resides in his home town of Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte.  He is a carpenter and, together with his wife, operates his picture lamination business to feed and send his children in college. Mr. Dante and his wife dream of expanding their small business so they can provide a better future for their children and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: Materials for picture lamination

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: Reynaldo José G. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Reynaldo tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Reynaldo es el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 12 años que inicio este negocio. Inicio por cuenta propia y con pequeños trabajos de carpintería y a medida que obtenía más clientela empezó a comprar equipos y herramientas de trabajos como sierras para cortar madera, taladros y ahora maneja un pequeño taller de carpintería. Reynaldo es un hombre muy trabajador. Y sus propósitos son de proporcionarle a su negocio las herramientas necesarias. El financiamiento es solicitado para capital de trabajo para la compra de madera, lijas, clavos, pega entre otras cosas. Los deseos de Reynaldo son de seguir creciendo con su negocio y así darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo José G. is 43 and single. Reynaldo has two children who go to school. Reynaldo is a carpenter. He started this business over twelve years ago. He started on his own with small carpentry jobs. As he got more customers, he started to buy equipment and work tools like saws to cut wood and drills. Now he runs a small carpentry shop. Reynaldo is a hard worker. He plans to supply his business with the necessary tools. He is asking for a loan for working capital. He will buy wood, sanders, nails, and glue, among other things. Reynaldo wants to have his business continue to grow. That way he will be able to give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty, 52, sells provisions like beverages, toothpaste, bathing soap, and so forth. She is married and has seven children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 19-year-old man living with his parents. In 2009, he decided to open his own call center. In order to expand his shop and his career, Hassan is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase equipment.

loans.use: To purchase call center equipment

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 49 years old and married with five children. She is an active LAPO client. Toyin sells drinks and wine. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and wine to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania es una mujer trabajadora D. 21 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su familia en el distrito D. Ventanilla, en Lima. Se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto del mercado “12 D. Mayo” D. su localidad. Por ser uno D. los mercados más conocidos, Epifania tiene mucha clientela, debido también al buen trato que ofrece se ha hecho D. clientes regulares, pues los trata como si fueran amigos que conociera desD. hace muchos años; asimismo, ofrece buenos precios y productos D. buena calidad. Su negocio le está resultando rentable, pues está trabajando muy duro para lograr todas sus metas, sabe que su progreso se hará en base a esfuerzo y dedicación. Es su décimo préstamo con su grupo solidario en MFP, ella y sus compañeras siempre han sido muy puntuales y estrictas a la hora D. hacer los pagos, y es así que se compromete para este nuevo crédito. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. verduras para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Epifania is a hard working 21-year-old who lives in her own house next to her family in the Ventanilla district in Lima. She sells fruits at a stand in the “12 D. Mayo” market in her village, one of the more well-known markets. As a result Epifania has many customers, but also because of the good treatment that she gives to her regulars, who she treats more like old friends. In addition, she offers good prices and high-quality products. Her business is becoming increasingly profitable because she is working very hard to achieve all of her goals, as she knows that her progress is based on her effort and dedication. This is her tenth loan with her solidarity group from MFP. Her group members have always been very punctual and strict about making their payments on time and they have promised the same with this credit. With her loan she will purchase the best quality vegetables in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: aissatou D. est vendeuse de tissus mèches greffages et divers articles pour femmes depuis six ans.elle est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1994.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et renforcer son stock.son activité lui permet d'entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos R. C. reside en el departamento de San Salvador en el municipio de Ilopango. Juan Carlos tiene 27 años de edad y vive con su esposa Marina quien le ayuda en el negocio.  Juntos se dedican a la venta y elaboración de cinchos, que venden luego de manera ambulante en varias zonas de san salvador. Con el propósito de formalizar un poco mas su negocio y vender nuevos productos, Juan Carlos solicita un préstamo que le permita compra materia prima y nuevo inventario.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para fabricación de cinchos

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel R. grows rice for a living. She has a 1-hectare farm that she expects to alway provide her with food and other basic needs. She said that her farm has been very helpful because they no longer have to buy rice grains for the family.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by purchasing farming necessities. The loan will truly help her sustain her livelihood and increase her income as well.  

She joined in CEVI in the year 2008. She is still a CEVi client because she really likes the policies.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Esmerita Margarita

texts.es:
La señora ESMERITA MARGARITA B. V., tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos de confección de ropa interior para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 meses de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
ESMERITA se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa interior para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300 soles, el cual utilizará para comprar algodón, elástico, encaje, etc. para la fabricación de ropa interior.
La empresaria sueña en confeccionar y vender lencería al por mayor, también tiene pensado estudiar para confeccionar buzos, pero esta esperando que su bebe crezca un poco mas para así poder empezar a estudiar.
texts.en:
Esmerita Margarita Briceño V., 25, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Valerosas Communal Bank. This businesswoman has a technical education in making underwear for children, youths, and adults. She is married and has two children. The children are four and three months old, and they are economically dependent upon her. Esmerita makes and sells underwear for children, youths, and adults. This is her first loan. She needs 300 PEN to buy cotton, elastic, and lace, etc. to make underwear. This businesswoman dreams of making and selling wholesale lingerie. She is also thinking of studying how to make sportswear, but she is waiting until her baby grows a little more to be able to begin studying.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By cotton, elastic, and lace, etc.

loans.name: Michael Otieno

texts.en:
Michael Otieno is 40 years old and married with six children. He owns a tailoring business, where he sells mostly dresses. Michael Otieno has expanded his business over the years and employs other individuals in his shop. He is on his third loan cycle with KADET and will use this loan to purchase more fabric and to pay school fees for his children. 

Michael Otieno operates his business in an urban slum area. Most of his clients are very low-income earners. 

One day, he hopes to venture into the real estate business. He has already acquired a plot of land, but currently lacks the capital to develop it.



About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase fabric for his business and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe R. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual fue para poder la losa en un cuarto trasero el cual es la recamara de sus hijos.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio que tiene el y su esposa la señora María Estela R., ya que en la compañía que estaba trabajando recortaron personal. 
Tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de comida. El negocio está ubicado afuera de su casa para atender a los niños. Quieren tener otro corrito de ventas de comida en otro ubicación igual de transitada  y que lo atienda el señor Felipe. Es por eso que están solicitando este préstamo, para la inversión de un nuevo negocio.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias D. negocio, ya con el otro local de comida será para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Felipe R. is thankful for the cooperation with his previous loan which went towards laying a slab in the back room which is his children's bedroom. Again, he is requesting a loan to invest in his business which he and his wife, María Estela R., own since the company he was working for had layoffs. He already has more than four years experience selling food. The business is located outside their home so they may attend to their children. They want to have another cart for selling food in another location that is as well-traveled, which Felipe can attend. It is for this that they are requesting this loan, to invest in a new business. They plan to pay the loan with the income from their business since the other food business can cover their family's bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up a cart for selling food.

loans.name: Zivamuntuuyo, Jinja Group

texts.en: N. Rose is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 38 years old and married with four children between the ages of 10 and 18. The first-born recently joined the University. She is a hard working lady with a tailoring and textile business that she has been running for 15 years. She is able to make 40,000/= profit every week. Her major challenge is that the vendors take most of their customers since they move from place to place yet Rose’s business is just stationed in one place. She ensures that she makes very good designs to her customers’ satisfaction so she can keep the customers coming to her business. She hopes to expand her textile business and continue to educate her children. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing for tailoring.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith sells bags of melon at retail prices to her customers. Melon is used in the preparation of egusi soup in Nigeria. She has been in her business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of melon to sell.

Faith is 45 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Faith is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of melon to sell

loans.name: Kattia Milagros

texts.es:
Kattia tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus padres y su pequeño hijo en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año tiene instalado en su hogar un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para niños y calzado. Ella pudo crear este negocio gracias a algunos ahorros con los que contaba y al apoyo que le brindaron sus padres. Esta actividad es su única fuente de sustento económico, por lo que día a día da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

El negocio ha tenido buena acogida entre los pobladores de la zona, por lo que Kattya está pensando en ampliarlo, pero ya no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir sacando adelante su negocio para brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le asegure un futuro prometedor. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Kattia is a 21 year old single mother who lives with her parents and son in the Olmos Distrit, about 1 hour and 45 minuts from Chiclayo. She started a business out of her house a year ago, selling children clothes and shoes. She was able to start this business thanks to some savings she had and the help of her parents. This is her only source of income and she works hard every day to improve her business, which has had good reception in the community. Kattia is looking forward to making her business bigger but she doesn't have enough money to invest in it and for this reason she's asking Edpyme Alternativa for a $350 loan. Her biggest dream is to be able to provide her son with quality education so he can have a better future. She's a very hard working entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Children's Clothes and Shoes

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio tiene 51 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. 
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza, sus vecinos son sus principales clientes, pero también distribuye para eventos sociales en su localidad.
Paralelamente, Bacilio trabaja realizando planos arquitectónicos, porque es arquitecto de profesión y es una de sus grandes pasiones. En el negocio de la venta de cerveza su principal apoyo son sus hijos, quienes le ayudan con el transporte de las cajas, mientras él cuida de cada detalle de la venta. Esta actividad le ha resultado muy rentable y quiere seguir mejorando sus ventas para el progreso de su familia.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete –nuevamente- a ser puntual en sus todos pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más mercadería en cajas de cerveza.
texts.en:
Bacilio, 51, lives with his wife and three children in his own house. He has sold beer for the last 15 years; his customers are, for the most part, his neighbors. However, he also distributes to social events in his locality. In addition, Bacilio draws architectural plans because he is an architect and this is one of his great passions. His children are his main help in his beer-sales business; they help carrying the cases while he watches over every detail of the sales. This has turned out to be quite a profitable business and he wants to continue to improve his sales so that his family can progress. This is his third loan with MFP and he commits, once again, to repay in a timely fashion. The funds he is requesting now will be used to buy more cases of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 30 years old and married to Annastacia Kanini. He has been employed as a rider in the motorcycle taxi business for the last two years, and now he wants to buy his own motorcycle. Wilson was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy his own motorcycle to use in the same taxi business. This will enable him not only to increase his income, but also make his income steady.
Wilson's future plan is to grow his transport business by purchasing a minibus for transporting customers over long distances, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Awareness Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Awareness group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are all small scale businesswomen who have formed a group to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 28-year-old Isatu M..  Isatu, who sells soap, cotton, shoes, rubbers (plastic containers), and women’s clothes, is married to a soldier and they have six children. Their children are still attending schools – three are in secondary school and three are in primary school.  Isatu has two years of experience in business. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more wholesale inventory.

loans.use: To buy bathing soap, cotton, shoes, rubbers (plastic containers), and women’s clothes

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: In the village of Prasat in the Kandal province, there are four women who have joined together to request a group loan. One of these members, Mrs. Phally N., was selected by all of the members to be the group leader. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phally N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice in order to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sam Orat, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Phally N. works hard in her field, but she does not earn a lot of income because her rice field has infertile soil, and she does not have enough seeds to grow. Thus, Mrs. Phally N. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to improve her yield of rice this year. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a waiter. The others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun N., who is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo Province, was born in 1964. To earn a living, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Thuon Chhou, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land on which he cultivates rice in order to support their family. As a side job, he is also a laborer. They have three children: one child is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying in the local public school.

Because her breeding business has been doing rather well, she is hoping to embark on a new business venture. Thus, in order to improve and expand her animal-breeding business, Mrs. Moeun N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To improve and expand her breeding business by purchasing a cow

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a woman who says she is “at the prime of life!”  She has two daughters who are both grown up now. One has already completed her university studies and the other is completing university soon.  She is very proud of them both for their schooling and commented that education “is the best gift you can give your child.” 

Betty describes herself as a very hard-working woman. She says that you have to be hard working if you are in the business of poultry farming because it is such an involved business.  Betty raises layers (chickens that are raised for consumption) behind her home. Currently she thinks she has between 200-400 chickens.  She buys them when they are one day old and then she raises them till they are fat enough to sell.

There are some real challenges in this business because there is a lot of competition for a small market.  In the areas where Betty sells there are lots of hotels and restaurants that want to buy her chickens, but many people know this in her neighborhood – so people are competing to be able to sell. 

It is too bad when there is too much competition because it forces poultry farmers to keep their chicken until they are too large.  In order to keep the chickens growing and healthy, it is a must that you keep feeding them well, but the more you spend on feed per chicken the lower your profit margin. 

Betty is taking a loan today for 40,000 KSH.  She hopes to be able to buy a few hundred more chicks with this amount, as well as the feed to make them grow! In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land, both where she can build a good home and also so that she can build some other homes where people can rent from her.

loans.use: 200 chicks and some bags of feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2009, this young man decided to start his own business; he opened a coffee shop, also serving Nargile, a special Lebanese tobacco very famous with the Lebanese people. The clients visit his café to have a good time. During this year, he has been able to attract a good number of clients and so a good profit. Therefore, he became able to help his father in the household. 

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy merchandise such as coffee and charcoal to meet the requirements of his customers, especially before the coming summer season.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as coffee and charcoal.

loans.name: Ali Suleiman

texts.en:
51-year-old A. is the father of five children. He sells charcoal to Malindi Town residents and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 12000 a month. A. sells water, too. 

He was introduced to KADET by the chairlady of his group. This is his second loan after successfully completing his first loan. He has no prior credit history apart from KADET. He will stock charcoal with Kshs 45000 and pay for transport with Kshs 5000. With the proceeds from this loan, he will open a store for his charcoal and firewood business.

A. hopes to buy a truck to help him with transportation for his business.

loans.use: Buy charcoal and pay for transportation

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es:
El grupo S. está conformado por Hortencia Leonor S. Vivaz, Darling de los Ángeles Flores y Ulises Fernando Méndez provenientes del reparto Martín Castellón de Nindiri. 

S. Vivaz, coordinadora del grupo tiene una pequeña comideria donde comercializa en su pequeño local y distribuye a distintas empresas su producto. Esta señora de 24 años trabaja arduamente para brindarle un mejor futuro a su pequeña de seis años.
	
Sus compañeros de grupo son Ulises Méndez el cual también tiene una comideria y Consuelo Mendes quien vende gaseosa, fresco, helado, hielos etc. desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The S. group’s members are: Hortencia Leonor S. Vivaz, Darling de los Ángeles Flores and Ulises Fernando Méndez, all residents of Martín Castellón de Nindiri. Mrs. S. Vivaz, 24, group coordinator, has a small eatery where she sells meals; she also provides meals for various firms. She works arduously to provide a better future for her 6-year-old daughter. Her fellow group members are Ulises Méndez who also has an eatery and Consuelo Mendes who has been selling soft-drinks, fruit drinks, frozen treats, ice, etc. for the last three years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años de edad, ella vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores y no dependen económicamente de ella. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, además a la confección y venta de ropa, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años. Desde entonces obtiene grandes beneficios económicos y satisfacción, puesto que lo realiza dentro de su domicilio recibiendo a clientes, entre vecinas y amistades. No tiene responsabilidad sobre algunos de sus hijos y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita, ahora lo que busca es estabilizarse y apoyar a sus hijos cuando sea necesario, con el fin de que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que ellos son su principal aliciente en la vida. Es su quinto crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por la puntualidad a la hora de los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y también en materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Irma is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her two adult children who are no longer financially dependent on her. She sells beauty products and also makes and sells clothing, an activity she started six years ago. Since then she has received great financial benefits and satisfaction from her work since she is able to stay at home and meet with her customers, which include neighbors and friends. Irma has peace of mind now that she is no longer responsible for her children. However, she still looks for ways to provide them stability and support when necessary since they are her main source of encouragement in life.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Irma has always been known for being prompt with her payments. The loan she requested will be used to purchase beauty products and also materials for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & materials for making clothes

loans.name: Horolgarav

texts.en:
Horolgarav is 43 years-old and lives with her husband and 19 year-old son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. Her son currently attends the local high school. 

Horolgarav operates a meat selling business in her town with the help of her husband. She offers a variety of locally produced meats to her customers through selling at the local market. Horlgarav started her meat business in 1996 with capital of 200,000 MNT. Her business has found success over the years and she has built a good reputation amongst her customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,500,000MNT. 

For the future, Horolgarav hopes that she can become a meat wholesaler and that she can sell on a larger scale. She also dreams of one day having her own meat trading shop. She is a hard working and creative woman who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum Y. is a 20-year-old married woman and a villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of farmland that she uses to grow different kinds of crops. She is married with a lovely baby and her husband works on the farm with her. Sum Y. planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer. Sum Y. was not available when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda S. is a married woman who lives in Sitio San Juan, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   a general store , selling AVON beauty products, and selling Ready-to-Wear clothes. Her husband, Herman S., who is 59 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have 6 children who are 11 to  26 years old. 

Neda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Neda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital in her business activities so that she can continue to save up for the future, for her business and for her family. Neda S. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea nació en el distrito de Chinchero de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento Cusco y tiene 46 años. Actualmente, Andrea vive junto con su esposo en la misma ciudad donde nació. Andrea se caso con su esposo y fruto de este matrimonio tienen 6 hijos, ella educa a sus hijos y los manda a estudiar a la ciudad del Cusco, donde la enseñanza es mejor que en Chincheros.   

Andrea se dedica a la venta de golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, él socio tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado de Chinchero. Mariano vende sus productos a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros que visitan la zona arqueológica de chichero. Le pueden encontrar en su negocio los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la noche o hasta que los turistas se retiren del lugar.

Con su próximo préstamo, Mariano Guadalupe que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, etc. 

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Andrea pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Andrea was born in the district of Chinchero, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the same town where she was born. She and her husband have six children who go to school in Cusco where the standard of education is better than in Chinchero. Andrea sells candy, cookies, soft drinks from a small stand in the Chinchero market to local and overseas tourists who visit the archeological sites of Chinchero. She can be found at her stand seven days a week, from 8 am to 4 pm or until the tourists leave the area. With this next loan Andrea hopes to receive 500 soles which she will use to buy merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate etc. The Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero community bank has been in existence for two and a half years. Andrea has been with the bank for two years and all is going well. The name of the bank comes from the local Quechua language and means ‘Beautiful Princess of Chinchero’.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate etc.

loans.name: Angulo Aquije

texts.es:
Angulo Aquije E. Y. se dedica a la venta de comida rápida (alitas y contrapierna de pollo). Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, tiene 3 hijos independientes quienes también la ayudan en el negocio.
Presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas gaseosas, sillas y mesas para mejorar e invertir en el negocio que le brinda buen ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Angulo Aquije E. Y. works in fast food sales (chicken wings and thighs). Her business is located in her home. She has 3 children who are independent and also help her with the business.

She presents good personal and work references.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of soft drinks, chairs and tables to improve and invest in her business which provides her with a good family income.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert B. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. He is 35 years old. Robert is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Robert plants and harvests rice for sale. Robert has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per crop. In 2010, Robert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Robert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rukundo Group

texts.fr:
Yvette N. est une femme commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite au Quartier Kamenge en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des habits pour toutes catégories depuis 10 ans. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année de l’école primaire. Son mari, Benoit Twagirayezu est lui aussi un commerçant. Elle arrive au 8e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 3enfants qui sont âgés de  5ans, 3ans et 1 an. Ils n’ont pas encore commence l’école. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité des habits  à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle espère en plus, qu’avec des économies générées de ce business, elle parviendra à construire sa propre maison et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants jusqu’ils terminent leurs études avec grand succès.

 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Rukundo».
texts.en:
Yvette N. is a 30-year-old retailer who lives in the Kamenge district of Bujumbura. She attended primary school up to the 6th grade. She has been selling all kinds of clothes for 10 years. Her husband, Benoit Twagirayezu, is also a retailer. Yvette has three children, ages 5, 3 and 1, who do not yet go to school.
  
Yvette is currently on the 8th cycle of community credit with the Turame MFI. She is seeking credit through Kiva to increase her stocks of clothes for sale, and hopefully boost her profits. She hopes to have more capital in the future, which would enable her to run a large business. She also hopes that with the savings from her activity, she will be able to build a house and pay for her children’s tuition until they successfully complete their studies.

Yvette is a member of the Rukundo community group.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of clothes for sale, and make substantial profits

loans.name: Francisca Geneveva

texts.en:
Franscisca is 58 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in the neighborhood of the Las Brisas in the city of Chiclayo. The family has lived in the area for over 25 years. They own their own home.

Out of the front of her home, Franscisca operates a small general store. She has run the store for approximately six years. She has a good presence in the community and a number of loyal clients. She also has the assistance of her children since they are getting older, which allows her to get additional rest and to keep the store open for additional hours.

Franscisca has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase additional merchandise and expand the selection she offers to her clients. In this manner, she hopes to gain additional clients and increase her income. She also hopes to be able to use the opportunity to proviD. her children with a good business lesson.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise and expand the selection she offers to her clients

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima R. is a married woman who lives in Nangka, DAS Village II, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns a living by operating two business ventures: furniture and pig fattening. Her husband Felix R., who is 38 years old, works as a carpenter to earn a living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 5 and 13 years old and are currently going to school. Prima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Prima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for more logs/lumber. With the expected profits, she will continue to save up for the future and renovate their kitchen. Prima R. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the furniture business

loans.name: Dominga Cecilia

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos, la señora llegó a estudiar hasta 5to de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 meses, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar animales.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital para tener mejores ganados.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Communal Bank.  It is located in the Azángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She has a fifth grade education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 18 months.  Her first loan was for 500 soles.  She used the money as working capital for her business of buying and selling small farm animals.

She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles.  She will use the money to buy animals.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital in order to have better livestock.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and the savings.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals

loans.name: Velma Ester

texts.es:
Velma  U. vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 15 años en la Pradera, un barrio al suroccidente de Barranquilla,  donde tiene una tienda llamada El esfuerzo,  que inició  en el año 1999 como una pequeña venta de artículos de la canasta familiar y que gradualmente ha ido creciendo gracias a su disciplina y la capacidad  administrativa innata de Velma. 
En la actualidad está aplicando a sus primer financiamiento, para surtir su negocio con refrescos y  víveres al por mayor, porque a finales de año aumentarán los precios y ella estaría surtida con un buen inventario a un mejor costo y en  la mejor temporada del año. Velma es una mujer de grandes sueños, su principal es  ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales y le gustaría que fueran médicos, por eso se esmera trabajando  persistentemente. Su negocio presenta una rentabilidad actual de 19,35% y espera que al inyectarle el capital de trabajo aumente a un 25%, por efecto de la época de fiestas que se avecina y que usualmente es la temporada donde se incrementan sus ventas,  su capital de trabajo es de  $ 12.956.480 COP, su nivel de endeudamiento es de 28,8% y su rotación de cartera es diaria. Ella augura que su inversión será magnifica en este fin de año y quedará muy bien en el pago de las cuotas mensuales  de su credikiva
texts.en:
Velma U. lives with her spouse and two children of ages 13 and 15 in the Pradera neighborhood located southwest of Barranquilla.  There she has a store called, El Esfuerzo (The Effort), which she started in 99' as a small sale of household items and has gradually grown thanks to her discipline and innate administrative capacity.
She is currently applying for her first loan in order to stock her business with refreshments and wholesale groceries; prices go up towards the end of the year and this way her inventory would be stocked at the best cost and at the best time of the year. Velma is a woman with big dreams, primarily it is to see her kids become professionals; she would like them to be doctors which is why she works so persistently.  Her business presents a 19.35 % profit-earning capacity and hopes that after injecting working capital it increases to 25% as an effect of the holidays that are near; a time when her sales usually increase.  Her working capital is $12,956,480 COP, her level of debt is 28.8 % and her portfolio turnover is daily.  She predicts that her investment will be magnificent this year and will do well in paying the monthly credikiva quotas.

loans.use: surtir su negocio con refrescos y  víveres al por mayor

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 37 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, he sells spare parts for vehicles. He has seven years of experience in this business. He also works as an electrician to earn extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and has been empowered to work hard in his business. He dreams of growing the business so that he may be self-reliant. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy distributors, alternators, and a winding machine.

loans.use: To buy distributors, alternators, and a winding machine.

loans.name: Willium Juma

texts.en:
William has been in the quarrying business in Naivasha town for the past eight years. He is 28 years old and is married to Alice Akinyi. They have one  school-aged child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a member of KADET. This will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of KES 25,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan to pay for manpower and to buy an extraction site.

In the future, William hopes to grow his business and supply building materials to the whole of Naivasha town.

loans.use: to pay for manpower and to buy an extraction site.

loans.name: Sairagul's Group

texts.en:
Sairagul A. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). She is 36 and married. Her husband works at a factory. They have two daughters, both of whom are at school. 

Six years ago, with the initial investment of 5,000 KGS, Sairagul started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock animals after fattening, she earns about $64 per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wants to build a big shed and purchase a vehicle.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Умедчон проживает в районе Яван. Ему 31 год. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Его брат находится на заработках в России. Сам Умедчон занимается растениеводством и садоводством. Рядом с домом имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для покупки семян и саженцев.
texts.en: Umedjon M. lives in the Yavan Region. He is 31 years old. Married, with four children. His parents live with him. His brother is temporarily working in Russia. Umedjon grows vegetables and fruits. He has a land plot near his house, which is where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. He has been doing this work for two years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy seeds and saplings.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and saplings

loans.name: Los Emprendedores I Group

texts.es:
Florencio, es casado, tiene 64 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores, vive en la zona D. Enrique Villa Ochoa, distrito D. los Olivos. Hace 11 meses que integra el grupo “Los emprendedores I”, formado por 8 integrantes, quienes le eligieron presidente del grupo.
Comenzó trabajando vendiendo abarrotes, útiles escolares, en su casa, viendo que había muchos ingresos decidió alquilar un local para la venta D. comida, gracias a ello ahora tiene su propio restaurante, tiene estabilidad económica y otro local  donD. venD. toda tipo D. zapatos. El sueño D. Florencio es que su última hija termine su estudio D. contadora y que sea una profesional.
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en la compra D. mercadería (sandalias, zapatos, zapatillas y ropa) para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Florencio, 64, is married and has three adult children.  He lives in the Enrique Villa Ochoa area, Los Olivos district.  He’s been a member of the “Los Emprendedores I” (Entrepreneurs I) group, which has 8 members that elected him group President, for the last 11 months.  

He started out selling groceries and school supplies in his house.  Seeing that income was good he decided to rent a locale to sell food.  Thanks to this he now owns his own restaurant and has economic stability; he has a second locale where he sells all kinds of shoes.  Florencio’s dream is that his youngest daughter finishes her Accounting studies and becomes a professional.

He will use the requested loan to buy merchandise (sandals, shoes, slippers and clothes) so that his business will grow.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch C. is highly expert at building stone and wooden houses in Kompong Tom province. He has a few laborers to help provide his service. Touch C. often gets a lot of orders from his clients to build houses. He has another partner in his wife who is a rice farmer. Touch C. has five children, two of whom are married and live independently while the other three are single and dependent on him. The couple has three kids who are employed in different jobs. Touch C. is going to use this loan to purchase a piece of land which is in a good location for farming. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.es:
Sara de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un taller de costura y confección, para tener ingresos adicionales vende productos de uso personal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando en el aunque se le ha hecho difícil trabajar debido a que está separada. Su horario de trabajo es de las 15h00pm hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Elabora pijamas, camisas, pantalones etc. Con el préstamo desea comprar telas, botones, hilos.
texts.en:
Sara is 35 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a sewing and dressmaking workshop.  In order to make additional income she sells personal care products such as perfume, creams, deodorants, etc.

Sara has a lot of aspirations for her business and she would like to continue working in it even though it has become difficult for her to work owing to the fact that she is separated.  Sara works from 3.00pm to 10.00pm every day.  She makes pajamas, shirts, pants, etc.  She would like to use her loan money to buy fabric, buttons and threads.

loans.use: to buy fabric and buttons

loans.name: Feliciana Rumiana

texts.es:
Feliciana Rumiana R. M. tiene 47 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Feliciana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una vida mas cómoda y tener dinero para vivir.

Le gusta las fiestas de navidad por que se pasa con la familia.
texts.en:
Feliciana Rumiana R. M. is 47 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and 3 children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUCÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Feliciana is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Feliciana is requesting a loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to enjoy a more comfortable life and have enough money to live on.

Feliciana enjoys the Christmas holidays because she spends them with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals

loans.name: Luis Albert

texts.es: El Sr. Luis y su esposa Ana, Ambos se   dedican  a la atención de una Licorería,   viven en  casa familiar, Ubicadas en la av. tres pasos al frente, tienen una hija de nueve añitos. También percibe renta de su vehículo ya que un chofer lo trabaja de lunes a jueves, el  Viernes, Sábados y Domingos el Sr: Luis lo trabaja el vehículo por que existe mayor movimiento de pasajeros y le genera mayor ingresos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo. Es cliente antiguo de la institución el cual ya demostró buena secuencia de pago, Actualizan su mercadería cada fin de semana realizan sus compras en diferentes mercados y agencias  buscando siempre de menos precios El Sr. Luis, es una persona  que trabaja mucho junto con su esposa, se esfuerzan para salir adelante por el bienestar de su hija y así darles un futuro en condiciones mejores.
texts.en:
Luis and his wife, Ana, work in a liquor store.  They live in the family house on Avenida Tres Pasos Al Frente.  They have a nine year old daughter.  They also receive rent from a vehicle that a driver uses to work on Mondays through Fridays.  Luis uses the vehicle to work on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays because there are more passengers on those days, and it generates greater income.  

He will use the money from the loan for repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.  He has been a long time client of the institution, and he has demonstrated a good course of payment.  He updates his merchandise every week-end.  He makes his purchases at different markets and agencies.  He is always looking for the lowest prices.

Luis is a person who works a lot along with his wife.  They put forth great effort to get ahead and for the well-being of their daughter.  This way they will have a future with better conditions.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Ester

texts.es:
Ester forma parte del banco comunal “Premio al Esfuerzo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Ella tiene un almacén en el cual vende abarrotes, frutas y verduras, está ubicado al interior de su casa. Se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 2 años.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras, donde los precios son a bajo costo y convenientes para el negocio de Ester. Su familia la ayuda en el traslado de mercadería. 
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus productos de abarrotes, frutas y verduras.
Sus sueños son reconstruir su casa, ya que a causa del terremoto del 27 de febrero del año 2010, su vivienda fue destruida, por lo que necesita reparaciones. 
Ester vive junto a su hijo, quién en la actualidad se encuentra hospitalizado debido a un accidente laboral, por lo que Ester debe concurrir diariamente a visitarlo, debido a esto ha postergado la atención de su negocio. 
Ester está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Las reuniones a las cuales participa son muy amenas, por lo que se siente a gusto. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Premio al Esfuerzo Community Bank in the town of Concepción. She runs a store from her house selling groceries, fruit, and vegetables and has had the store for two years. Ester generally buys the merchandise from nearby wholesale supermarkets and distributors where the prices are lower. Her family helps her transport the goods. With the loan Ester plans to buy more merchandise for her store.

Her goal is to own a store in a permanent location from which to sell groceries, fruit, and vegetables. Her dream is to rebuild her house as the February 27, 2010 earthquake caused much damage, and repairs are needed. 

Ester lives with her son who is currently in hospital due to a work accident so she has to visit him every day. As a result her business has suffered.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza since it has enabled her to invest in her business and generate more income. The meetings in which she participates are very enjoyable.

The town of Concepción is located at the mouth of the River Bíobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country, in Bíobio region in southern Chile. The city played an important role in Chilean history, being the home of important battles and a major settlement, particularly during the Arauco War. Concepción lies on the border next to the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development. It is considered to be one of the major urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter B.  is 32 years old. He has been in the entertainment business for close to 6 years now. The father of 4 earns his livelihood working as a master of ceremony at various entertainment functions in and around Namulesa in Jinja. He says he earns 150,000 shillings each week. He says he began working in  a local theatrical group, where he developed his master of ceremony skills. 

Peter also does carpentry and has his own workshop.  With this loan, he says he is going to purchase wood to make more furniture to sell.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa, 31 years old, is a very ambitious woman. She is married to Foad, 35 years old, who got an early retirement from the military for health conditions. After retirement, he started working as a cleaning products distributor to be able to support the family. Since Sanaa has always wanted to have her own business, she decided to start a retail business selling clothes and cosmetics at her house. She has been running her retail business for five years. Now Sanaa has applied for a loan because she felt it was time to expand and open her own store to sell clothes and cosmetics. Since Sanaa is a conservative person, her husband Foad agreed to be in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To open her own clothes and cosmetics retail store

loans.name: Kalagala Prosperity For All Group

texts.en:
Edisa, who is 43 years old, has been overseeing her fresh fruit and vegetable sales enterprise for the last decade in Kayunga.  Edisa is happily married with 4 children. She is one determined and tenacious lady, bent on seeing her business succeed against all odds in her maiden business undertaking.

Edisa sells mostly fresh fruit and vegetables from her farming garden.  She says this business generates her weekly sales profits of about 37,000  shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Moises Arahon

texts.es:
Moisés, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15, 17 y 21 años de edad, él es agricultor, se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol, desde hace 20 años, él trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, y todos los días realiza labores que demanda la agricultura de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes, e insecticidas, estos materiales son para iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol, esta compra le ayudara a tener todos los insumos, dar un cuido adecuado al cultivo y con la esperanza de recibir una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es formar académicamente a sus hijos y a través de su trabajo, también dar el sustento necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Moisés is married and lives with his wife and three children aged 15, 17 and 21.  He is a farmer who has been growing corn and beans for 20 years.  He learned this work from his father and he carries out his farming work every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

Moisés is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides.  He will use these materials when he starts sowing his corn and beans.  This purchase will help him to have available all the supplies he needs.  He will be able to care properly for his crops and hopefully enjoy a good harvest.

Moisés' goal is for his children to receive an education and, through his work, to support his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia tiene 60 años, su actividad es ofrecer el servicio de costura desde hace mas de 43 años que tiene de administrar el negocio, pues desde muy joven en su familia le han enseñado a luchar y a trabajar muy duro para poder mantener a su familia. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el tiempo ya que tiene ciertos encargos que le solicitan y le brindan muy poco tiempo en la entrega, pero aun así sabe cómo trabajar bajo presión. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de telas, zipper, botones, hilos, tijeras y agujas.
texts.en: Nubia is 60 years old, she is a seamstress and has been offering sewing services for more than 43 years. Since her young ages, she was taught by her parents to strive and to work very hard to be able to provide for her family. Even though she is able to work under pressure, time is still one of the main challenges she has to face, as sometimes she is given too little time to complete the orders she receives. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, scissors and needles.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, scissors and needles

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Vincent hails from Kyenjojo District, is married and the father of four children aged between fourteen and four years. The family lives in a semi-permanent house. 
Vincent has run a retail shop  for five years. He acquired his initial capital to set up shop from farming. He is requesting a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell in his shop. 
In the future Vincent dreams of having a wholesale shop and giving his children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Rosa Celia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente es muy amable y cálida, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

La Señora Rosa tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad, todos sus hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa labora en la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para su consumo y si hay sobrantes lo vende, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, gallinas y ganado a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo  va a invertir en la compra de m una vaca. 

Su meta es  llegar a tener más animales para la venta.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Union Progresista", meaning "Progressive Union". She lives in the Parish of Santa Ana. Beautiful scenery can be admired from this Parish and the population is kind and welcoming. They maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors and they are agriculturists and farmers.

Rosa is 28 years old, married, and from her relationship she has conceived 3 children, aged 11, 9 and 6. All of her children attend school in the neighborhood. Her husband works in construction. The house in which they live is their own property.

Rosa works in agriculture and the harvest is for their consumption. If there is produce left over, she sells it. She also raises pigs, poultry, and cattle and she sells them within her community. 

This is the first loan she accesses through her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of a cow.

Her goal is to have more livestock to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Angel Eduardo tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra en el sector La capilla, comunidad cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 25 minutos, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, comercio, construcción y ganadería.

Angel Eduardo se dedica a la agricultura de maiz, cianza de animales y a trabajar de chofer en una camioneta. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda, Guanujo.

Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos, semillas, alimento para los animales. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos la competencia, los precios y daños en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para dedicarse solo a la agricultura. 

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel Eduardo is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar Province.

The members of the communal bank “New Hope” meet in the "Four Corners" neighborhood of La Capilla sector, in the canton of Guaranda, 25 minutes from town.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, commerce, construction, and livestock.

Angel Eduardo works in corn farming, raising animals, and as a truck driver.  He buys and sells his products in the city of Guaranda, Guanujo.
He requests this credit to buy manure, seeds, and feed for the animals.

The loan will help him meet his financial needs and improve his agricultural activities.  He faces challenges like competition, prices, and crop damages.  His dream is to buy land to be able to dedicate himself entirely to farming.

He likes to play sports and enjoy the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and animal feed.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a hardworking 32-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with a five-year-old child. For the last eight years, she has been operating a grocery shop so as to make a living. 

She wants in the next five years to be a supplier of groceries. Her dream is to buy a plot and develop it. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 40-year-old married lady. Hellen is a tailor in Mtwapa, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. 

Hellen has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing another sewing machine. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. 

Her dream is to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Omar Abel

texts.es:
El señor Omar Abel se dedica a la venta de productos varios, como ser: controles para televisor y equipo de sonido, extensiones para electricidad, tomas corrientes, cortaúñas, pasta dental, focos de mano, baterías, prestobarbas, candados, espejos, tijeras, etc, sus ventas las realiza ambulantemente en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, tambien viaja en autobús hasta la frontera de Honduras - El Salvador a vender sus productos, Omar vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos,  dos de ellos van a la escuela de la comunidad.
Omar utilizara el credito para comprar mercaderia y asi tener mas inventario de sus productos, sus clientes son las personas que viajan de El Salvador a Honduras y viceversa.
Su sueño es  tener un lugar estable donde vender sus productos y no tener que viajar día a día.
texts.en:
Señor Omar Abel sells various products such as: controls for televisions and sound systems, electric extensions, sockets, nail clippers, tooth paste, flashlights, batteries, prestobarbas (3-blade razors), locks, mirrors, scissors etc. He is a street vendor in the city of San Lorenzo. He also travels by bus to the Honduras-El Salvador border to sell his products. Omar lives with his wife and 4 children, two of which go to the local school.

Omar will use the loan to buy merchandise and so have a more extensive inventory of products. His customers are people who travel from el Salvador to Honduras and vice versa.

His dream is to have a permanent location to sell his products and not have to travel every day.

loans.use: to buy controls for television and sound equipment, electric extensions, nail clippers, toothpaste, flashlights, batteries, razors, padlocks, mirrors, scissors

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and supports the family taxi business. Erdenebaatar started his business in 2007 by driving a taxi in the city. His daily income is 30,000 MNT and his monthly profit is 400,000 MNT. When his car is clean and tidy, he receives more customers and earns more profit. He is willing to expand his business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "the loan from XacBank will bring huge contribution to my business and to my family." 

Erdenebaatar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to fix his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate his house
